stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ द्युभि॒स्त्वमा॑शुशु॒क्षणि॒स्त्वम॒द्भ्यस्त्वमश्म॑न॒स्परि॑ त्वं वने॑भ्य॒स्त्वमोष॑धीभ्य॒स्त्वं नृ॒णां नृ॑पते जायसे॒ शुचिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne dyúbhis tvám āśuśukṣáṇis tvám adbhyás tvám áśmanas pári tváṃ vánebhyas tvám óṣadhībhyas tváṃ nr̥ṇā́ṃ nr̥pate jāyase śúciḥ
stanzas.translation: THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone: From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art generatad (sic) pure.

translations.griffith: THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone: From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art generatad (sic) pure.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thou, O Agni, the flaming one, (art born) from out the Heavens 2, thou (art born) from out the Waters and the stone (the flint); thou (art born) from out the forests and the herbs; thou art born bright, O Lord of men, (as belonging) to men 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: तवा॑ग्ने हो॒त्रं तव॑ पो॒त्रमृ॒त्वियं॒ तव॑ ने॒ष्ट्रं त्वम॒ग्निदृ॑ताय॒तः तव॑ प्रशा॒स्त्रं त्वम॑ध्वरीयसि ब्र॒ह्मा चासि॑ गृ॒हप॑तिश्च नो॒ दमे॑
stanzas.transliteration: távāgne hotráṃ táva potrám r̥tvíyaṃ táva neṣṭráṃ tvám agníd r̥tāyatáḥ táva praśāstráṃ tvám adhvarīyasi brahmā́ cā́si gr̥hápatiś ca no dáme
stanzas.translation: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man. Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

translations.griffith: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man. Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.
translations.oldenberg: 1 To thee, O Agni, belongs the Hotri's and the Potri's office exercised at the appointed season; to thee belongs the office of the Neshtri; thou art the Agnîdh 2 for the righteous. To thee belongs the office of the Prasâstri; thou actest as an Adhvaryu, and thou art the Brahman and the master of the house in our house 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्न॒ इन्द्रो॑ वृष॒भः स॒ताम॑सि॒ त्वं विष्णु॑रुरुगा॒यो न॑म॒स्यः॑ त्वं ब्र॒ह्मा र॑यि॒विद्ब्र॑ह्मणस्पते॒ त्वं वि॑धर्तः सचसे॒ पुरं॑ध्या
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agna índro vr̥ṣabháḥ satā́m asi tváṃ víṣṇur urugāyó namasyàḥ tvám brahmā́ rayivíd brahmaṇas pate tváṃ vidhartaḥ sacase púraṃdhyā
stanzas.translation: Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Vishṇu of the Mighty Stride, adorable: Thou, Brahmaṇaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.

translations.griffith: Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Vishṇu of the Mighty Stride, adorable: Thou, Brahmaṇaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thou, O Agni, art Indra, a bull among (all) beings. Thou art the wide-ruling Vishnu, worthy of adoration. Thou art the Brahman, a gainer of wealth, O Brahmanaspati 2. Thou, O Vidhartri (i. e. who keepest asunder all things), art united with Puramdhi (or the Liberality of the gods) 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णो धृ॒तव्र॑त॒स्त्वं मि॒त्रो भ॑वसि द॒स्म ईड्यः॑ त्वम॑र्य॒मा सत्प॑ति॒र्यस्य॑ स॒म्भुजं॒ त्वमंशो॑ वि॒दथे॑ देव भाज॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne rā́jā váruṇo dhr̥távratas tvám mitró bhavasi dasmá ī́ḍyaḥ tvám aryamā́ sátpatir yásya sambhújaṃ tvám áṃśo vidáthe deva bhājayúḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, thou art King Varuṇa whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored. Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enrich ing all, and liberal Anṣa in the synod, O thou God.

translations.griffith: Agni, thou art King Varuṇa whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored. Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enrich ing all, and liberal Anṣa in the synod, O thou God.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, art the king Varuna whose laws are firm; thou becomest Mitra, the wondrous one, worthy of being magnified. Thou art Aryaman, the lord of beings, whom I may enjoy 1. Thou, O god, art Amsa 2, desirous of distributing (goods) in the assembly 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ त्वष्टा॑ विध॒ते सु॒वीर्यं॒ तव॒ ग्नावो॑ मित्रमहः सजा॒त्य॑म् त्वमा॑शु॒हेमा॑ ररिषे॒ स्वश्व्यं॒ त्वं न॒रां शर्धो॑ असि पुरू॒वसुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne tváṣṭā vidhaté suvī́ryaṃ táva gnā́vo mitramahaḥ sajātyàm tvám āśuhémā rariṣe sváśvyaṃ tváṃ narā́ṃ śárdho asi purūvásuḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou givest strength, as Tvashṭar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames. Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.

translations.griffith: Thou givest strength, as Tvashṭar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames. Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, being Tvashtri, (grantest) to thy worshipper abundance in heroes. To thee, who art accompanied by the (divine) wives 1, who art great like Mitra, belongs relationship 2. Thou, the quick inciter 3, givest abundance in horses. Thou, rich in wealth, art the host of men 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने रु॒द्रो असु॑रो म॒हो दि॒वस्त्वं शर्धो॒ मारु॑तं पृ॒क्ष ई॑शिषे त्वं वातै॑ररु॒णैर्या॑सि शंग॒यस्त्वं पू॒षा वि॑ध॒तः पा॑सि॒ नु त्मना॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne rudró ásuro mahó divás tváṃ śárdho mā́rutam pr̥kṣá īśiṣe tváṃ vā́tair aruṇaír yāsi śaṃgayás tvám pūṣā́ vidhatáḥ pāsi nú tmánā
stanzas.translation: Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts' host, thou art the Lord of food, Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pûshan thou thyself protectest worshippers.

translations.griffith: Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts' host, thou art the Lord of food, Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pûshan thou thyself protectest worshippers.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, art Rudra, the Asura of the high Heaven 1; thou, being the host of the Maruts, rulest over nourishment. Thou goest along with the flame-coloured Winds, bringing happiness to our home. Thou, being Pûshan, protectest thy worshippers by thy own might.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने द्रविणो॒दा अ॑रं॒कृते॒ त्वं दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता र॑त्न॒धा अ॑सि त्वं भगो॑ नृपते॒ वस्व॑ ईशिषे॒ त्वं पा॒युर्दमे॒ यस्तेऽवि॑धत्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne draviṇodā́ araṃkŕ̥te tváṃ deváḥ savitā́ ratnadhā́ asi tvám bhágo nr̥pate vásva īśiṣe tvám pāyúr dáme yás té 'vidhat
stanzas.translation: Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things. As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.

translations.griffith: Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things. As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, art a giver of wealth to him who does service to thee 1; thou art the god Savitri, a bestower of treasures. Thou, being Bhaga, O lord of men, rulest over wealth. Thou art a protector in his house to him who has worshipped thee. 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ दम॒ आ वि॒श्पतिं॒ विश॒स्त्वां राजा॑नं सुवि॒दत्र॑मृञ्जते त्वं विश्वा॑नि स्वनीक पत्यसे॒ त्वं स॒हस्रा॑णि श॒ता दश॒ प्रति॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne dáma ā́ viśpátiṃ víśas tvā́ṃ rā́jānaṃ suvidátram r̥ñjate tváṃ víśvāni svanīka patyase tváṃ sahásrāṇi śatā́ dáśa práti
stanzas.translation: To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined. Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.

translations.griffith: To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined. Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.
translations.oldenberg: Towards thee, in the house, the lord of the clan, O Agni, the clans strive, towards thee, the bounteous king. Thou with the beautiful face possessest all things. Thou art equal to thousands, to hundreds, to ten (of others).

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने पि॒तर॑मि॒ष्टिभि॒र्नर॒स्त्वां भ्रा॒त्राय॒ शम्या॑ तनू॒रुच॑म् त्वं पु॒त्रो भ॑वसि॒ यस्तेऽवि॑ध॒त्त्वं सखा॑ सु॒शेवः॑ पास्या॒धृषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne pitáram iṣṭíbhir náras tvā́m bhrātrā́ya śámyā tanūrúcam tvám putró bhavasi yás té 'vidhat tváṃ sákhā suśévaḥ pāsy ādhŕ̥ṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act. Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.

translations.griffith: Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act. Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, men (make) their father by their sacrifices 1; thee who shinest with thy body they (invite) to brotherhood by their (sacrificial) work. Thou becomest a son to him who has worshipped thee. As a kind friend thou protectest against attack.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्न ऋ॒भुरा॒के न॑म॒स्य१॒॑स्त्वं वाज॑स्य क्षु॒मतो॑ रा॒य ई॑शिषे त्वं वि भा॒स्यनु॑ दक्षि दा॒वने॒ त्वं वि॒शिक्षु॑रसि य॒ज्ञमा॒तनिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agna r̥bhúr āké namasyàs tváṃ vā́jasya kṣumáto rāyá īśiṣe tváṃ ví bhāsy ánu dakṣi dāváne tváṃ viśíkṣur asi yajñám ātániḥ
stanzas.translation: A R̥ibhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth. Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.

translations.griffith: A R̥ibhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth. Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, art Ribhu, to be adored when near. Thou rulest over strength 1, over wealth rich in food. Thou shinest 2, thou burnest for the sake of giving (wealth). Thou art a hewer 3, an expander of sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ अदि॑तिर्देव दा॒शुषे॒ त्वं होत्रा॒ भार॑ती वर्धसे गि॒रा त्वमिळा॑ श॒तहि॑मासि॒ दक्ष॑से॒ त्वं वृ॑त्र॒हा व॑सुपते॒ सर॑स्वती
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne áditir deva dāśúṣe tváṃ hótrā bhā́ratī vardhase girā́ tvám íḷā śatáhimāsi dákṣase tváṃ vr̥trahā́ vasupate sárasvatī
stanzas.translation: Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotrâ Bhâratî, art strengthened by the song. Thou art the hundred-wintered Iḷâ to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vr̥itra-slayer and Sarasvatî.

translations.griffith: Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotrâ Bhâratî, art strengthened by the song. Thou art the hundred-wintered Iḷâ to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vr̥itra-slayer and Sarasvatî.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, Agni, O god, art Aditi to the worshipper. Thou, being Hotrâ Bhâratî 1, growest strong by prayer. Thou art Idâ, living a hundred winters, for (the increase of) ability. Thou, the killer of Vritra, O Lord of wealth, art Sarasvatî 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ सुभृ॑त उत्त॒मं वय॒स्तव॑ स्पा॒र्हे वर्ण॒ आ सं॒दृशि॒ श्रियः॑ त्वं वाजः॑ प्र॒तर॑णो बृ॒हन्न॑सि॒ त्वं र॒यिर्ब॑हु॒लो वि॒श्वत॑स्पृ॒थुः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne súbhr̥ta uttamáṃ váyas táva spārhé várṇa ā́ saṃdŕ̥śi śríyaḥ tváṃ vā́jaḥ pratáraṇo br̥hánn asi tváṃ rayír bahuló viśvátas pr̥thúḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible. Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible. Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, well kept, art the highest vital power. In thy lovely colour and in thy appearance (dwell all) beauties. Thou art great strength that carries us forward. Thou art abundant wealth, extending on all sides.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्न आदि॒त्यास॑ आ॒स्यं१॒॑ त्वां जि॒ह्वां शुच॑यश्चक्रिरे कवे त्वां रा॑ति॒षाचो॑ अध्व॒रेषु॑ सश्चिरे॒ त्वे दे॒वा ह॒विर॑द॒न्त्याहु॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agna ādityā́sa āsyàṃ tvā́ṃ jihvā́ṃ śúcayaś cakrire kave tvā́ṃ rātiṣā́co adhvaréṣu saścire tvé devā́ havír adanty ā́hutam
stanzas.translation: Thee, Agni, have the Âdityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue. They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, have the Âdityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue. They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.
translations.oldenberg: The Âdityas have made thee, O Agni, their mouth; the bright ones have made thee their tongue, O Sage. The Râti-sâk gods (i. e. the 'bounteous' gods) accompany thee at the sacrifices. In thee the gods eat the offering which is offered to them.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे अ॑ग्ने॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॑सो अ॒द्रुह॑ आ॒सा दे॒वा ह॒विर॑द॒न्त्याहु॑तम् त्वया॒ मर्ता॑सः स्वदन्त आसु॒तिं त्वं गर्भो॑ वी॒रुधां॑ जज्ञिषे॒ शुचिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvé agne víśve amŕ̥tāso adrúhaḥ- āsā́ devā́ havír adanty ā́hutam tváyā mártāsaḥ svadanta āsutíṃ tváṃ gárbho vīrúdhāṃ jajñiṣe śúciḥ
stanzas.translation: By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them. By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.

translations.griffith: By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them. By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.
translations.oldenberg: In thee, O Agni, with (thy) mouth 1 all the guileless 2 immortal gods eat the offering which is offered to them. Through thee the mortals taste their drink. Thou hast been born, the bright one, as the child of the plants.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं तान्त्सं च॒ प्रति॑ चासि म॒ज्मनाग्ने॑ सुजात॒ प्र च॑ देव रिच्यसे पृ॒क्षो यदत्र॑ महि॒ना वि ते॒ भुव॒दनु॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी रोद॑सी उ॒भे
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ tā́n sáṃ ca práti cāsi majmánā- -ágne sujāta prá ca deva ricyase pr̥kṣó yád átra mahinā́ ví te bhúvad ánu dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ródasī ubhé
stanzas.translation: With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty, Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty, Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thou art united with them and equal to them in strength, O well-born Agni, nay, thou surpassest them, O god, when thy power 2 has expanded here in its greatness over Heaven and Earth, over both worlds.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ गोअ॑ग्रा॒मश्व॑पेशस॒मग्ने॑ रा॒तिमु॑पसृ॒जन्ति॑ सू॒रयः॑ अ॒स्माञ्च॒ ताँश्च॒ प्र हि नेषि॒ वस्य॒ आ बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé stotŕ̥bhyo góagrām áśvapeśasam ágne rātím upasr̥jánti sūráyaḥ asmā́ñ ca tā́ṃś ca prá hí néṣi vásya ā́ br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,– Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

translations.griffith: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,– Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.
translations.oldenberg: The liberal lords who pour out, O Agni, over thy praisers gifts at the head of which there are cows 1, the ornament of which are horses: lead both ourselves and them to welfare. May we speak loud in the assembly 2, rich in valiant men.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञेन॑ वर्धत जा॒तवे॑दसम॒ग्निं य॑जध्वं ह॒विषा॒ तना॑ गि॒रा स॒मि॒धा॒नं सु॑प्र॒यसं॒ स्व॑र्णरं द्यु॒क्षं होता॑रं वृ॒जने॑षु धू॒र्षद॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yajñéna vardhata jātávedasam agníṃ yajadhvaṃ havíṣā tánā girā́ samidhānáṃ suprayásaṃ svàrṇaraṃ dyukṣáṃ hótāraṃ vr̥jáneṣu dhūrṣádam
stanzas.translation: WITH sacrifice exalt Agni who knows all life; worship him 'with oblation and the song of praise, Well kindled, nobly fed; heaven's Lord, Celestial Priest, who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done.

translations.griffith: WITH sacrifice exalt Agni who knows all life; worship him 'with oblation and the song of praise, Well kindled, nobly fed; heaven's Lord, Celestial Priest, who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done.
translations.oldenberg: Increase Gâtavedas by your sacrifice 1, worship Agni for ever with your offering and your prayer 2—him who has been kindled, the receiver of good offerings, the solar hero, the heavenly Hotri, the charioteer 3 in our settlements 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि त्वा॒ नक्ती॑रु॒षसो॑ ववाशि॒रेऽग्ने॑ व॒त्सं न स्वस॑रेषु धे॒नवः॑ दि॒व इ॒वेद॑र॒तिर्मानु॑षा यु॒गा क्षपो॑ भासि पुरुवार सं॒यतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: abhí tvā náktīr uṣáso vavāśire- -ágne vatsáṃ ná svásareṣu dhenávaḥ divá ivéd aratír mā́nuṣā yugā́ kṣápo bhāsi puruvāra saṃyátaḥ
stanzas.translation: At night and morning, Agni, have they called to thee, like milch-kine in their stalls lowing to meet their young. As messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men. Thou Lord of precious boons.

translations.griffith: At night and morning, Agni, have they called to thee, like milch-kine in their stalls lowing to meet their young. As messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men. Thou Lord of precious boons.
translations.oldenberg: For thee Nights and Dawns have been lowing, O Agni, as milch-cows in the folds for their calf 1. A steward 2, as it were, of Heaven, thou shinest on the human tribes, O bountiful one, on continuous nights 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं दे॒वा बु॒ध्ने रज॑सः सु॒दंस॑सं दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्योर॑र॒तिं न्ये॑रिरे रथ॑मिव॒ वेद्यं॑ शु॒क्रशो॑चिषम॒ग्निं मि॒त्रं न क्षि॒तिषु॑ प्र॒शंस्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ devā́ budhné rájasaḥ sudáṃsasaṃ diváspr̥thivyór aratíṃ ny èrire rátham iva védyaṃ śukráśociṣam agním mitráṃ ná kṣitíṣu praśáṃsyam
stanzas.translation: Him have the Gods established at the region's base, doer of wondrous deeds, Herald of heaven and earth; Like a most famous car, Agni the purely bright, like Mitra. to be glorified among the folk.

translations.griffith: Him have the Gods established at the region's base, doer of wondrous deeds, Herald of heaven and earth; Like a most famous car, Agni the purely bright, like Mitra. to be glorified among the folk.
translations.oldenberg: The gods have set him to work, as a steward 1 of Heaven and Earth, endowed with wonderful power, at the bottom of the air: Agni who is well known like a chariot 2, brightly shining, deserving of praise like Mitra (or, like a friend) in (human) dwellings.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॒क्षमा॑णं॒ रज॑सि॒ स्व आ दमे॑ च॒न्द्रमि॑व सु॒रुचं॑ ह्वा॒र आ द॑धुः पृश्न्याः॑ पत॒रं चि॒तय॑न्तम॒क्षभिः॑ पा॒थो न पा॒युं जन॑सी उ॒भे अनु॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám ukṣámāṇaṃ rájasi svá ā́ dáme candrám iva surúcaṃ hvārá ā́ dadhuḥ pŕ̥śnyāḥ pataráṃ citáyantam akṣábhiḥ pāthó ná pāyúṃ jánasī ubhé ánu
stanzas.translation: Him have they set in his own dwelling, in the vault, like the Moon waxing, fulgent, in the realm of air. Bird of the firmament, observant with his eyes, guard of the place as 'twere, looking to Gods and men.

translations.griffith: Him have they set in his own dwelling, in the vault, like the Moon waxing, fulgent, in the realm of air. Bird of the firmament, observant with his eyes, guard of the place as 'twere, looking to Gods and men.
translations.oldenberg: They have established him who grows in the air, in his house, the serpent 1 with beautiful splendour like gold 2, the winged (son?) of Prisni 3 who lights up with his eyes both tribes (of gods and of men), like a guardian of the way (?) 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: स होता॒ विश्वं॒ परि॑ भूत्वध्व॒रं तमु॑ ह॒व्यैर्मनु॑ष ऋञ्जते गि॒रा हि॒रि॒शि॒प्रो वृ॑धसा॒नासु॒ जर्भु॑र॒द्द्यौर्न स्तृभि॑श्चितय॒द्रोद॑सी॒ अनु॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá hótā víśvam pári bhūtv adhvaráṃ tám u havyaír mánuṣa r̥ñjate girā́ hiriśipró vr̥dhasānā́su járbhurad dyaúr ná stŕ̥bhiś citayad ródasī ánu
stanzas.translation: May he as Priest encompass all the sacrifice. men throng to him with offerings and with hymns of praise. Raging with jaws of gold among the growing plants, like heaven with all the stars, he quickens earth and sky.

translations.griffith: May he as Priest encompass all the sacrifice. men throng to him with offerings and with hymns of praise. Raging with jaws of gold among the growing plants, like heaven with all the stars, he quickens earth and sky.
translations.oldenberg: May he, the Hotri, encompass the whole sacrifice. Men strive towards him with offerings and prayer. (Agni) with golden jaws 1, hurrying around in the growing (plants) 2, lighted up the two worlds like the Sky with the stars.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ रे॒वत्स॑मिधा॒नः स्व॒स्तये॑ संदद॒स्वान्र॒यिम॒स्मासु॑ दीदिहि आ नः॑ कृणुष्व सुवि॒ताय॒ रोद॑सी॒ अग्ने॑ ह॒व्या मनु॑षो देव वी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá no revát samidhānáḥ svastáye saṃdadasvā́n rayím asmā́su dīdihi ā́ naḥ kr̥ṇuṣva suvitā́ya ródasī ágne havyā́ mánuṣo deva vītáye
stanzas.translation: Such as thou art, brilliantly kindled for our weal, a liberal giver, send us riches in thy shine, For our advantage, Agni, God, bring Heaven and Earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man.

translations.griffith: Such as thou art, brilliantly kindled for our weal, a liberal giver, send us riches in thy shine, For our advantage, Agni, God, bring Heaven and Earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man.
translations.oldenberg: Thus mayst thou, being brightly kindled for our welfare or being exhausted (?) 1, shine upon us with thy wealth. Carry hither to us the two worlds for the sake of happiness, Agni, O god, that they may eagerly partake 2 of the offering of the man (or, of Manus).

stanzas.sanskrit: दा नो॑ अग्ने बृह॒तो दाः स॑ह॒स्रिणो॑ दु॒रो न वाजं॒ श्रुत्या॒ अपा॑ वृधि प्राची॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ब्रह्म॑णा कृधि॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रमु॒षसो॒ वि दि॑द्युतः
stanzas.transliteration: dā́ no agne br̥ható dā́ḥ sahasríṇo duró ná vā́jaṃ śrútyā ápā vr̥dhi prā́cī dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bráhmaṇā kr̥dhi svàr ṇá śukrám uṣáso ví didyutaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, give us great wealth, give riches thousandfold. unclose to us, like doors, strength that shall bring renown. Make Heaven and Earth propitious through the power of prayer, and like the sky's bright sheen let mornings beam on us.

translations.griffith: Agni, give us great wealth, give riches thousandfold. unclose to us, like doors, strength that shall bring renown. Make Heaven and Earth propitious through the power of prayer, and like the sky's bright sheen let mornings beam on us.
translations.oldenberg: Give us, Agni, mighty, give us thousandfold (gifts). Open strength for us like a door 1 for the sake of glory. Make Heaven and Earth inclined towards us through (our) spell. Make the Dawns shine like the brilliant Sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इ॑धा॒न उ॒षसो॒ राम्या॒ अनु॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण दी॑देदरु॒षेण॑ भा॒नुना॑ होत्रा॑भिर॒ग्निर्मनु॑षः स्वध्व॒रो राजा॑ वि॒शामति॑थि॒श्चारु॑रा॒यवे॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá idhāná uṣáso rā́myā ánu svàr ṇá dīded aruṣéṇa bhānúnā hótrābhir agnír mánuṣaḥ svadhvaró rā́jā viśā́m átithiś cā́rur āyáve
stanzas.translation: Enkindled night by night at every morning's dawn, may he shine forth with red flame like the realm of light,– Agni adored in beauteous rites with lauds of men, fair guest of living man and King of all our folk.

translations.griffith: Enkindled night by night at every morning's dawn, may he shine forth with red flame like the realm of light,– Agni adored in beauteous rites with lauds of men, fair guest of living man and King of all our folk.
translations.oldenberg: Being kindled after dawns and nights may he shine with his red light like the sun, Agni, being a good sacrificer with the help of the offerings of man (or, of Manus) 1, the king of the clans, and the welcome guest of Âyu.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा नो॑ अग्ने अ॒मृते॑षु पूर्व्य॒ धीष्पी॑पाय बृ॒हद्दि॑वेषु॒ मानु॑षा दुहा॑ना धे॒नुर्वृ॒जने॑षु का॒रवे॒ त्मना॑ श॒तिनं॑ पुरु॒रूप॑मि॒षणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ no agne amŕ̥teṣu pūrvya dhī́ṣ pīpāya br̥háddiveṣu mā́nuṣā dúhānā dhenúr vr̥jáneṣu kāráve tmánā śatínam pururū́pam iṣáṇi
stanzas.translation: Song chanted by us men, O Agni, Ancient One, has swelled unto the deathless Gods in lofty heaven- A milch-cow yielding to the singer in the rites wealth manifold, in hundreds, even as he wills.

translations.griffith: Song chanted by us men, O Agni, Ancient One, has swelled unto the deathless Gods in lofty heaven- A milch-cow yielding to the singer in the rites wealth manifold, in hundreds, even as he wills.
translations.oldenberg: Thus, O Agni, ancient one, our human prayer has prospered among the immortals who dwell in the great heaven. May the cow 1 when milked, yield 2 freely to the singer in our settlements hundredfold (wealth) of all kinds.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यम॑ग्ने॒ अर्व॑ता वा सु॒वीर्यं॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वा चितयेमा॒ जनाँ॒ अति॑ अ॒स्माकं॑ द्यु॒म्नमधि॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टिषू॒च्चा स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॑शुचीत दु॒ष्टर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vayám agne árvatā vā suvī́ryam bráhmaṇā vā citayemā jánām̐ áti asmā́kaṃ dyumnám ádhi páñca kr̥ṣṭíṣu- -uccā́ svàr ṇá śuśucīta duṣṭáram
stanzas.translation: Agni, may we show forth our valour with the steed or with the power of prayer beyond all other men; And over the Five Races let our glory shine high like the realm of light and unsurpassable.

translations.griffith: Agni, may we show forth our valour with the steed or with the power of prayer beyond all other men; And over the Five Races let our glory shine high like the realm of light and unsurpassable.
translations.oldenberg: May we, O Agni, (attain) bliss in valiant men by our racers, or may we shine over (all) people by our sacred spells. May our unconquerable lustre beam on high like the sun over the fivefold dwellings (of the five peoples).

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ बोधि सहस्य प्र॒शंस्यो॒ यस्मि॑न्त्सुजा॒ता इ॒षय॑न्त सू॒रयः॑ यम॑ग्ने य॒ज्ञमु॑प॒यन्ति॑ वा॒जिनो॒ नित्ये॑ तो॒के दी॑दि॒वांसं॒ स्वे दमे॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá no bodhi sahasya praśáṃsyo yásmin sujātā́ iṣáyanta sūráyaḥ yám agne yajñám upayánti vājíno nítye toké dīdivā́ṃsaṃ své dáme
stanzas.translation: Such, Conqueror! be to us, be worthy of our praise, thou for whom princes nobly born exert themselves; Whose sacrifice the strong seek, Agni, when it shines for never-failing offspring in thine own abode.

translations.griffith: Such, Conqueror! be to us, be worthy of our praise, thou for whom princes nobly born exert themselves; Whose sacrifice the strong seek, Agni, when it shines for never-failing offspring in thine own abode.
translations.oldenberg: Be thou, O mighty one, worthy of praise among us, (thou) from whom the well-born, liberal (lords) have sought nourishment 1, unto whom the strong ones, O Agni, go for sacrifice, who shinest in thy abode among (the worshipper's) own kith.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒भया॑सो जातवेदः स्याम ते स्तो॒तारो॑ अग्ने सू॒रय॑श्च॒ शर्म॑णि वस्वो॑ रा॒यः पु॑रुश्च॒न्द्रस्य॒ भूय॑सः प्र॒जाव॑तः स्वप॒त्यस्य॑ शग्धि नः
stanzas.transliteration: ubháyāso jātavedaḥ syāma te stotā́ro agne sūráyaś ca śármaṇi vásvo rāyáḥ puruścandrásya bhū́yasaḥ prajā́vataḥ svapatyásya śagdhi naḥ
stanzas.translation: Knower of all that lives, O Agni may we both, singers of praise and chiefs, be in thy keeping still. Help us to wealth exceeding good and glorious, abundant, rich in children and their progeny.

translations.griffith: Knower of all that lives, O Agni may we both, singers of praise and chiefs, be in thy keeping still. Help us to wealth exceeding good and glorious, abundant, rich in children and their progeny.
translations.oldenberg: May we both, O Gâtavedas, the praisers and the liberal (lords), be in thy protection, O Agni. Help us to good, resplendent, abundant wealth which is accompanied by offspring, by good progeny.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ गोअ॑ग्रा॒मश्व॑पेशस॒मग्ने॑ रा॒तिमु॑पसृ॒जन्ति॑ सू॒रयः॑ अ॒स्माञ्च॒ ताँश्च॒ प्र हि नेषि॒ वस्य॒ आ बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé stotŕ̥bhyo góagrām áśvapeśasam ágne rātím upasr̥jánti sūráyaḥ asmā́ñ ca tā́ṃś ca prá hí néṣi vásya ā́ br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon, graced with kine and steeds,– Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

translations.griffith: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon, graced with kine and steeds,– Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धो अ॒ग्निर्निहि॑तः पृथि॒व्यां प्र॒त्यङ्विश्वा॑नि॒ भुव॑नान्यस्थात् होता॑ पाव॒कः प्र॒दिवः॑ सुमे॒धा दे॒वो दे॒वान्य॑जत्व॒ग्निरर्ह॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddho agnír níhitaḥ pr̥thivyā́m pratyáṅ víśvāni bhúvanāny asthāt hótā pāvakáḥ pradívaḥ sumedhā́ḥ- devó devā́n yajatv agnír árhan
stanzas.translation: AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings. Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.

translations.griffith: AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings. Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.
translations.oldenberg: Agni being kindled, set down on the earth, has stood up with his face towards all worlds. May the Hotri, the purifier, the ancient, wise one, may god Agni sacrifice to the gods, he who is worthy (of being the sacrificer).

stanzas.sanskrit: नरा॒शंसः॒ प्रति॒ धामा॑न्य॒ञ्जन्ति॒स्रो दिवः॒ प्रति॑ म॒ह्ना स्व॒र्चिः घृ॒त॒प्रुषा॒ मन॑सा ह॒व्यमु॒न्दन्मू॒र्धन्य॒ज्ञस्य॒ सम॑नक्तु दे॒वान्
stanzas.transliteration: nárāśáṃsaḥ práti dhā́māny añján tisró dívaḥ práti mahnā́ svarcíḥ ghr̥taprúṣā mánasā havyám undán mūrdhán yajñásya sám anaktu devā́n
stanzas.translation: May Narâṣansa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven, Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.

translations.griffith: May Narâṣansa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven, Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.
translations.oldenberg: Narâsamsa, anointing the abodes (of the sacrifice), equal by his greatness to the three heavens, endowed with beautiful light, moistening the offering, his mind being intent on scattering ghrita—may he anoint the gods on the summit of sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: ई॒ळि॒तो अ॑ग्ने॒ मन॑सा नो॒ अर्ह॑न्दे॒वान्य॑क्षि॒ मानु॑षा॒त्पूर्वो॑ अ॒द्य स आ व॑ह म॒रुतां॒ शर्धो॒ अच्यु॑त॒मिन्द्रं॑ नरो बर्हि॒षदं॑ यजध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: īḷitó agne mánasā no árhan devā́n yakṣi mā́nuṣāt pū́rvo adyá sá ā́ vaha marútāṃ śárdho ácyutam índraṃ naro barhiṣádaṃ yajadhvam
stanzas.translation: Adored in heart, as is thy right, O Agni, serve the Gods first to-day before the mortal. Bring thou the Marut host. Ye men do worship to Indra seated on the grass, eternal.

translations.griffith: Adored in heart, as is thy right, O Agni, serve the Gods first to-day before the mortal. Bring thou the Marut host. Ye men do worship to Indra seated on the grass, eternal.
translations.oldenberg: Being magnified 1 in our mind, Agni, sacrifice for us to-day to the gods before the human (sacrificer) 2, thou who art worthy (of being the sacrificer). Conduct hither the unshakable host of the Maruts. Sacrifice, O men, to Indra who sits on the Barhis.

stanzas.sanskrit: देव॑ बर्हि॒र्वर्ध॑मानं सु॒वीरं॑ स्ती॒र्णं रा॒ये सु॒भरं॒ वेद्य॒स्याम् घृ॒तेना॒क्तं व॑सवः सीदते॒दं विश्वे॑ देवा आदित्या य॒ज्ञिया॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: déva barhir várdhamānaṃ suvī́raṃ stīrṇáṃ rāyé subháraṃ védy asyā́m ghr̥ténāktáṃ vasavaḥ sīdatedáṃ víśve devā ādityā yajñíyāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Grass divine, increasing, rich in heroes, strewn for wealth' sake, well laid upon this altar,– On this bedewed with oil sit ye, O Vasus, sit all ye Gods, ye Holy, ye Âdityas.

translations.griffith: O Grass divine, increasing, rich in heroes, strewn for wealth' sake, well laid upon this altar,– On this bedewed with oil sit ye, O Vasus, sit all ye Gods, ye Holy, ye Âdityas.
translations.oldenberg: O divine Barhis! On this (Barhis) which is large, rich in valiant men, which has been spread on this Vedi (or sacrificial altar) rich in gain, ready for wealth, which is anointed with ghrita, sit down, O Vasus, O Visve devâs, O Âdityas 1 worthy of worship!

stanzas.sanskrit: वि श्र॑यन्तामुर्वि॒या हू॒यमा॑ना॒ द्वारो॑ दे॒वीः सु॑प्राय॒णा नमो॑भिः व्यच॑स्वती॒र्वि प्र॑थन्तामजु॒र्या वर्णं॑ पुना॒ना य॒शसं॑ सु॒वीर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ví śrayantām urviyā́ hūyámānāḥ- dvā́ro devī́ḥ suprāyaṇā́ námobhiḥ vyácasvatīr ví prathantām ajuryā́ḥ- várṇam punānā́ yaśásaṃ suvī́ram
stanzas.translation: Wide be the Doors, the Goddesses, thrown open, easy to pass, invoked, through adorations, Let them unfold, expansive, everlasting, that sanctify the class famed, rich in heroes.

translations.griffith: Wide be the Doors, the Goddesses, thrown open, easy to pass, invoked, through adorations, Let them unfold, expansive, everlasting, that sanctify the class famed, rich in heroes.
translations.oldenberg: May the divine doors which are easily passable, open themselves wide when invoked with adoration. May they, the far-embracing, undecaying ones, open wide, purifying our glorious race 1 which is rich in valiant men.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा॒ध्वपां॑सि स॒नता॑ न उक्षि॒ते उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ व॒य्ये॑व रण्वि॒ते तन्तुं॑ त॒तं सं॒वय॑न्ती समी॒ची य॒ज्ञस्य॒ पेशः॑ सु॒दुघे॒ पय॑स्वती
stanzas.transliteration: sādhv ápāṃsi sanátā na ukṣité uṣā́sānáktā vayyèva raṇvité tántuṃ tatáṃ saṃváyantī samīcī́ yajñásya péśaḥ sudúghe páyasvatī
stanzas.translation: Good work for us, the glorious Night and Morning, like female weavers, waxen from aforetime, Yielders of rich milk, interweave in concert the long-extended thread, the web of worship.

translations.griffith: Good work for us, the glorious Night and Morning, like female weavers, waxen from aforetime, Yielders of rich milk, interweave in concert the long-extended thread, the web of worship.
translations.oldenberg: May Dawn and Night, grown strong from of old, joyful like two birds (?) 1, (do) their work well for us—they who weave, turned towards each other, the stretched-out warp, the ornamented form of the sacrifice 2, (the two goddesses) flowing with plenty, rich in milk.

stanzas.sanskrit: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा वि॒दुष्ट॑र ऋ॒जु य॑क्षतः॒ समृ॒चा व॒पुष्ट॑रा दे॒वान्यज॑न्तावृतु॒था सम॑ञ्जतो॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॒ सानु॑षु त्रि॒षु
stanzas.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ vidúṣṭarā- r̥jú yakṣataḥ sám r̥cā́ vapúṣṭarā devā́n yájantāv r̥tuthā́ sám añjato nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ ádhi sā́nuṣu triṣú
stanzas.translation: Let the two heavenly Heralds, first, most wise, most fair, present oblation duly with the sacred verse, Worshipping God at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.

translations.griffith: Let the two heavenly Heralds, first, most wise, most fair, present oblation duly with the sacred verse, Worshipping God at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.
translations.oldenberg: May the two divine Hotris, the first ones, very knowing, very marvellous, perform the sacrifice rightly with their (sacrificial) verse. Sacrificing to the gods they anoint (them) 1, observing the right time, on the navel of the Earth, over the three ridges (of the three worlds).

stanzas.sanskrit: सर॑स्वती सा॒धय॑न्ती॒ धियं॑ न॒ इळा॑ दे॒वी भार॑ती वि॒श्वतू॑र्तिः ति॒स्रो दे॒वीः स्व॒धया॑ ब॒र्हिरेदमच्छि॑द्रं पान्तु शर॒णं नि॒षद्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: sárasvatī sādháyantī dhíyaṃ naḥ- íḷā devī́ bhā́ratī viśvátūrtiḥ tisró devī́ḥ svadháyā barhír édám áchidram pāntu śaraṇáṃ niṣádya
stanzas.translation: Sarasvatî who perfects our devotion, Iḷâ divine, Bhâratî all surpassing,– Three Goddesses, with power inherent, seated, protect this holy Grass, our flawless refuge!

translations.griffith: Sarasvatî who perfects our devotion, Iḷâ divine, Bhâratî all surpassing,– Three Goddesses, with power inherent, seated, protect this holy Grass, our flawless refuge!
translations.oldenberg: May Sarasvatî, the accomplisher of our prayer, may the goddess Ilâ, all-victorious Bhâratî—may the three goddesses, according to their wont, sit down on this Barhis and protect it, the faultless shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: पि॒शङ्ग॑रूपः सु॒भरो॑ वयो॒धाः श्रु॒ष्टी वी॒रो जा॑यते दे॒वका॑मः प्र॒जां त्वष्टा॒ वि ष्य॑तु॒ नाभि॑म॒स्मे अथा॑ दे॒वाना॒मप्ये॑तु॒ पाथः॑
stanzas.transliteration: piśáṅgarūpaḥ subháro vayodhā́ḥ śruṣṭī́ vīró jāyate devákāmaḥ prajā́ṃ tváṣṭā ví ṣyatu nā́bhim asmé áthā devā́nām ápy etu pā́thaḥ
stanzas.translation: Born is the pious hero swift of hearing, like gold in hue, well formed, and full of vigour. May Tvashṭar lengthen our line and kindred, and may they reach the place which Gods inhabit.

translations.griffith: Born is the pious hero swift of hearing, like gold in hue, well formed, and full of vigour. May Tvashṭar lengthen our line and kindred, and may they reach the place which Gods inhabit.
translations.oldenberg: Through (the god's) hearing (our prayer) a manly son is born (to us), tawny-coloured, rich in gain, bringing vigour, loving the gods. May Tvashtri deliver for us a son, the navel (i. e. the tie that binds generations together), and may he then go to the abode of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: वन॒स्पति॑रवसृ॒जन्नुप॑ स्थाद॒ग्निर्ह॒विः सू॑दयाति॒ प्र धी॒भिः त्रिधा॒ सम॑क्तं नयतु प्रजा॒नन्दे॒वेभ्यो॒ दैव्यः॑ शमि॒तोप॑ ह॒व्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: vánaspátir avasr̥jánn úpa sthād agnír havíḥ sūdayāti prá dhībhíḥ trídhā sámaktaṃ nayatu prajānán devébhyo daívyaḥ śamitópa havyám
stanzas.translation: Vanaspati shall stand anear and start us, and Agni with his arts prepare oblation. Let the skilled heavenly Immolator forward unto the Gods the offering thrice anointed.

translations.griffith: Vanaspati shall stand anear and start us, and Agni with his arts prepare oblation. Let the skilled heavenly Immolator forward unto the Gods the offering thrice anointed.
translations.oldenberg: 1 May the tree (i. e. the sacrificial post) stand by, letting loose (the offering which goes to the gods). May Agni make the offering ready in consequence of our prayers. May the prescient divine butcher carry the thrice-anointed offering to the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: घृ॒तं मि॑मिक्षे घृ॒तम॑स्य॒ योनि॑र्घृ॒ते श्रि॒तो घृ॒तम्व॑स्य॒ धाम॑ अ॒नु॒ष्व॒धमा व॑ह मा॒दय॑स्व॒ स्वाहा॑कृतं वृषभ वक्षि ह॒व्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: ghr̥tám mimikṣe ghr̥tám asya yónir ghr̥té śritó ghr̥tám v asya dhā́ma anuṣvadhám ā́ vaha mādáyasva svā́hākr̥taṃ vr̥ṣabha vakṣi havyám
stanzas.translation: Oil has been mixt: oil is his habitation. In oil he rests: oil is his proper province. Come as thy wont is: O thou Steer, rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated.

translations.griffith: Oil has been mixt: oil is his habitation. In oil he rests: oil is his proper province. Come as thy wont is: O thou Steer, rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated.
translations.oldenberg: He 1 is joined with ghrita 2. His womb (on the altar) is ghrita. He rests on ghrita. His abode is ghrita. Carry hither (the gods) according to thy wont! Rejoice 3! Carry, O bull, the offering, over which the Svâhâ has been spoken, (to the gods).

stanzas.sanskrit: हु॒वे वः॑ सु॒द्योत्मा॑नं सुवृ॒क्तिं वि॒शाम॒ग्निमति॑थिं सुप्र॒यस॑म् मि॒त्र इ॑व॒ यो दि॑धि॒षाय्यो॒ भूद्दे॒व आदे॑वे॒ जने॑ जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: huvé vaḥ sudyótmānaṃ suvr̥ktíṃ viśā́m agním átithiṃ suprayásam mitrá iva yó didhiṣā́yyo bhū́d devá ā́deve jáne jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: FOR you I call theglorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: FOR you I call theglorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jâtavedas.
translations.oldenberg: I call for you Agni, shining with beautiful shine, praised with beautiful praise 1, the guest of the clans, the receiver of fine offerings, who is desirable like Mitra (or, like an ally), Gâtavedas the god, among godly people.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं वि॒धन्तो॑ अ॒पां स॒धस्थे॑ द्वि॒ताद॑धु॒र्भृग॑वो वि॒क्ष्वा॒३॒॑योः ए॒ष विश्वा॑न्य॒भ्य॑स्तु॒ भूमा॑ दे॒वाना॑म॒ग्निर॑र॒तिर्जी॒राश्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ vidhánto apā́ṃ sadhásthe dvitā́dadhur bhŕ̥gavo vikṣv ā̀yóḥ eṣá víśvāny abhy àstu bhū́mā devā́nām agnír aratír jīrā́śvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Bhr̥igus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living. Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.

translations.griffith: Bhr̥igus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living. Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.
translations.oldenberg: The Bhrigus worshipping him in the abode of the waters 1 have verily 2 established him among the clans of Âyu. Let him surpass all worlds, Agni, the steward of the gods 3, the possessor of quick horses.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं दे॒वासो॒ मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु प्रि॒यं धुः॑ क्षे॒ष्यन्तो॒ न मि॒त्रम् स दी॑दयदुश॒तीरूर्म्या॒ आ द॒क्षाय्यो॒ यो दास्व॑ते॒ दम॒ आ
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ devā́so mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú priyáṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyánto ná mitrám sá dīdayad uśatī́r ū́rmyā~ā́ dakṣā́yyo yó dā́svate dáma ā́
stanzas.translation: Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them. Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.

translations.griffith: Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them. Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.
translations.oldenberg: The gods have established beloved Agni among the human clans as (people) going to settle (establish) Mitra 1. May he illuminate the nights that are longing (for him), he who should be treated kindly by the liberal (worshipper) in his house.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य र॒ण्वा स्वस्ये॑व पु॒ष्टिः संदृ॑ष्टिरस्य हिया॒नस्य॒ दक्षोः॑ वि यो भरि॑भ्र॒दोष॑धीषु जि॒ह्वामत्यो॒ न रथ्यो॑ दोधवीति॒ वारा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: asyá raṇvā́ svásyeva puṣṭíḥ sáṃdr̥ṣṭir asya hiyānásya dákṣoḥ ví yó bháribhrad óṣadhīṣu jihvā́m átyo ná ráthyo dodhavīti vā́rān
stanzas.translation: Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely. He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.

translations.griffith: Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely. He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.
translations.oldenberg: His prosperity is delightful as good pasture (?) 1; delightful is his appearance when the burning one is driven forward, he who quickly shaking his tongue among the plants waves 2 his tail mightily like a chariot-horse.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यन्मे॒ अभ्वं॑ व॒नदः॒ पन॑न्तो॒शिग्भ्यो॒ नामि॑मीत॒ वर्ण॑म् स चि॒त्रेण॑ चिकिते॒ रंसु॑ भा॒सा जु॑जु॒र्वाँ यो मुहु॒रा युवा॒ भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yán me ábhvaṃ vanádaḥ pánanta- -uśígbhyo nā́mimīta várṇam sá citréṇa cikite ráṃsu bhāsā́ jujurvā́m̐ yó múhur ā́ yúvā bhū́t
stanzas.translation: Since they who honour me have praised my greatness,– he gave, as 'twere, his hue to those who love him. Known is he by his bright delightful splendour, and waxing old renews his youth for ever.

translations.griffith: Since they who honour me have praised my greatness,– he gave, as 'twere, his hue to those who love him. Known is he by his bright delightful splendour, and waxing old renews his youth for ever.
translations.oldenberg: When they praised 1 to me the monstrous might of the eater of the forests 2, he produced his (shining) colour as (he has done) for the Usigs 3. With shining splendour he has shone joyously, he who having grown old has suddenly become young (again).

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यो वना॑ तातृषा॒णो न भाति॒ वार्ण प॒था रथ्ये॑व स्वानीत् कृ॒ष्णाध्वा॒ तपू॑ र॒ण्वश्चि॑केत॒ द्यौरि॑व॒ स्मय॑मानो॒ नभो॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yó vánā tātr̥ṣāṇó ná bhā́ti vā́r ṇá pathā́ ráthyeva svānīt kr̥ṣṇā́dhvā tápū raṇváś ciketa dyaúr iva smáyamāno nábhobhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Like one athirst, he lighteth up the forests; like water down the chariot ways he roareth. On his black path he shines in burning beauty, marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.

translations.griffith: Like one athirst, he lighteth up the forests; like water down the chariot ways he roareth. On his black path he shines in burning beauty, marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.
translations.oldenberg: He who shines on the forests 1 as if he were thirsty, who resounded like water on its path, like (the rattle of the wheels) of a chariot 2—he whose path is black, the hot, the joyous one has shone, laughing 3 like the sky with its clouds.

stanzas.sanskrit: स यो व्यस्था॑द॒भि दक्ष॑दु॒र्वीं प॒शुर्नैति॑ स्व॒युरगो॑पाः अ॒ग्निः शो॒चिष्माँ॑ अत॒सान्यु॒ष्णन्कृ॒ष्णव्य॑थिरस्वदय॒न्न भूम॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá yó vy ásthād abhí dákṣad urvī́m paśúr naíti svayúr ágopāḥ agníḥ śocíṣmām̐ atasā́ny uṣṇán kr̥ṣṇávyathir asvadayan ná bhū́ma
stanzas.translation: Around, consuming the broad earth, he wanders, free roaming like an ox without a herdsman,– Agni refulgent, burning up the bushes, with blackened lines, as though the earth he seasoned.

translations.griffith: Around, consuming the broad earth, he wanders, free roaming like an ox without a herdsman,– Agni refulgent, burning up the bushes, with blackened lines, as though the earth he seasoned.
translations.oldenberg: He who has spread himself burning over the wide (earth), moves about like an animal, free, without a keeper. The naming Agni, burning down the brushwood, with a black trail 1, has, as it were, tasted the earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ते॒ पूर्व॒स्याव॑सो॒ अधी॑तौ तृ॒तीये॑ वि॒दथे॒ मन्म॑ शंसि अ॒स्मे अ॑ग्ने सं॒यद्वी॑रं बृ॒हन्तं॑ क्षु॒मन्तं॒ वाजं॑ स्वप॒त्यं र॒यिं दाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ te pū́rvasyā́vaso ádhītau tr̥tī́ye vidáthe mánma śaṃsi asmé agne saṃyádvīram br̥hántaṃ kṣumántaṃ vā́jaṃ svapatyáṃ rayíṃ dāḥ
stanzas.translation: I, in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly. O Agni, give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.

translations.griffith: I, in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly. O Agni, give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.
translations.oldenberg: Now in the remembrance of thy former blessings this prayer has been recited to thee at the third sacrifice 1. Give to us, Agni, mighty strength with a succession of valiant men, with plenty of food; (give us) wealth with good progeny 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वया॒ यथा॑ गृत्सम॒दासो॑ अग्ने॒ गुहा॑ व॒न्वन्त॒ उप॑राँ अ॒भि ष्युः सु॒वीरा॑सो अभिमाति॒षाहः॒ स्मत्सू॒रिभ्यो॑ गृण॒ते तद्वयो॑ धाः
stanzas.transliteration: tváyā yáthā gr̥tsamadā́so agne gúhā vanvánta úparām̐ abhí ṣyúḥ suvī́rāso abhimātiṣā́haḥ smát sūríbhyo gr̥ṇaté tád váyo dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: May the Gr̥itsamadas, serving in secret, through thee, O Agni, overcome their neighbours, Rich in good heroes and subduing foemen. That vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.

translations.griffith: May the Gr̥itsamadas, serving in secret, through thee, O Agni, overcome their neighbours, Rich in good heroes and subduing foemen. That vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.
translations.oldenberg: Give, O Agni, such vigour to thy praiser together with his liberal (lords), that the Gritsamadas, rich in valiant men, victorious over hostile plots, attaining (their aim) in secret, may overcome through thee (their rivals) who get behind 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: होता॑जनिष्ट॒ चेत॑नः पि॒ता पि॒तृभ्य॑ ऊ॒तये॑ प्र॒यक्ष॒ञ्जेन्यं॒ वसु॑ श॒केम॑ वा॒जिनो॒ यम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: hótājaniṣṭa cétanaḥ pitā́ pitŕ̥bhya ūtáye prayákṣañ jényaṃ vásu śakéma vājíno yámam
stanzas.translation: HERALD and teacher was he born, a guardian for our patrons' help, Earner by rites of noble wealth. That Strong One may we grasp and guide;

translations.griffith: HERALD and teacher was he born, a guardian for our patrons' help, Earner by rites of noble wealth. That Strong One may we grasp and guide;
translations.oldenberg: The brilliant Hotri 1 has been born 2, the father to protect the fathers 3, aspiring after noble wealth. May we be able to bridle the strong (horse) 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यस्मि॑न्त्स॒प्त र॒श्मय॑स्त॒ता य॒ज्ञस्य॑ ने॒तरि॑ म॒नु॒ष्वद्दैव्य॑मष्ट॒मं पोता॒ विश्वं॒ तदि॑न्वति
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yásmin saptá raśmáyas tatā́ yajñásya netári manuṣvád daívyam aṣṭamám pótā víśvaṃ tád invati
stanzas.translation: In whom, Leader of sacrifice, the seven reins, far extended, meet; Who furthers, man-like, eighth in place, as Cleanser, all the work divine.

translations.griffith: In whom, Leader of sacrifice, the seven reins, far extended, meet; Who furthers, man-like, eighth in place, as Cleanser, all the work divine.
translations.oldenberg: He the leader of the sacrifice towards whom the seven reins (or rays) are stretched, the Potri promotes, as (he has done) for Manu, the divine eighth (rein); all those (reins he promotes) 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒ध॒न्वे वा॒ यदी॒मनु॒ वोच॒द्ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ वेरु॒ तत् परि॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑ ने॒मिश्च॒क्रमि॑वाभवत्
stanzas.transliteration: dadhanvé vā yád īm ánu vócad bráhmāṇi vér u tát pári víśvāni kā́vyā nemíś cakrám ivābhavat
stanzas.translation: When swift he follows this behest, bird-like he chants the holy prayers. He holds all knowledge in his grasp even as the felly rounds the wheel.

translations.griffith: When swift he follows this behest, bird-like he chants the holy prayers. He holds all knowledge in his grasp even as the felly rounds the wheel.
translations.oldenberg: Or when he has run along, and has recited the sacred words 1, and has pursued that (duty) 2, he has encompassed every kind of wisdom as the felly (encircles) the wheel.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा॒कं हि शुचि॑ना॒ शुचिः॑ प्रशा॒स्ता क्रतु॒नाज॑नि वि॒द्वाँ अ॑स्य व्र॒ता ध्रु॒वा व॒या इ॒वानु॑ रोहते
stanzas.transliteration: sākáṃ hí śúcinā śúciḥ praśāstā́ krátunā́jani vidvā́m̐ asya vratā́ dhruvā́ vayā́ ivā́nu rohate
stanzas.translation: Together with pure mental power, pure, as Director, was he born. Skilled in his own unchanging laws he waxes like the growing boughs.

translations.griffith: Together with pure mental power, pure, as Director, was he born. Skilled in his own unchanging laws he waxes like the growing boughs.
translations.oldenberg: For He has been born as the bright Prasâstri, with bright power of mind. (A man) who knows his firm laws, mounts up on them as on the branches (of a tree) 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता अ॑स्य॒ वर्ण॑मा॒युवो॒ नेष्टुः॑ सचन्त धे॒नवः॑ कु॒वित्ति॒सृभ्य॒ आ वरं॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ या इ॒दं य॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ asya várṇam āyúvo néṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenávaḥ kuvít tisŕ̥bhya ā́ váraṃ svásāro yā́ idáṃ yayúḥ
stanzas.translation: Clothing them in his hues, the kine of him the Leader wait on him. Is he not better than the Three, the Sisters who have come to us?

translations.griffith: Clothing them in his hues, the kine of him the Leader wait on him. Is he not better than the Three, the Sisters who have come to us?
translations.oldenberg: The lively milch-cows were attached to his, the Neshtri's, (bright) colour 1. Was it according to the wish of the three sisters who have gone there 2?

stanzas.sanskrit: यदी॑ मा॒तुरुप॒ स्वसा॑ घृ॒तं भर॒न्त्यस्थि॑त तासा॑मध्व॒र्युराग॑तौ॒ यवो॑ वृ॒ष्टीव॑ मोदते
stanzas.transliteration: yádī mātúr úpa svásā ghr̥tám bháranty ásthita tā́sām adhvaryúr ā́gatau yávo vr̥ṣṭī́va modate
stanzas.translation: When, laden with the holy oil, the Sitster (sic) by the Mother stands, The Priest delights in their approach, as corn at coming of the rain.

translations.griffith: When, laden with the holy oil, the Sitster (sic) by the Mother stands, The Priest delights in their approach, as corn at coming of the rain.
translations.oldenberg: When (coming) from the mother the sister has approached, bringing ghrita 1, the Adhvaryu rejoices at their 2 coming as corn (rejoices) at rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्वः स्वाय॒ धाय॑से कृणु॒तामृ॒त्विगृ॒त्विज॑म् स्तोमं॑ य॒ज्ञं चादरं॑ व॒नेमा॑ ररि॒मा व॒यम्
stanzas.transliteration: sváḥ svā́ya dhā́yase kr̥ṇutā́m r̥tvíg r̥tvíjam stómaṃ yajñáṃ cā́d áraṃ vanémā rarimā́ vayám
stanzas.translation: For his support let him perform as ministrant his priestly task; Yea, song of praise and sacrifice: we have bestowed, let us obtain.

translations.griffith: For his support let him perform as ministrant his priestly task; Yea, song of praise and sacrifice: we have bestowed, let us obtain.
translations.oldenberg: May He the Ritvig (priest) himself make the Ritvig (serve) for his own refreshment 1. And may we readily gain the praise and the sacrifice 2; we have offered it.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथा॑ वि॒द्वाँ अरं॒ कर॒द्विश्वे॑भ्यो यज॒तेभ्यः॑ अ॒यम॑ग्ने॒ त्वे अपि॒ यं य॒ज्ञं च॑कृ॒मा व॒यम्
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā vidvā́m̐ áraṃ kárad víśvebhyo yajatébhyaḥ ayám agne tvé ápi yáṃ yajñáṃ cakr̥mā́ vayám
stanzas.translation: That so this man well skilled, may pay worship to all the Holy Ones. And, Agni, this our sacrifice which wehave here prepared, to thee.

translations.griffith: That so this man well skilled, may pay worship to all the Holy Ones. And, Agni, this our sacrifice which wehave here prepared, to thee.
translations.oldenberg: In order that He the knowing one (Agni) may readily serve all the worshipful (gods), this sacrifice, O Agni, which we have performed, rests in thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मां मे॑ अग्ने स॒मिध॑मि॒मामु॑प॒सदं॑ वनेः इ॒मा उ॒ षु श्रु॑धी॒ गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imā́m me agne samídham imā́m upasádaṃ vaneḥ imā́ u ṣú śrudhī gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee: Hear graciously these songs of praise.

translations.griffith: AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee: Hear graciously these songs of praise.
translations.oldenberg: Accept, O Agni, this my piece of wood and this my sitting down (reverentially) 1, and hear these words of mine.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒या ते॑ अग्ने विधे॒मोर्जो॑ नपा॒दश्व॑मिष्टे ए॒ना सू॒क्तेन॑ सुजात
stanzas.transliteration: ayā́ te agne vidhema- -ū́rjo napād áśvamiṣṭe enā́ sūkténa sujāta
stanzas.translation: With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength, With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.

translations.griffith: With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength, With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.
translations.oldenberg: Let us worship thee, Agni, child of vigour, with this (piece of wood?) 1, O winner of horses 2, with this well-spoken (hymn), O well-born one.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॑ गी॒र्भिर्गिर्व॑णसं द्रविण॒स्युं द्र॑विणोदः स॒प॒र्येम॑ सप॒र्यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā gīrbhír gírvaṇasaṃ draviṇasyúṃ draviṇodaḥ saparyéma saparyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth! With reverence let us worship thee.

translations.griffith: As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth! With reverence let us worship thee.
translations.oldenberg: May we thus as thy devoted servants pay devotion by our words to thee who acceptest words (of prayer), to thee who aspirest after wealth, O giver of wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: स बो॑धि सू॒रिर्म॒घवा॒ वसु॑पते॒ वसु॑दावन् यु॒यो॒ध्य१॒॑स्मद्द्वेषां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: sá bodhi sūrír maghávā vásupate vásudāvan yuyodhy àsmád dvéṣāṃsi
stanzas.translation: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things. Drive those who hate us far away.

translations.griffith: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things. Drive those who hate us far away.
translations.oldenberg: Thus be thou a liberal, bountiful lord, O lord of goods, O giver of goods. Drive hatred away from us.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ वृ॒ष्टिं दि॒वस्परि॒ स नो॒ वाज॑मन॒र्वाण॑म् स नः॑ सह॒स्रिणी॒रिषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá no vr̥ṣṭíṃ divás pári sá no vā́jam anarvā́ṇam sá naḥ sahasríṇīr íṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist: Give food exceeding plentiful.

translations.griffith: Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist: Give food exceeding plentiful.
translations.oldenberg: Thus (give) us 1 rain from the sky; thus (give) us unattainable strength; thus (give) us thousandfold food.

stanzas.sanskrit: ईळा॑नायाव॒स्यवे॒ यवि॑ष्ठ दूत नो गि॒रा यजि॑ष्ठ होत॒रा ग॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: ī́ḷānāyāvasyáve yáviṣṭha dūta no girā́ yájiṣṭha hotar ā́ gahi
stanzas.translation: To him who lauds thee, craving help, most youthful envoy! through our song, Most holy Herald! come thou nigh.

translations.griffith: To him who lauds thee, craving help, most youthful envoy! through our song, Most holy Herald! come thou nigh.
translations.oldenberg: To him who magnifies thee, who desires thy help, O youngest messenger, (invoked) by our word, best sacrificing Hotri, come near.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒न्तर्ह्य॑ग्न॒ ईय॑से वि॒द्वाञ्जन्मो॒भया॑ कवे दू॒तो जन्ये॑व॒ मित्र्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: antár hy àgna ī́yase vidvā́ñ jánmobháyā kave dūtó jányeva mítryaḥ
stanzas.translation: Between both races, Agni, Sage, well skilled thou passest to and fro, As envoy friendly to mankind.

translations.griffith: Between both races, Agni, Sage, well skilled thou passest to and fro, As envoy friendly to mankind.
translations.oldenberg: For thou, Agni, O sage, who knowest both races (of gods and of men), passest (to and fro) between them, like a messenger belonging to thy own people 1, belonging to thy allies.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वि॒द्वाँ आ च॑ पिप्रयो॒ यक्षि॑ चिकित्व आनु॒षक् आ चा॒स्मिन्त्स॑त्सि ब॒र्हिषि॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá vidvā́m̐ ā́ ca piprayo yákṣi cikitva ānuṣák ā́ cāsmín satsi barhíṣi
stanzas.translation: Befriend us thou as knowing all. Sage, duly worship thou the Gods, And seat thee on this sacred grass.

translations.griffith: Befriend us thou as knowing all. Sage, duly worship thou the Gods, And seat thee on this sacred grass.
translations.oldenberg: Thus gladden (the gods) 1 as the knowing one; sacrifice, O intelligent one, in due order, and sit down on this Barhis.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रेष्ठं॑ यविष्ठ भार॒ताग्ने॑ द्यु॒मन्त॒मा भ॑र वसो॑ पुरु॒स्पृहं॑ र॒यिम्
stanzas.transliteration: śréṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭha bhārata- -ágne dyumántam ā́ bhara váso puruspŕ̥haṃ rayím
stanzas.translation: VASU, thou most youthful God, Bharata, Agni, bring us wealth, Excellent, splendid, much-desired.

translations.griffith: VASU, thou most youthful God, Bharata, Agni, bring us wealth, Excellent, splendid, much-desired.
translations.oldenberg: Bring us, O youngest god, Bhârata 1, Agni, the best, resplendent, much-desired wealth, O Vasu 2!

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नो॒ अरा॑तिरीशत दे॒वस्य॒ मर्त्य॑स्य च पर्षि॒ तस्या॑ उ॒त द्वि॒षः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ no árātir īśata devásya mártyasya ca párṣi tásyā utá dviṣáḥ
stanzas.translation: Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's. Save us from this and enmity.

translations.griffith: Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's. Save us from this and enmity.
translations.oldenberg: May no malign power of a god or of a mortal overcome us. Help us across such hostile power.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑ उ॒त त्वया॑ व॒यं धारा॑ उद॒न्या॑ इव अति॑ गाहेमहि॒ द्विषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśvā utá tváyā vayáṃ dhā́rā udanyā̀ iva áti gāhemahi dvíṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way, As 'twere through streaming water-floods.

translations.griffith: So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way, As 'twere through streaming water-floods.
translations.oldenberg: And may we dive with thee across all hostile powers as across streams of water.

stanzas.sanskrit: शुचिः॑ पावक॒ वन्द्योऽग्ने॑ बृ॒हद्वि रो॑चसे त्वं घृ॒तेभि॒राहु॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: śúciḥ pāvaka vándyaḥ- -ágne br̥hád ví rocase tváṃ ghr̥tébhir ā́hutaḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, Purifier Agni, high shinest forth, bright, adorable, When worshipped with the sacred oil.

translations.griffith: Thou, Purifier Agni, high shinest forth, bright, adorable, When worshipped with the sacred oil.
translations.oldenberg: Bright, O purifier, worthy of adoration, Agni, thou shinest mightily; thou hast been worshipped by offerings of ghrita 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ असि भार॒ताग्ने॑ व॒शाभि॑रु॒क्षभिः॑ अ॒ष्टाप॑दीभि॒राहु॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no asi bhārata- -ágne vaśā́bhir ukṣábhiḥ aṣṭā́padībhir ā́hutaḥ
stanzas.translation: Ours art thou, Agni, Bharata, honoured by us with barren cows, With bullocks and with kine in calf

translations.griffith: Ours art thou, Agni, Bharata, honoured by us with barren cows, With bullocks and with kine in calf
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Bhârata 1, Agni! hast been worshipped by us with offerings of heifers, of bulls, of eight-footed (cows) 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्र्व॑न्नः स॒र्पिरा॑सुतिः प्र॒त्नो होता॒ वरे॑ण्यः सह॑सस्पु॒त्रो अद्भु॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: drvànnaḥ sarpírāsutiḥ pratnó hótā váreṇyaḥ sáhasas putró ádbhutaḥ
stanzas.translation: Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent, The Son of Strength, the Wonderful.

translations.griffith: Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent, The Son of Strength, the Wonderful.
translations.oldenberg: The old excellent Hotri who feeds on wood and drinks butter, he is the wonderful son of strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: वा॒ज॒यन्नि॑व॒ नू रथा॒न्योगाँ॑ अ॒ग्नेरुप॑ स्तुहि य॒शस्त॑मस्य मी॒ळ्हुषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vājayánn iva nū́ ráthān yógām̐ agnér úpa stuhi yaśástamasya mīḷhúṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car, The liberal, the most splendid One;

translations.griffith: Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car, The liberal, the most splendid One;
translations.oldenberg: As one who runs a race 1 (praises) his chariots, praise thou the yoking of Agni (to the chariot of sacrifice), of the most glorious, bountiful (god)—

stanzas.sanskrit: यः सु॑नी॒थो द॑दा॒शुषे॑ऽजु॒र्यो ज॒रय॑न्न॒रिम् चारु॑प्रतीक॒ आहु॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ sunīthó dadāśúṣe -ajuryó jaráyann arím cā́rupratīka ā́hutaḥ
stanzas.translation: Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe: When worshipped fair to look upon;

translations.griffith: Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe: When worshipped fair to look upon;
translations.oldenberg: Who is the best leader for his worshipper, who undecaying makes the malign decay 1, the cheerful-faced who has been worshipped with offerings—

stanzas.sanskrit: य उ॑ श्रि॒या दमे॒ष्वा दो॒षोषसि॑ प्रश॒स्यते॑ यस्य॑ व्र॒तं न मीय॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: yá u śriyā́ dámeṣv~ā́ doṣóṣási praśasyáte yásya vratáṃ ná mī́yate
stanzas.translation: Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes, Whose statute is inviolate;

translations.griffith: Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes, Whose statute is inviolate;
translations.oldenberg: He who is praised in the houses on account of his beauty in the evening and at dawn, whose law is not set at nought,

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यः स्व१॒॑र्ण भा॒नुना॑ चि॒त्रो वि॒भात्य॒र्चिषा॑ अ॒ञ्जा॒नो अ॒जरै॑र॒भि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ svàr ṇá bhānúnā citró vibhā́ty arcíṣā añjānó ajárair abhí
stanzas.translation: Who shines refulgent like the Sun, with brilliance and with fiery flame, Decked with imperishable sheen.

translations.griffith: Who shines refulgent like the Sun, with brilliance and with fiery flame, Decked with imperishable sheen.
translations.oldenberg: The bright one who shines with his light as the Sun with his splendour, with his undecaying (flames) 1, he who is anointed (with ghrita).

stanzas.sanskrit: अत्रि॒मनु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म॒ग्निमु॒क्थानि॑ वावृधुः विश्वा॒ अधि॒ श्रियो॑ दधे
stanzas.transliteration: átrim ánu svarā́jyam agním ukthā́ni vāvr̥dhuḥ víśvā ádhi śríyo dadhe
stanzas.translation: Him Atri, Agni, have our songs Strengthened according to his sway: All glories hath he made his own.

translations.griffith: Him Atri, Agni, have our songs Strengthened according to his sway: All glories hath he made his own.
translations.oldenberg: The hymns have strengthened Agni the devourer 1 along (the extent of) his own royalty 2. He has assumed every beauty.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्नेरिन्द्र॑स्य॒ सोम॑स्य दे॒वाना॑मू॒तिभि॑र्व॒यम् अरि॑ष्यन्तः सचेमह्य॒भि ष्या॑म पृतन्य॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: agnér índrasya sómasya devā́nām ūtíbhir vayám áriṣyantaḥ sacemahi- abhí ṣyāma pr̥tanyatáḥ
stanzas.translation: May we with Agni's, Indra's help, with Soma's, yea, of all the Gods, Uninjured dwell together still, and conquer those who fight with us.

translations.griffith: May we with Agni's, Indra's help, with Soma's, yea, of all the Gods, Uninjured dwell together still, and conquer those who fight with us.
translations.oldenberg: May we unharmed stand under the protection of Agni, Indra, Soma, of the gods; may we overcome our foes.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि होता॑ होतृ॒षद॑ने॒ विदा॑नस्त्वे॒षो दी॑दि॒वाँ अ॑सदत्सु॒दक्षः॑ अद॑ब्धव्रतप्रमति॒र्वसि॑ष्ठः सहस्रम्भ॒रः शुचि॑जिह्वो अ॒ग्निः
stanzas.transliteration: ní hótā hotr̥ṣádane vídānas tveṣó dīdivā́m̐ asadat sudákṣaḥ ádabdhavratapramatir vásiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharáḥ śúcijihvo agníḥ
stanzas.translation: ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty, Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.

translations.griffith: ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty, Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.
translations.oldenberg: The Hotri who is found on the Hotri's seat has sat down (there), the fierce, the resplendent, the dexterous one, the protector of (his own) infallible laws 1, the highest Vasu, he who brings thousandfold (gain), the pure-tongued Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं दू॒तस्त्वमु॑ नः पर॒स्पास्त्वं वस्य॒ आ वृ॑षभ प्रणे॒ता अग्ने॑ तो॒कस्य॑ न॒स्तने॑ त॒नूना॒मप्र॑युच्छ॒न्दीद्य॑द्बोधि गो॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ dūtás tvám u naḥ paraspā́s tváṃ vásya ā́ vr̥ṣabha praṇetā́ ágne tokásya nas táne tanū́nām áprayuchan dī́dyad bodhi gopā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings. Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.

translations.griffith: Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings. Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.
translations.oldenberg: Be thou our messenger, be our protector far and wide; be thou, O bull, a leader towards greater wealth. O Agni! for the continuation of our children and of ourselves be thou an unremitting, brilliant protector.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒धेम॑ ते पर॒मे जन्म॑न्नग्ने वि॒धेम॒ स्तोमै॒रव॑रे स॒धस्थे॑ यस्मा॒द्योने॑रु॒दारि॑था॒ यजे॒ तं प्र त्वे ह॒वींषि॑ जुहुरे॒ समि॑द्धे
stanzas.transliteration: vidhéma te paramé jánmann agne vidhéma stómair ávare sadhásthe yásmād yóner udā́rithā yáje tám prá tvé havī́ṃṣi juhure sámiddhe
stanzas.translation: May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station. The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.

translations.griffith: May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station. The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.
translations.oldenberg: May we worship thee at thy highest birth (-place), O Agni; may we worship thee with praises in thy lower abode. I honour the womb from which thou hast sprung. When thou hast been kindled, they have offered offerings in thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ यज॑स्व ह॒विषा॒ यजी॑याञ्छ्रु॒ष्टी दे॒ष्णम॒भि गृ॑णीहि॒ राधः॑ त्वं ह्यसि॑ रयि॒पती॑ रयी॒णां त्वं शु॒क्रस्य॒ वच॑सो म॒नोता॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne yájasva havíṣā yájīyāñ -śruṣṭī́ deṣṇám abhí gr̥ṇīhi rā́dhaḥ tváṃ hy ási rayipátī rayīṇā́ṃ tváṃ śukrásya vácaso manótā
stanzas.translation: Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented; For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.

translations.griffith: Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented; For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, being the best sacrificer perform thou the sacrifice with the oblation. With thy readiness to hear (us) hail our gift, the wealth (which we offer). For thou art the treasure-lord of treasures; thou art the deviser of brilliant speech.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒भयं॑ ते॒ न क्षी॑यते वस॒व्यं॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ जाय॑मानस्य दस्म कृ॒धि क्षु॒मन्तं॑ जरि॒तार॑मग्ने कृ॒धि पतिं॑ स्वप॒त्यस्य॑ रा॒यः
stanzas.transliteration: ubháyaṃ te ná kṣīyate vasavyàṃ divé-dive jā́yamānasya dasma kr̥dhí kṣumántaṃ jaritā́ram agne kr̥dhí pátiṃ svapatyásya rāyáḥ
stanzas.translation: The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases. Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.

translations.griffith: The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases. Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.
translations.oldenberg: Thy wealth of both kinds 1 never fails, when thou art born (kindled) day by day, O wonderful one. Make thy singer, O Agni, rich in food; make him the lord of wealth with excellent offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: सैनानी॑केन सुवि॒दत्रो॑ अ॒स्मे यष्टा॑ दे॒वाँ आय॑जिष्ठः स्व॒स्ति अद॑ब्धो गो॒पा उ॒त नः॑ पर॒स्पा अग्ने॑ द्यु॒मदु॒त रे॒वद्दि॑दीहि
stanzas.transliteration: saínā́nīkena suvidátro asmé yáṣṭā devā́m̐ ā́yajiṣṭhaḥ svastí ádabdho gopā́ utá naḥ paraspā́ḥ- ágne dyumád utá revád didīhi
stanzas.translation: May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us. Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.

translations.griffith: May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us. Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.
translations.oldenberg: With this face of thine, as a bounteous (lord), a sacrificer to the gods, the best performer of sacrifices with happiness, as an undeceivable guardian and far-reaching protector, shine among us, O Agni, with light and wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: जो॒हूत्रो॑ अ॒ग्निः प्र॑थ॒मः पि॒तेवे॒ळस्प॒दे मनु॑षा॒ यत्समि॑द्धः श्रियं॒ वसा॑नो अ॒मृतो॒ विचे॑ता मर्मृ॒जेन्यः॑ श्रव॒स्य१॒॑ः स वा॒जी
stanzas.transliteration: johū́tro agníḥ prathamáḥ pitéva- -iḷás padé mánuṣā yát sámiddhaḥ śríyaṃ vásāno amŕ̥to vícetāḥ- marmr̥jényaḥ śravasyàḥ sá vājī́
stanzas.translation: AGNI, first, loudly calling, like a Father, kindled by man upon the seat of worship. Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.

translations.griffith: AGNI, first, loudly calling, like a Father, kindled by man upon the seat of worship. Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.
translations.oldenberg: Agni is to be invoked as the first like a father, when he has been inflamed by Manus 1 in the abode of Id 2. When he has invested himself with beauty, the wise immortal, he, the glorious strong (horse) is to be smoothed (by the worshippers as by grooms).

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रू॒या अ॒ग्निश्चि॒त्रभा॑नु॒र्हवं॑ मे॒ विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिर॒मृतो॒ विचे॑ताः श्या॒वा रथं॑ वहतो॒ रोहि॑ता वो॒तारु॒षाह॑ चक्रे॒ विभृ॑त्रः
stanzas.transliteration: śrūyā́ agníś citrábhānur hávam me víśvābhir gīrbhír amŕ̥to vícetāḥ śyāvā́ ráthaṃ vahato róhitā vā- -utā́ruṣā́ha cakre víbhr̥traḥ
stanzas.translation: May Agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs, Immortal, keen of insight. Dark steeds or ruddy draw his car, or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.

translations.griffith: May Agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs, Immortal, keen of insight. Dark steeds or ruddy draw his car, or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.
translations.oldenberg: Agni with bright splendour, mayest thou hear my call with all my prayers, thou a wise immortal. The two tawny (horses) draw thy chariot or the two red (horses), or He the wide-ranging one has made the two ruddy (horses draw his chariot) 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त्ता॒नाया॑मजनय॒न्त्सुषू॑तं॒ भुव॑द॒ग्निः पु॑रु॒पेशा॑सु॒ गर्भः॑ शिरि॑णायां चिद॒क्तुना॒ महो॑भि॒रप॑रीवृतो वसति॒ प्रचे॑ताः
stanzas.transliteration: uttānā́yām ajanayan súṣūtam bhúvad agníḥ purupéśāsu gárbhaḥ śíriṇāyāṃ cid aktúnā máhobhir áparīvr̥to vasati prácetāḥ
stanzas.translation: On wood supine they got the well-formed Infant: a germ in various-fashioned plants was Agni; And in the night, not compassed round by darkness, he dwells exceeding wise, with rays of splendour.

translations.griffith: On wood supine they got the well-formed Infant: a germ in various-fashioned plants was Agni; And in the night, not compassed round by darkness, he dwells exceeding wise, with rays of splendour.
translations.oldenberg: They have generated the well-born (Agni) in her who lies on her back 1. Agni became a germ in the manifoldly-adorned (wives) 2. Even in the … 3 the wise one dwells by night uncovered in his powers 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: जिघ॑र्म्य॒ग्निं ह॒विषा॑ घृ॒तेन॑ प्रतिक्षि॒यन्तं॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ पृ॒थुं ति॑र॒श्चा वय॑सा बृ॒हन्तं॒ व्यचि॑ष्ठ॒मन्नै॑ रभ॒सं दृशा॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: jígharmy agníṃ havíṣā ghr̥téna pratikṣiyántam bhúvanāni víśvā pr̥thúṃ tiraścā́ váyasā br̥hántaṃ vyáciṣṭham ánnai rabhasáṃ dŕ̥śānam
stanzas.translation: With oil and sacred gifts I sprinkle Agni who makes his home in front of all things living, Broad, vast, through vital power o'er all expanded, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds him.

translations.griffith: With oil and sacred gifts I sprinkle Agni who makes his home in front of all things living, Broad, vast, through vital power o'er all expanded, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds him.
translations.oldenberg: I besprinkle with my offering, with Ghrita, Agni who abides turned towards all beings, who widely extends throughout, who is mighty in his vigour, who shows himself most capacious by the food (which he consumes), and robust 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वि॒श्वतः॑ प्र॒त्यञ्चं॑ जिघर्म्यर॒क्षसा॒ मन॑सा॒ तज्जु॑षेत मर्य॑श्रीः स्पृह॒यद्व॑र्णो अ॒ग्निर्नाभि॒मृशे॑ त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ जर्भु॑राणः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ viśvátaḥ pratyáñcaṃ jigharmi- arakṣásā mánasā táj juṣeta máryaśrī spr̥hayádvarṇo agnír nā́bhimŕ̥śe tanvā̀ járbhurāṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: I pour to him who looks in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit. Agni with bridegroom's grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.

translations.griffith: I pour to him who looks in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit. Agni with bridegroom's grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.
translations.oldenberg: I besprinkle Him who is turned towards (us) from all sides; may he gladly accept that with his benevolent mind. Agni, who is like a beautiful youth, who has the appearance of one eagerly striving, is not to be touched, when he hurries around with his body.

stanzas.sanskrit: ज्ञे॒या भा॒गं स॑हसा॒नो वरे॑ण॒ त्वादू॑तासो मनु॒वद्व॑देम अनू॑नम॒ग्निं जु॒ह्वा॑ वच॒स्या म॑धु॒पृचं॑ धन॒सा जो॑हवीमि
stanzas.transliteration: jñeyā́ bhāgáṃ sahasānó váreṇa tvā́dūtāso manuvád vadema ánūnam agníṃ juhvā̀ vacasyā́ madhupŕ̥caṃ dhanasā́ johavīmi
stanzas.translation: By choice victorious, recognize thy portion: with thee for envoy may we speak like Manu. Obtaining wealth, I call on perfect Agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.

translations.griffith: By choice victorious, recognize thy portion: with thee for envoy may we speak like Manu. Obtaining wealth, I call on perfect Agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.
translations.oldenberg: Mayst thou know the portion (belonging to thee), being strong through thy desire. With thee as our messenger may we speak like Manu. Gaining wealth 1 I invoke with my (sacrificial) ladle, with my eloquence, the faultless Agni who mixes the honey-drink.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रु॒धी हव॑मिन्द्र॒ मा रि॑षण्यः॒ स्याम॑ ते दा॒वने॒ वसू॑नाम् इ॒मा हि त्वामूर्जो॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ति वसू॒यवः॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ न क्षर॑न्तः
stanzas.transliteration: śrudhī́ hávam indra mā́ riṣaṇyaḥ syā́ma te dāváne vásūnām imā́ hí tvā́m ū́rjo vardháyanti vasūyávaḥ síndhavo ná kṣárantaḥ
stanzas.translation: HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures; For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.

translations.griffith: HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures; For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.

stanzas.sanskrit: सृ॒जो म॒हीरि॑न्द्र॒ या अपि॑न्वः॒ परि॑ष्ठिता॒ अहि॑ना शूर पू॒र्वीः अम॑र्त्यं चिद्दा॒सं मन्य॑मान॒मवा॑भिनदु॒क्थैर्वा॑वृधा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: sr̥jó mahī́r indra yā́ ápinvaḥ páriṣṭhitā áhinā śūra pūrvī́ḥ ámartyaṃ cid dāsám mányamānam ávābhinad ukthaír vāvr̥dhānáḥ
stanzas.translation: Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero. Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dâsa, him who deemed himself immortal.

translations.griffith: Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero. Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dâsa, him who deemed himself immortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒क्थेष्विन्नु शू॑र॒ येषु॑ चा॒कन्त्स्तोमे॑ष्विन्द्र रु॒द्रिये॑षु च तुभ्येदे॒ता यासु॑ मन्दसा॒नः प्र वा॒यवे॑ सिस्रते॒ न शु॒भ्राः
stanzas.transliteration: ukthéṣv ín nú śūra yéṣu cākán stómeṣv indra rudríyeṣu ca túbhyéd etā́ yā́su mandasānáḥ prá vāyáve sisrate ná śubhrā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras, These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vâyu.
