translations.griffith: For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras, These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vâyu.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒भ्रं नु ते॒ शुष्मं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्तः शु॒भ्रं वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोर्दधा॑नाः शु॒भ्रस्त्वमि॑न्द्र वावृधा॒नो अ॒स्मे दासी॒र्विशः॒ सूर्ये॑ण सह्याः
stanzas.transliteration: śubhráṃ nú te śúṣmaṃ vardháyantaḥ śubhráṃ vájram bāhvór dádhānāḥ śubhrás tvám indra vāvr̥dhānó asmé dā́sīr víśaḥ sū́ryeṇa sahyāḥ
stanzas.translation: We who add strength to thine own splendid vigour, laying within thine arms the splendid thunder- With us mayst thou, O Indra, waxen splendid, with Sûrya overcome the Dâsa races.

translations.griffith: We who add strength to thine own splendid vigour, laying within thine arms the splendid thunder- With us mayst thou, O Indra, waxen splendid, with Sûrya overcome the Dâsa races.

stanzas.sanskrit: गुहा॑ हि॒तं गुह्यं॑ गू॒ळ्हम॒प्स्वपी॑वृतं मा॒यिनं॑ क्षि॒यन्त॑म् उ॒तो अ॒पो द्यां त॑स्त॒भ्वांस॒मह॒न्नहिं॑ शूर वी॒र्ये॑ण
stanzas.transliteration: gúhā hitáṃ gúhyaṃ gūḷhám apsú- ápīvr̥tam māyínaṃ kṣiyántam utó apó dyā́ṃ tastabhvā́ṃsam áhann áhiṃ śūra vīryèṇa
stanzas.translation: Hero, thou slewest in thy valour Ahi concealed in depths, mysterious, great enchanter, Dwelling enveloped deep within the waters, him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.

translations.griffith: Hero, thou slewest in thy valour Ahi concealed in depths, mysterious, great enchanter, Dwelling enveloped deep within the waters, him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तवा॒ नु त॑ इन्द्र पू॒र्व्या म॒हान्यु॒त स्त॑वाम॒ नूत॑ना कृ॒तानि॑ स्तवा॒ वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोरु॒शन्तं॒ स्तवा॒ हरी॒ सूर्य॑स्य के॒तू
stanzas.transliteration: stávā nú ta indra pūrvyā́ mahā́ni- utá stavāma nū́tanā kr̥tā́ni stávā vájram bāhvór uśántaṃ stávā hárī sū́ryasya ketū́
stanzas.translation: Indra, we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime, we laud thine exploits later of achievement; We laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager; we laud thy two Bay Steeds, heralds of Sûrya.

translations.griffith: Indra, we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime, we laud thine exploits later of achievement; We laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager; we laud thy two Bay Steeds, heralds of Sûrya.

stanzas.sanskrit: हरी॒ नु त॑ इन्द्र वा॒जय॑न्ता घृत॒श्चुतं॑ स्वा॒रम॑स्वार्ष्टाम् वि स॑म॒ना भूमि॑रप्रथि॒ष्टारं॑स्त॒ पर्व॑तश्चित्सरि॒ष्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: hárī nú ta indra vājáyantā ghr̥taścútaṃ svārám asvārṣṭām ví samanā́ bhū́mir aprathiṣṭa- -áraṃsta párvataś cit sariṣyán
stanzas.translation: Indra, thy Bay Steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness. The earth hath spread herself in all her fulness: the cloud that was about to move hath rested.

translations.griffith: Indra, thy Bay Steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness. The earth hath spread herself in all her fulness: the cloud that was about to move hath rested.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि पर्व॑तः सा॒द्यप्र॑युच्छ॒न्त्सं मा॒तृभि॑र्वावशा॒नो अ॑क्रान् दू॒रे पा॒रे वाणीं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्त॒ इन्द्रे॑षितां ध॒मनिं॑ पप्रथ॒न्नि
stanzas.transliteration: ní párvataḥ sādy áprayuchan sám mātŕ̥bhir vāvaśānó akrān dūré pāré vā́ṇīṃ vardháyantaḥ- índreṣitāṃ dhamánim paprathan ní
stanzas.translation: Down, never ceasing, hath the rain-cloud settled: bellowing, it hath wandered with the Mothers. Swelling the roar in the far distant limits, they have spread wide the blast sent forth by Indra.

translations.griffith: Down, never ceasing, hath the rain-cloud settled: bellowing, it hath wandered with the Mothers. Swelling the roar in the far distant limits, they have spread wide the blast sent forth by Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॑ म॒हां सिन्धु॑मा॒शया॑नं माया॒विनं॑ वृ॒त्रम॑स्फुर॒न्निः अरे॑जेतां॒ रोद॑सी भिया॒ने कनि॑क्रदतो॒ वृष्णो॑ अस्य॒ वज्रा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: índro mahā́ṃ síndhum āśáyānam māyāvínaṃ vr̥trám asphuran níḥ árejetāṃ ródasī bhiyāné kánikradato vŕ̥ṣṇo asya vájrāt
stanzas.translation: Indra hath hurled down the magician Vr̥itra who lay beleaguering the mighty river. Then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong Hero's thunder when he bellowed.

translations.griffith: Indra hath hurled down the magician Vr̥itra who lay beleaguering the mighty river. Then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong Hero's thunder when he bellowed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अरो॑रवी॒द्वृष्णो॑ अस्य॒ वज्रोऽमा॑नुषं॒ यन्मानु॑षो नि॒जूर्वा॑त् नि मा॒यिनो॑ दान॒वस्य॑ मा॒या अपा॑दयत्पपि॒वान्त्सु॒तस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: ároravīd vŕ̥ṣṇo asya vájraḥ- -ámānuṣaṃ yán mā́nuṣo nijū́rvāt ní māyíno dānavásya māyā́ḥ- ápādayat papivā́n sutásya
stanzas.translation: Loud roared the mighty Hero's bolt of thunder, when he, the Friend of man, burnt up the monster, And, having drunk his fill of flowing Soma, baffled the guileful Dânava's devices.

translations.griffith: Loud roared the mighty Hero's bolt of thunder, when he, the Friend of man, burnt up the monster, And, having drunk his fill of flowing Soma, baffled the guileful Dânava's devices.

stanzas.sanskrit: पिबा॑पि॒बेदि॑न्द्र शूर॒ सोमं॒ मन्द॑न्तु त्वा म॒न्दिनः॑ सु॒तासः॑ पृ॒णन्त॑स्ते कु॒क्षी व॑र्धयन्त्वि॒त्था सु॒तः पौ॒र इन्द्र॑माव
stanzas.transliteration: píbā-pibéd indra śūra sómam mándantu tvā mandínaḥ sutā́saḥ pr̥ṇántas te kukṣī́ vardhayantu- itthā́ sutáḥ paurá índram āva
stanzas.translation: Drink thou, O Hero Indra, drink the Soma; let the joy-giving juices make thee joyful. They, filling both thy flanks, shall swell thy vigour. The juice that satisfies hath helped Indra.

translations.griffith: Drink thou, O Hero Indra, drink the Soma; let the joy-giving juices make thee joyful. They, filling both thy flanks, shall swell thy vigour. The juice that satisfies hath helped Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे इ॒न्द्राप्य॑भूम॒ विप्रा॒ धियं॑ वनेम ऋत॒या सप॑न्तः अ॒व॒स्यवो॑ धीमहि॒ प्रश॑स्तिं स॒द्यस्ते॑ रा॒यो दा॒वने॑ स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: tvé indrā́py abhūma víprāḥ- dhíyaṃ vanema r̥tayā́ sápantaḥ avasyávo dhīmahi práśastiṃ sadyás te rāyó dāváne syāma
stanzas.translation: Singers have we become with thee, O Indra: may we serve duly and prepare devotion. Seeking thy help we meditate thy praises: may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.

translations.griffith: Singers have we become with thee, O Indra: may we serve duly and prepare devotion. Seeking thy help we meditate thy praises: may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्याम॒ ते त॑ इन्द्र॒ ये त॑ ऊ॒ती अ॑व॒स्यव॒ ऊर्जं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्तः शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मं॒ यं चा॒कना॑म देवा॒स्मे र॒यिं रा॑सि वी॒रव॑न्तम्
stanzas.transliteration: syā́ma té ta indra yé ta ūtī́ avasyáva ū́rjaṃ vardháyantaḥ śuṣmíntamaṃ yáṃ cākánāma deva- -asmé rayíṃ rāsi vīrávantam
stanzas.translation: May we be thine, such by thy help, O Indra, as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour. Give us, thou God, the riches that we long for, most powerful, with stare of noble children.

translations.griffith: May we be thine, such by thy help, O Indra, as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour. Give us, thou God, the riches that we long for, most powerful, with stare of noble children.

stanzas.sanskrit: रासि॒ क्षयं॒ रासि॑ मि॒त्रम॒स्मे रासि॒ शर्ध॑ इन्द्र॒ मारु॑तं नः स॒जोष॑सो॒ ये च॑ मन्दसा॒नाः प्र वा॒यवः॑ पा॒न्त्यग्र॑णीतिम्
stanzas.transliteration: rā́si kṣáyaṃ rā́si mitrám asmé rā́si śárdha indra mā́rutaṃ naḥ sajóṣaso yé ca mandasānā́ḥ prá vāyávaḥ pānty ágraṇītim
stanzas.translation: Give us a friend, give us an habitation; Indra, give us the company of Maruts, And those whose minds accord with theirs, the Vâyus, who drink the first libation of the Soma.

translations.griffith: Give us a friend, give us an habitation; Indra, give us the company of Maruts, And those whose minds accord with theirs, the Vâyus, who drink the first libation of the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्यन्त्विन्नु येषु॑ मन्दसा॒नस्तृ॒पत्सोमं॑ पाहि द्र॒ह्यदि॑न्द्र अ॒स्मान्त्सु पृ॒त्स्वा त॑रु॒त्राव॑र्धयो॒ द्यां बृ॒हद्भि॑र॒र्कैः
stanzas.transliteration: vyántv ín nú yéṣu mandasānás tr̥pát sómam pāhi drahyád indra asmā́n sú pr̥tsv ā́ tarutra- -ávardhayo dyā́m br̥hádbhir arkaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted. Indra, drink Soma for thy strength and gladness. Thou hast exalted us to heaven, Preserver, in battles, through the lofty hymns that praise thee.

translations.griffith: Let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted. Indra, drink Soma for thy strength and gladness. Thou hast exalted us to heaven, Preserver, in battles, through the lofty hymns that praise thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृ॒हन्त॒ इन्नु ये ते॑ तरुत्रो॒क्थेभि॑र्वा सु॒म्नमा॒विवा॑सान् स्तृ॒णा॒नासो॑ ब॒र्हिः प॒स्त्या॑व॒त्त्वोता॒ इदि॑न्द्र॒ वाज॑मग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: br̥hánta ín nú yé te tarutra- -ukthébhir vā sumnám āvívāsān str̥ṇānā́so barhíḥ pastyā̀vat tvótā íd indra vā́jam agman
stanzas.translation: Great, verily, are they, O thou Protector, who by their songs of praise have won the blessing. They who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling, helped by thee have got them strength, O Indra.

translations.griffith: Great, verily, are they, O thou Protector, who by their songs of praise have won the blessing. They who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling, helped by thee have got them strength, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ग्रेष्विन्नु शू॑र मन्दसा॒नस्त्रिक॑द्रुकेषु पाहि॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र प्र॒दोधु॑व॒च्छ्मश्रु॑षु प्रीणा॒नो या॒हि हरि॑भ्यां सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: ugréṣv ín nú śūra mandasānás tríkadrukeṣu pāhi sómam indra pradódhuvac chmáśruṣu prīṇānó yāhí háribhyāṃ sutásya pītím
stanzas.translation: Upon the great Trikadruka days, Hero, rejoicing thee, O Indra, drink the Soma. Come with Bay Steeds to drink of libation, shaking the drops from out thy beard, contented.

translations.griffith: Upon the great Trikadruka days, Hero, rejoicing thee, O Indra, drink the Soma. Come with Bay Steeds to drink of libation, shaking the drops from out thy beard, contented.

stanzas.sanskrit: धि॒ष्वा शवः॑ शूर॒ येन॑ वृ॒त्रम॒वाभि॑न॒द्दानु॑मौर्णवा॒भम् अपा॑वृणो॒र्ज्योति॒रार्या॑य॒ नि स॑व्य॒तः सा॑दि॒ दस्यु॑रिन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: dhiṣvā́ śávaḥ śūra yéna vr̥trám avā́bhinad dā́num aurṇavābhám ápāvr̥ṇor jyótir ā́ryāya ní savyatáḥ sādi dásyur indra
stanzas.translation: Hero, assume the might wherewith thou clavest Vr̥itra piecemeal, the Dânava Aurṇavâbha. Thou hast disclosed the light to light the Arya: on thy left hand, O Indra, sank the Dasyu.

translations.griffith: Hero, assume the might wherewith thou clavest Vr̥itra piecemeal, the Dânava Aurṇavâbha. Thou hast disclosed the light to light the Arya: on thy left hand, O Indra, sank the Dasyu.

stanzas.sanskrit: सने॑म॒ ये त॑ ऊ॒तिभि॒स्तर॑न्तो॒ विश्वाः॒ स्पृध॒ आर्ये॑ण॒ दस्यू॑न् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तत्त्वा॒ष्ट्रं वि॒श्वरू॑प॒मर॑न्धयः सा॒ख्यस्य॑ त्रि॒ताय॑
stanzas.transliteration: sánema yé ta ūtíbhis táranto víśvā spŕ̥dha ā́ryeṇa dásyūn asmábhyaṃ tát tvāṣṭráṃ viśvárūpam árandhayaḥ sākhyásya tritā́ya
stanzas.translation: May we gain wealth, subduing with thy succour and with the Ârya, all our foes, the Dasyus. Our gain was that to Trita of our party thou gavest up Tvashṭar's son Viṣvarûpâ.

translations.griffith: May we gain wealth, subduing with thy succour and with the Ârya, all our foes, the Dasyus. Our gain was that to Trita of our party thou gavest up Tvashṭar's son Viṣvarûpâ.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य सु॑वा॒नस्य॑ म॒न्दिन॑स्त्रि॒तस्य॒ न्यर्बु॑दं वावृधा॒नो अ॑स्तः अव॑र्तय॒त्सूर्यो॒ न च॒क्रं भि॒नद्व॒लमिन्द्रो॒ अङ्गि॑रस्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: asyá suvānásya mandínas tritásya ny árbudaṃ vāvr̥dhānó astaḥ ávartayat sū́ryo ná cakrám bhinád valám índro áṅgirasvān
stanzas.translation: He cast down Arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by Trita. Indra sent forth his whirling wheel like Sûrya, and aided by the Angirases rent Vala.

translations.griffith: He cast down Arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by Trita. Indra sent forth his whirling wheel like Sûrya, and aided by the Angirases rent Vala.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in the assembly.

translations.griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in the assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो जा॒त ए॒व प्र॑थ॒मो मन॑स्वान्दे॒वो दे॒वान्क्रतु॑ना प॒र्यभू॑षत् यस्य॒ शुष्मा॒द्रोद॑सी॒ अभ्य॑सेतां नृ॒म्णस्य॑ म॒ह्ना स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó jātá evá prathamó mánasvān devó devā́n krátunā paryábhūṣat yásya śúṣmād ródasī ábhyasetāṃ nr̥mṇásya mahnā́ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods' protector, Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods' protector, Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: He who just born as chief god full of spirit Went far beyond the other gods in wisdom: Before whose majesty and mighty manhood The two worlds trembled: he, O men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः पृ॑थि॒वीं व्यथ॑माना॒मदृं॑ह॒द्यः पर्व॑ता॒न्प्रकु॑पिताँ॒ अर॑म्णात् यो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं विम॒मे वरी॑यो॒ यो द्यामस्त॑भ्ना॒त्स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ vyáthamānām ádr̥ṃhad yáḥ párvatān prákupitām̐ áramṇāt yó antárikṣaṃ vimamé várīyo yó dyā́m ástabhnāt sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains, Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains, Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Who made the widespread earth when quaking steadfast, Who set at rest the agitated mountains, Who measured out air's middle space more widely, Who gave the sky support: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो ह॒त्वाहि॒मरि॑णात्स॒प्त सिन्धू॒न्यो गा उ॒दाज॑दप॒धा व॒लस्य॑ यो अश्म॑नोर॒न्तर॒ग्निं ज॒जान॑ सं॒वृक्स॒मत्सु॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó hatvā́him áriṇāt saptá síndhūn yó gā́ udā́jad apadhā́ valásya yó áśmanor antár agníṃ jajā́na saṃvŕ̥k samátsu sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala, Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors' battle, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala, Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors' battle, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Who slew the serpent, freed the seven rivers, Who drove the cattle out from Vala's cavern. Who fire between two rocks has generated, A conqueror in fights: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: येने॒मा विश्वा॒ च्यव॑ना कृ॒तानि॒ यो दासं॒ वर्ण॒मध॑रं॒ गुहाकः॑ श्व॒घ्नीव॒ यो जि॑गी॒वाँल्ल॒क्षमाद॑द॒र्यः पु॒ष्टानि॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yénemā́ víśvā cyávanā kr̥tā́ni yó dā́saṃ várṇam ádharaṃ gúhā́kaḥ śvaghnī́va yó jigīvā́m̐ lakṣám ā́dad aryáḥ puṣṭā́ni sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons, Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons, Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: He who has made all earthly things unstable, Who humbled and dispersed the Dāsa colour, Who, as the player's stake the winning gambler, The foeman's fortune gains: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं स्मा॑ पृ॒च्छन्ति॒ कुह॒ सेति॑ घो॒रमु॒तेमा॑हु॒र्नैषो अ॒स्तीत्ये॑नम् सो अ॒र्यः पु॒ष्टीर्विज॑ इ॒वा मि॑नाति॒ श्रद॑स्मै धत्त॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ smā pr̥chánti kúha séti ghorám utém āhur naíṣó astī́ty enam só aryáḥ puṣṭī́r víja ivā́ mināti śrád asmai dhatta sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Of whom, the Terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not. He sweeps away, like birds, the foe's possessions. Have faith in him, for He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: Of whom, the Terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not. He sweeps away, like birds, the foe's possessions. Have faith in him, for He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Of whom, the terrible, they ask, "Where is he?" Of him, indeed, they also say, "He is not." The foemen's wealth, like players' stakes, he lessens. Believe in him: for he, O men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो र॒ध्रस्य॑ चोदि॒ता यः कृ॒शस्य॒ यो ब्र॒ह्मणो॒ नाध॑मानस्य की॒रेः यु॒क्तग्रा॑व्णो॒ यो॑ऽवि॒ता सु॑शि॒प्रः सु॒तसो॑मस्य॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó radhrásya coditā́ yáḥ kr̥śásya yó brahmáṇo nā́dhamānasya kīréḥ yuktágrāvṇo yó 'vitā́ suśipráḥ sutásomasya sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises; Who, fair-faced, favours him who presses Soma with stones made ready, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises; Who, fair-faced, favours him who presses Soma with stones made ready, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: He furthers worshippers, both rich and needy, And priests that supplicate his aid and praise him. Who, fair-lipped, helps the man that presses Soma, That sets the stones at work: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्याश्वा॑सः प्र॒दिशि॒ यस्य॒ गावो॒ यस्य॒ ग्रामा॒ यस्य॒ विश्वे॒ रथा॑सः यः सूर्यं॒ य उ॒षसं॑ ज॒जान॒ यो अ॒पां ने॒ता स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásyā́śvāsaḥ pradíśi yásya gā́vo yásya grā́mā yásya víśve ráthāsaḥ yáḥ sū́ryaṃ yá uṣásaṃ jajā́na yó apā́ṃ netā́ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the villages, and cattle; He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the villages, and cattle; He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: In whose control are horses and all chariots, In whose control are villages and cattle; He who has generated sun and morning, Who leads the waters: he, O men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं क्रन्द॑सी संय॒ती वि॒ह्वये॑ते॒ परेऽव॑र उ॒भया॑ अ॒मित्राः॑ स॒मा॒नं चि॒द्रथ॑मातस्थि॒वांसा॒ नाना॑ हवेते॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ krándasī saṃyatī́ vihváyete páré 'vara ubháyā amítrāḥ samānáṃ cid rátham ātasthivā́ṃsā nā́nā havete sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: To whom two armies cry in close encounter, both enemies, the stronger and the weaker; Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: To whom two armies cry in close encounter, both enemies, the stronger and the weaker; Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Whom two contending armies vie in calling, On both sides foes, the farther and the nearer; Two fighters mounted on the self-same chariot Invoke him variously: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्मा॒न्न ऋ॒ते वि॒जय॑न्ते॒ जना॑सो॒ यं युध्य॑माना॒ अव॑से॒ हव॑न्ते यो विश्व॑स्य प्रति॒मानं॑ ब॒भूव॒ यो अ॑च्युत॒च्युत्स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásmān ná r̥té vijáyante jánāso yáṃ yúdhyamānā ávase hávante yó víśvasya pratimā́nam babhū́va yó acyutacyút sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Without whose help our people never conquer; whom, battling, they invoke to give them succour; He of whom all this world is but the copy, who shakes things moveless, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: Without whose help our people never conquer; whom, battling, they invoke to give them succour; He of whom all this world is but the copy, who shakes things moveless, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Without whose aid men conquer not in battle, Whom fighting ever they invoke for succour, Who shows himself a match for every foeman, Who moves what is unmoved: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः शश्व॑तो॒ मह्येनो॒ दधा॑ना॒नम॑न्यमाना॒ञ्छर्वा॑ ज॒घान॑ यः शर्ध॑ते॒ नानु॒ददा॑ति शृ॒ध्यां यो दस्यो॑र्ह॒न्ता स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ śáśvato máhy éno dádhānān ámanyamānāñ chárvā jaghā́na yáḥ śárdhate nā́nudádāti śr̥dhyā́ṃ yó dásyor hantā́ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: He who hath smitten, ere they knew their danger, with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners; Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyti, He, O men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: He who hath smitten, ere they knew their danger, with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners; Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyti, He, O men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Who with his arrow slays the unexpecting Unnumbered crew of gravely guilty sinners; Who yields not to the boasting foe in boldness, Who slays the demons: he, O men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः शम्ब॑रं॒ पर्व॑तेषु क्षि॒यन्तं॑ चत्वारिं॒श्यां श॒रद्य॒न्ववि॑न्दत् ओ॒जा॒यमा॑नं॒ यो अहिं॑ ज॒घान॒ दानुं॒ शया॑नं॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ śámbaram párvateṣu kṣiyántaṃ catvāriṃśyā́ṃ śarády anvávindat ojāyámānaṃ yó áhiṃ jaghā́na dā́nuṃ śáyānaṃ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Ṣambara as he dwelt among the mountains; Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Ṣambara as he dwelt among the mountains; Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: He who detected in the fortieth autumn Śambara dwelling far among the mountains; Who slew the serpent that put forth his vigour. The demon as he lay: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः स॒प्तर॑श्मिर्वृष॒भस्तुवि॑ष्मान॒वासृ॑ज॒त्सर्त॑वे स॒प्त सिन्धू॑न् यो रौ॑हि॒णमस्फु॑र॒द्वज्र॑बाहु॒र्द्यामा॒रोह॑न्तं॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ saptáraśmir vr̥ṣabhás túviṣmān avā́sr̥jat sártave saptá síndhūn yó rauhiṇám ásphurad vájrabāhur dyā́m āróhantaṃ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Who with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the Mighty, set free the Seven great Floods to flow at pleasure; Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: Who with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the Mighty, set free the Seven great Floods to flow at pleasure; Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Who with his seven rays, the bull, the mighty, Let loose the seven streams to flow in torrents; Who, bolt in arm, spurned Rauhiṇa, the demon, On scaling heaven bent: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यावा॑ चिदस्मै पृथि॒वी न॑मेते॒ शुष्मा॑च्चिदस्य॒ पर्व॑ता भयन्ते यः सो॑म॒पा नि॑चि॒तो वज्र॑बाहु॒र्यो वज्र॑हस्तः॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dyā́vā cid asmai pr̥thivī́ namete śúṣmāc cid asya párvatā bhayante yáḥ somapā́ nicitó vájrabāhur yó vájrahastaḥ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Even the Heaven and Earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble. Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, who wields the bolt, He, O ye men, is Indra.

translations.griffith: Even the Heaven and Earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble. Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, who wields the bolt, He, O ye men, is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Both Heaven and Earth, themselves, bow down before him: Before his might the very mountains tremble, Who, famed as Soma-drinker, armed with lightning, Is wielder of the bolt: he, men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः सु॒न्वन्त॒मव॑ति॒ यः पच॑न्तं॒ यः शंस॑न्तं॒ यः श॑शमा॒नमू॒ती यस्य॒ ब्रह्म॒ वर्ध॑नं॒ यस्य॒ सोमो॒ यस्ये॒दं राधः॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ sunvántam ávati yáḥ pácantaṃ yáḥ śáṃsantaṃ yáḥ śaśamānám ūtī́ yásya bráhma várdhanaṃ yásya sómo yásyedáṃ rā́dhaḥ sá janāsa índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer. Whom prayer exalts, and pouring forth of Soma, and this our gift, He, O ye men, Is Indra.

translations.griffith: Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer. Whom prayer exalts, and pouring forth of Soma, and this our gift, He, O ye men, Is Indra.
translations.macdonell: Who with his aid helps him that presses Soma, That bakes and lauds and ever sacrifices; Whom swelling prayer, whom Soma pressings strengthen, And now this offering: he, O men, is Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः सु॑न्व॒ते पच॑ते दु॒ध्र आ चि॒द्वाजं॒ दर्द॑र्षि॒ स किला॑सि स॒त्यः व॒यं त॑ इन्द्र वि॒श्वह॑ प्रि॒यासः॑ सु॒वीरा॑सो वि॒दथ॒मा व॑देम
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ sunvaté pácate dudhrá ā́ cid vā́jaṃ dárdarṣi sá kílāsi satyáḥ vayáṃ ta indra viśváha priyā́saḥ suvī́rāso vidátham ā́ vadema
stanzas.translation: Thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation. So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.

translations.griffith: Thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation. So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.
translations.macdonell: Who, fierce, on him that bakes and him that presses Bestowest booty: thou, indeed, art trusted. May we, for ever dear to thee, O Indra, Endowed with hero sons address the synod.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तुर्जनि॑त्री॒ तस्या॑ अ॒पस्परि॑ म॒क्षू जा॒त आवि॑श॒द्यासु॒ वर्ध॑ते तदा॑ह॒ना अ॑भवत्पि॒प्युषी॒ पयों॒ऽशोः पी॒यूषं॑ प्रथ॒मं तदु॒क्थ्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥túr jánitrī tásyā apás pári makṣū́ jātá ā́viśad yā́su várdhate tád āhanā́ abhavat pipyúṣī páyo -aṃśóḥ pīyū́ṣam prathamáṃ tád ukthyàm
stanzas.translation: THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows. Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.

translations.griffith: THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows. Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒ध्रीमा य॑न्ति॒ परि॒ बिभ्र॑तीः॒ पयो॑ वि॒श्वप्स्न्या॑य॒ प्र भ॑रन्त॒ भोज॑नम् स॒मा॒नो अध्वा॑ प्र॒वता॑मनु॒ष्यदे॒ यस्ताकृ॑णोः प्रथ॒मं सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sadhrī́m ā́ yanti pári bíbhratīḥ páyo viśvápsnyāya prá bharanta bhójanam samānó ádhvā pravátām anuṣyáde yás tā́kr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all. The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

translations.griffith: They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all. The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: अन्वेको॑ वदति॒ यद्ददा॑ति॒ तद्रू॒पा मि॒नन्तद॑पा॒ एक॑ ईयते विश्वा॒ एक॑स्य वि॒नुद॑स्तितिक्षते॒ यस्ताकृ॑णोः प्रथ॒मं सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ánv éko vadati yád dádāti tád rūpā́ minán tádapā éka īyate víśvā ékasya vinúdas titikṣate yás tā́kr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task, The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

translations.griffith: One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task, The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒जाभ्यः॑ पु॒ष्टिं वि॒भज॑न्त आसते र॒यिमि॑व पृ॒ष्ठं प्र॒भव॑न्तमाय॒ते असि॑न्व॒न्दंष्ट्रैः॑ पि॒तुर॑त्ति॒ भोज॑नं॒ यस्ताकृ॑णोः प्रथ॒मं सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prajā́bhyaḥ puṣṭíṃ vibhájanta āsate rayím iva pr̥ṣṭhám prabhávantam āyaté ásinvan dáṃṣṭraiḥ pitúr atti bhójanaṃ yás tā́kr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear. Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

translations.griffith: Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear. Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑कृणोः पृथि॒वीं सं॒दृशे॑ दि॒वे यो धौ॑ती॒नाम॑हिह॒न्नारि॑णक्प॒थः तं त्वा॒ स्तोमे॑भिरु॒दभि॒र्न वा॒जिनं॑ दे॒वं दे॒वा अ॑जन॒न्त्सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádhākr̥ṇoḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ saṃdŕ̥śe divé yó dhautīnā́m ahihann ā́riṇak patháḥ táṃ tvā stómebhir udábhir ná vājínaṃ deváṃ devā́ ajanan sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths. Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.

translations.griffith: Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths. Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो भोज॑नं च॒ दय॑से च॒ वर्ध॑नमा॒र्द्रादा शुष्कं॒ मधु॑मद्दु॒दोहि॑थ स शे॑व॒धिं नि द॑धिषे वि॒वस्व॑ति॒ विश्व॒स्यैक॑ ईशिषे॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó bhójanaṃ ca dáyase ca várdhanam ārdrā́d ā́ śúṣkam mádhumad dudóhitha sá śevadhíṃ ní dadhiṣe vivásvati víśvasyaíka īśiṣe sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets. Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.

translations.griffith: Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets. Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः पु॒ष्पिणी॑श्च प्र॒स्व॑श्च॒ धर्म॒णाधि॒ दाने॒ व्य१॒॑वनी॒रधा॑रयः यश्चास॑मा॒ अज॑नो दि॒द्युतो॑ दि॒व उ॒रुरू॒र्वाँ अ॒भितः॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ puṣpíṇīś ca prasvàś ca dhármaṇā- -ádhi dā́ne vy àvánīr ádhārayaḥ yáś cā́samā ájano didyúto divé- urúr ūrvā́m̐ abhítaḥ sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed; Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,– vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.

translations.griffith: Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed; Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,– vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो ना॑र्म॒रं स॒हव॑सुं॒ निह॑न्तवे पृ॒क्षाय॑ च दा॒सवे॑शाय॒ चाव॑हः ऊ॒र्जय॑न्त्या॒ अप॑रिविष्टमा॒स्य॑मु॒तैवाद्य पु॑रुकृ॒त्सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó nārmaráṃ sahávasuṃ níhantave pr̥kṣā́ya ca dāsáveśāya cā́vahaḥ ūrjáyantyā ápariviṣṭam āsyàm utaívā́dyá purukr̥t sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Who broughtest Nârmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed, Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.

translations.griffith: Who broughtest Nârmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed, Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒तं वा॒ यस्य॒ दश॑ सा॒कमाद्य॒ एक॑स्य श्रु॒ष्टौ यद्ध॑ चो॒दमावि॑थ अ॒र॒ज्जौ दस्यू॒न्त्समु॑नब्द॒भीत॑ये सुप्रा॒व्यो॑ अभवः॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: śatáṃ vā yásya dáśa sākám ā́dyaḥ- ékasya śruṣṭaú yád dha codám ā́vitha arajjaú dásyūn sám unab dabhī́taye suprāvyò abhavaḥ sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou boundest up the Dâsa's hundred friends and ten, when, at one's hearing, thou belpest thy worshipper. Thou for Dabhîti boundest Dasyus not with cords; Thou wast a mighty help. Worthy of lauds art thou.

translations.griffith: Thou boundest up the Dâsa's hundred friends and ten, when, at one's hearing, thou belpest thy worshipper. Thou for Dabhîti boundest Dasyus not with cords; Thou wast a mighty help. Worthy of lauds art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वेदनु॑ रोध॒ना अ॑स्य॒ पौंस्यं॑ द॒दुर॑स्मै दधि॒रे कृ॒त्नवे॒ धन॑म् षळ॑स्तभ्ना वि॒ष्टिरः॒ पञ्च॑ सं॒दृशः॒ परि॑ प॒रो अ॑भवः॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśvéd ánu rodhanā́ asya paúṃsyaṃ dadúr asmai dadhiré kr̥tnáve dhánam ṣáḷ astabhnā viṣṭíraḥ páñca saṃdŕ̥śaḥ pári paró abhavaḥ sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: All banks of rivers yielded to his manly might; to him they gave, to him, the Strong, gave up their wealth. The six directions hast thou fixed, a five-fold view: thy victories reached afar. Worthy of lauds art thou.

translations.griffith: All banks of rivers yielded to his manly might; to him they gave, to him, the Strong, gave up their wealth. The six directions hast thou fixed, a five-fold view: thy victories reached afar. Worthy of lauds art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒प्र॒वा॒च॒नं तव॑ वीर वी॒र्यं१॒॑ यदेके॑न॒ क्रतु॑ना वि॒न्दसे॒ वसु॑ जा॒तूष्ठि॑रस्य॒ प्र वयः॒ सह॑स्वतो॒ या च॒कर्थ॒ सेन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑स्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: supravācanáṃ táva vīra vīryàṃ yád ékena krátunā vindáse vásu jātū́ṣṭhirasya prá váyaḥ sáhasvato yā́ cakártha séndra víśvāsy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Meet for high praise, O Hero, is thy power, that with thy single wisdom thou obtainest wealth, The life-support of conquering Jatusthira. Indra, for all thy deeds, worthy of lauds art thou.

translations.griffith: Meet for high praise, O Hero, is thy power, that with thy single wisdom thou obtainest wealth, The life-support of conquering Jatusthira. Indra, for all thy deeds, worthy of lauds art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: अर॑मयः॒ सर॑पस॒स्तरा॑य॒ कं तु॒र्वीत॑ये च व॒य्या॑य च स्रु॒तिम् नी॒चा सन्त॒मुद॑नयः परा॒वृजं॒ प्रान्धं श्रो॒णं श्र॒वय॒न्त्सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áramayaḥ sárapasas tárāya káṃ turvī́taye ca vayyā̀ya ca srutím nīcā́ sántam úd anayaḥ parāvŕ̥jam prā́ndháṃ śroṇáṃ śraváyan sā́sy ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou for Turvîti heldest still the flowing floods, the river-stream for Vayya easily to pass Didst raise the outcast from the depths, and gavest fame unto the halt and blind. Worthy of lauds art thou.

translations.griffith: Thou for Turvîti heldest still the flowing floods, the river-stream for Vayya easily to pass Didst raise the outcast from the depths, and gavest fame unto the halt and blind. Worthy of lauds art thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्व॑सो दा॒नाय॒ राधः॒ सम॑र्थयस्व ब॒हु ते॑ वस॒व्य॑म् इन्द्र॒ यच्चि॒त्रं श्र॑व॒स्या अनु॒ द्यून्बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tád vaso dānā́ya rā́dhaḥ sám arthayasva bahú te vasavyàm índra yác citráṃ śravasyā́ ánu dyū́n br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Prepare thyself to grant us that great bounty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Snatch up the wonderful, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Prepare thyself to grant us that great bounty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Snatch up the wonderful, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ भर॒तेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोम॒माम॑त्रेभिः सिञ्चता॒ मद्य॒मन्धः॑ का॒मी हि वी॒रः सद॑मस्य पी॒तिं जु॒होत॒ वृष्णे॒ तदिदे॒ष व॑ष्टि
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo bháraténdrāya sómam ā́matrebhiḥ siñcatā mádyam ándhaḥ kāmī́ hí vīráḥ sádam asya pītíṃ juhóta vŕ̥ṣṇe tád íd eṣá vaṣṭi
stanzas.translation: MINISTERS, bring the Soma juice for Indra, pour forth the gladdening liquor with the beakers.logeth ever To drink of this the Hero offer it to the Bull, for this he willeth.

translations.griffith: MINISTERS, bring the Soma juice for Indra, pour forth the gladdening liquor with the beakers.logeth ever To drink of this the Hero offer it to the Bull, for this he willeth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यो अ॒पो व॑व्रि॒वांसं॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॒घाना॒शन्ये॑व वृ॒क्षम् तस्मा॑ ए॒तं भ॑रत तद्व॒शायँ॑ ए॒ष इन्द्रो॑ अर्हति पी॒तिम॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yó apó vavrivā́ṃsaṃ vr̥tráṃ jaghā́nāśányeva vr̥kṣám tásmā etám bharata tadvaśā́yam̐ eṣá índro arhati pītím asya
stanzas.translation: Ye ministers, to him who with the lightning smote, like a tree, the rain-withholding Vr̥itra- Bring it to him, him who is fain to taste it, a draught of this which Indra here deserveth.

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who with the lightning smote, like a tree, the rain-withholding Vr̥itra- Bring it to him, him who is fain to taste it, a draught of this which Indra here deserveth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यो दृभी॑कं ज॒घान॒ यो गा उ॒दाज॒दप॒ हि व॒लं वः तस्मा॑ ए॒तम॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ न वात॒मिन्द्रं॒ सोमै॒रोर्णु॑त॒ जूर्न वस्त्रैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yó dŕ̥bhīkaṃ jaghā́na yó gā́ udā́jad ápa hí valáṃ váḥ tásmā etám antárikṣe ná vā́tam índraṃ sómair órṇuta jū́r ná vástraiḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye ministers, to him who smote Dr̥ibhîkas who drove the kine forth, and discovered Vala, Offer this draught, like Vita in the region: clothe him with Soma even as steeds with trappings.

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who smote Dr̥ibhîkas who drove the kine forth, and discovered Vala, Offer this draught, like Vita in the region: clothe him with Soma even as steeds with trappings.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ य उर॑णं ज॒घान॒ नव॑ च॒ख्वांसं॑ नव॒तिं च॑ बा॒हून् यो अर्बु॑द॒मव॑ नी॒चा ब॑बा॒धे तमिन्द्रं॒ सोम॑स्य भृ॒थे हि॑नोत
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yá úraṇaṃ jaghā́na náva cakhvā́ṃsaṃ navatíṃ ca bāhū́n yó árbudam áva nīcā́ babādhé tám índraṃ sómasya bhr̥thé hinota
stanzas.translation: Him who did Uraṇa to death, Adhvaryus! though showing arms ninety-and-nine in number; Who cast down headlong Arbuda and slew him,– speed ye that Indra to our offered Soma.

translations.griffith: Him who did Uraṇa to death, Adhvaryus! though showing arms ninety-and-nine in number; Who cast down headlong Arbuda and slew him,– speed ye that Indra to our offered Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यः स्वश्नं॑ ज॒घान॒ यः शुष्ण॑म॒शुषं॒ यो व्यं॑सम् यः पिप्रुं॒ नमु॑चिं॒ यो रु॑धि॒क्रां तस्मा॒ इन्द्रा॒यान्ध॑सो जुहोत
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yáḥ sv áśnaṃ jaghā́na yáḥ śúṣṇam aśúṣaṃ yó vyàṃsam yáḥ pípruṃ námuciṃ yó rudhikrā́ṃ tásmā índrāyā́ndhaso juhota
stanzas.translation: Ye ministers, to him who struck down Svaṣna, and did to death Vyansa and greedy Ṣushṇa, And Rudhikrâs and Namuchi and Pipru,– to him, to Indra, pour ye forth libation.

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who struck down Svaṣna, and did to death Vyansa and greedy Ṣushṇa, And Rudhikrâs and Namuchi and Pipru,– to him, to Indra, pour ye forth libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यः श॒तं शम्ब॑रस्य॒ पुरो॑ बि॒भेदाश्म॑नेव पू॒र्वीः यो व॒र्चिनः॑ श॒तमिन्द्रः॑ स॒हस्र॑म॒पाव॑प॒द्भर॑ता॒ सोम॑मस्मै
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yáḥ śatáṃ śámbarasya púro bibhédā́śmaneva pūrvī́ḥ yó varcínaḥ śatám índraḥ sahásram apā́vapad bháratā sómam asmai
stanzas.translation: Ye ministers, to him who as with thunder demolished Ṣambara's hundred ancient castles; Who cast down Varcin's sons, a hundred thousand,– to him, to Indra, offer ye the Soma.

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who as with thunder demolished Ṣambara's hundred ancient castles; Who cast down Varcin's sons, a hundred thousand,– to him, to Indra, offer ye the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यः श॒तमा स॒हस्रं॒ भूम्या॑ उ॒पस्थेऽव॑पज्जघ॒न्वान् कुत्स॑स्या॒योर॑तिथि॒ग्वस्य॑ वी॒रान्न्यावृ॑ण॒ग्भर॑ता॒ सोम॑मस्मै
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yáḥ śatám ā́ sahásram bhū́myā upásthé 'vapaj jaghanvā́n kútsasyāyór atithigvásya vīrā́n ny ā́vr̥ṇag bháratā sómam asmai
stanzas.translation: Ye ministers, to him who slew a hundred thousand, and cast them down upon earth's bosom; Who quelled the valiant men of Âtithigva, Kutsa, and Âyu,– bring to him the Soma.

translations.griffith: Ye ministers, to him who slew a hundred thousand, and cast them down upon earth's bosom; Who quelled the valiant men of Âtithigva, Kutsa, and Âyu,– bring to him the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यन्न॑रः का॒मया॑ध्वे श्रु॒ष्टी वह॑न्तो नशथा॒ तदिन्द्रे॑ गभ॑स्तिपूतं भरत श्रु॒तायेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॑ यज्यवो जुहोत
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yán naraḥ kāmáyādhve śruṣṭī́ váhanto naśathā tád índre gábhastipūtam bharata śrutā́ya- -índrāya sómaṃ yajyavo juhota
stanzas.translation: Ministers, men, whatever thing ye long for obtain ye quickly bringing gifts to Indra. Bring to the Glorious One what bands have cleansed; to Indra bring, ye pious ones, the Soma.

translations.griffith: Ministers, men, whatever thing ye long for obtain ye quickly bringing gifts to Indra. Bring to the Glorious One what bands have cleansed; to Indra bring, ye pious ones, the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवः॒ कर्त॑ना श्रु॒ष्टिम॑स्मै॒ वने॒ निपू॑तं॒ वन॒ उन्न॑यध्वम् जु॒षा॒णो हस्त्य॑म॒भि वा॑वशे व॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॑ मदि॒रं जु॑होत
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavaḥ kártanā śruṣṭím asmai váne nípūtaṃ vána ún nayadhvam juṣāṇó hástyam abhí vāvaśe vaḥ- índrāya sómam madiráṃ juhota
stanzas.translation: Do ye, O ministers, obey his order: that purified in wood, in wood uplift ye. Well pleased he longs for what your hands have tended: offer the gladdening Soma juice to Indra.

translations.griffith: Do ye, O ministers, obey his order: that purified in wood, in wood uplift ye. Well pleased he longs for what your hands have tended: offer the gladdening Soma juice to Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवः॒ पय॒सोध॒र्यथा॒ गोः सोमे॑भिरीं पृणता भो॒जमिन्द्र॑म् वेदा॒हम॑स्य॒ निभृ॑तं म ए॒तद्दित्स॑न्तं॒ भूयो॑ यज॒तश्चि॑केत
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavaḥ páyasódhar yáthā góḥ sómebhir īm pr̥ṇatā bhojám índram védāhám asya níbhr̥tam ma etád dítsantam bhū́yo yajatáś ciketa
stanzas.translation: As the cow's udder teems with milk, Adhvaryus, so fill with Soma Indra, liberal giver. I know him: I am sure of this, the Holy knows that I fain would give to him more largely.

translations.griffith: As the cow's udder teems with milk, Adhvaryus, so fill with Soma Indra, liberal giver. I know him: I am sure of this, the Holy knows that I fain would give to him more largely.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यो दि॒व्यस्य॒ वस्वो॒ यः पार्थि॑वस्य॒ क्षम्य॑स्य॒ राजा॑ तमूर्द॑रं॒ न पृ॑णता॒ यवे॒नेन्द्रं॒ सोमे॑भि॒स्तदपो॑ वो अस्तु
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yó divyásya vásvo yáḥ pā́rthivasya kṣámyasya rā́jā tám ū́rdaraṃ ná pr̥ṇatā yávena- -índraṃ sómebhis tád ápo vo astu
stanzas.translation: Him, ministers, the Lord of heavenly treasure and all terrestrial wealth that earth possesses, Him, Indra, fill with Soma as a garner is filled with barley full: be this your labour.

translations.griffith: Him, ministers, the Lord of heavenly treasure and all terrestrial wealth that earth possesses, Him, Indra, fill with Soma as a garner is filled with barley full: be this your labour.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्व॑सो दा॒नाय॒ राधः॒ सम॑र्थयस्व ब॒हु ते॑ वस॒व्य॑म् इन्द्र॒ यच्चि॒त्रं श्र॑व॒स्या अनु॒ द्यून्बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tád vaso dānā́ya rā́dhaḥ sám arthayasva bahú te vasavyàm índra yác citráṃ śravasyā́ ánu dyū́n br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Prepare thyself to grant us that great booty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Gather up wondrous wealth, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Prepare thyself to grant us that great booty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Gather up wondrous wealth, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र घा॒ न्व॑स्य मह॒तो म॒हानि॑ स॒त्या स॒त्यस्य॒ कर॑णानि वोचम् त्रिक॑द्रुकेष्वपिबत्सु॒तस्या॒स्य मदे॒ अहि॒मिन्द्रो॑ जघान
stanzas.transliteration: prá ghā nv àsya maható mahā́ni satyā́ satyásya káraṇāni vocam tríkadrukeṣv apibat sutásya -asyá máde áhim índro jaghāna
stanzas.translation: Now, verily, will I declare the exploits, mighty and true, of him the True and Mighty. In the Trikadrukas he drank the Soma then in its rapture Indra slew the Dragon.

translations.griffith: Now, verily, will I declare the exploits, mighty and true, of him the True and Mighty. In the Trikadrukas he drank the Soma then in its rapture Indra slew the Dragon.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒वं॒शे द्याम॑स्तभायद्बृ॒हन्त॒मा रोद॑सी अपृणद॒न्तरि॑क्षम् स धा॑रयत्पृथि॒वीं प॒प्रथ॑च्च॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: avaṃśé dyā́m astabhāyad br̥hántam ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇad antárikṣam sá dhārayat pr̥thivī́m papráthac ca sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: High heaven unsupported in space he stablished: he filled the two worlds and the air's mid-region. Earth he upheld, and gave it wide expansion. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: High heaven unsupported in space he stablished: he filled the two worlds and the air's mid-region. Earth he upheld, and gave it wide expansion. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: सद्मे॑व॒ प्राचो॒ वि मि॑माय॒ मानै॒र्वज्रे॑ण॒ खान्य॑तृणन्न॒दीना॑म् वृथा॑सृजत्प॒थिभि॑र्दीर्घया॒थैः सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: sádmeva prā́co ví mimāya mā́nair vájreṇa khā́ny atr̥ṇan nadī́nām vŕ̥thāsr̥jat pathíbhir dīrghayāthaíḥ sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: From front, as 'twere a house, he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers, And made them flow at ease by paths far-reaching, These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: From front, as 'twere a house, he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers, And made them flow at ease by paths far-reaching, These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: स प्र॑वो॒ळ्हॄन्प॑रि॒गत्या॑ द॒भीते॒र्विश्व॑मधा॒गायु॑धमि॒द्धे अ॒ग्नौ सं गोभि॒रश्वै॑रसृज॒द्रथे॑भिः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: sá pravoḷhr̥̄́n parigátyā dabhī́ter víśvam adhāg ā́yudham iddhé agnaú sáṃ góbhir áśvair asr̥jad ráthebhiḥ sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: Compassing those who bore away Dabhîti, in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons. And made him rich with kine and cars and horses. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: Compassing those who bore away Dabhîti, in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons. And made him rich with kine and cars and horses. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ईं॑ म॒हीं धुनि॒मेतो॑ररम्णा॒त्सो अ॑स्ना॒तॄन॑पारयत्स्व॒स्ति त उ॒त्स्नाय॑ र॒यिम॒भि प्र त॑स्थुः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: sá īm mahī́ṃ dhúnim étor aramṇāt só asnātr̥̄́n apārayat svastí tá utsnā́ya rayím abhí prá tasthuḥ sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: The mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing, and carried those who swam not safely over. They having crossed the stream attained to riches. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: The mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing, and carried those who swam not safely over. They having crossed the stream attained to riches. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोद॑ञ्चं॒ सिन्धु॑मरिणान्महि॒त्वा वज्रे॒णान॑ उ॒षसः॒ सं पि॑पेष अ॒ज॒वसो॑ ज॒विनी॑भिर्विवृ॒श्चन्त्सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: sódañcaṃ síndhum ariṇān mahitvā́ vájreṇā́na uṣásaḥ sám pipeṣa ajaváso javínībhir vivr̥ścán sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: With mighty power he made the stream flow upward, crushed with his thunderbolt the car of Ushas, Rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: With mighty power he made the stream flow upward, crushed with his thunderbolt the car of Ushas, Rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वि॒द्वाँ अ॑पगो॒हं क॒नीना॑मा॒विर्भव॒न्नुद॑तिष्ठत्परा॒वृक् प्रति॑ श्रो॒णः स्था॒द्व्य१॒॑नग॑चष्ट॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: sá vidvā́m̐ apagoháṃ kanī́nām āvír bhávann úd atiṣṭhat parāvŕ̥k práti śroṇá sthād vy ànág acaṣṭa sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: Knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding, the outcast showed himself and stood before them. The cripple stood erect, the blind beheld them. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: Knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding, the outcast showed himself and stood before them. The cripple stood erect, the blind beheld them. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: भि॒नद्व॒लमङ्गि॑रोभिर्गृणा॒नो वि पर्व॑तस्य दृंहि॒तान्यै॑रत् रि॒णग्रोधां॑सि कृ॒त्रिमा॑ण्येषां॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: bhinád valám áṅgirobhir gr̥ṇānó ví párvatasya dr̥ṃhitā́ny airat riṇág ródhāṃsi kr̥trímāṇy eṣāṃ sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: Praised by the Angirases he slaughtered Vala, and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain. He tore away their deftly-built defences. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: Praised by the Angirases he slaughtered Vala, and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain. He tore away their deftly-built defences. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्वप्ने॑ना॒भ्युप्या॒ चुमु॑रिं॒ धुनिं॑ च ज॒घन्थ॒ दस्युं॒ प्र द॒भीति॑मावः र॒म्भी चि॒दत्र॑ विविदे॒ हिर॑ण्यं॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: svápnenābhyúpyā cúmuriṃ dhúniṃ ca jaghántha dásyum prá dabhī́tim āvaḥ rambhī́ cid átra vivide híraṇyaṃ sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra
stanzas.translation: Thou, with sleep whelming Chumuri and Dhuni, slewest the Dasyu, keptest safe Dabhîti. There the staff-bearer found the golden treasure. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

translations.griffith: Thou, with sleep whelming Chumuri and Dhuni, slewest the Dasyu, keptest safe Dabhîti. There the staff-bearer found the golden treasure. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra , yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra , yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वः॑ स॒तां ज्येष्ठ॑तमाय सुष्टु॒तिम॒ग्नावि॑व समिधा॒ने ह॒विर्भ॑रे इन्द्र॑मजु॒र्यं ज॒रय॑न्तमुक्षि॒तं स॒नाद्युवा॑न॒मव॑से हवामहे
stanzas.transliteration: prá vaḥ satā́ṃ jyéṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutím agnā́v iva samidhāné havír bhare índram ajuryáṃ jaráyantam ukṣitáṃ sanā́d yúvānam ávase havāmahe
stanzas.translation: To him, your own, the best among the good, I bring eulogy, like oblation in the kindled fire. We invocate for help Indra untouched by eld, who maketh all decay, strengthened, for ever young.

translations.griffith: To him, your own, the best among the good, I bring eulogy, like oblation in the kindled fire. We invocate for help Indra untouched by eld, who maketh all decay, strengthened, for ever young.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्मा॒दिन्द्रा॑द्बृह॒तः किं च॒नेमृ॒ते विश्वा॑न्यस्मि॒न्त्सम्भृ॒ताधि॑ वी॒र्या॑ ज॒ठरे॒ सोमं॑ त॒न्वी॒३॒॑ सहो॒ महो॒ हस्ते॒ वज्रं॒ भर॑ति शी॒र्षणि॒ क्रतु॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yásmād índrād br̥hatáḥ kíṃ caném r̥té víśvāny asmin sámbhr̥tā́dhi vīryā̀ jaṭháre sómaṃ tanvī̀ sáho máho háste vájram bhárati śīrṣáṇi krátum
stanzas.translation: Without whom naught exists, Indra the Lofty One; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined. The Soma is within him, in his frame vast strength, the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head.

translations.griffith: Without whom naught exists, Indra the Lofty One; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined. The Soma is within him, in his frame vast strength, the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head.

stanzas.sanskrit: न क्षो॒णीभ्यां॑ परि॒भ्वे॑ त इन्द्रि॒यं न स॑मु॒द्रैः पर्व॑तैरिन्द्र ते॒ रथः॑ न ते॒ वज्र॒मन्व॑श्नोति॒ कश्च॒न यदा॒शुभिः॒ पत॑सि॒ योज॑ना पु॒रु
stanzas.transliteration: ná kṣoṇī́bhyām paribhvè ta indriyáṃ ná samudraíḥ párvatair indra te ráthaḥ ná te vájram ánv aśnoti káś caná yád āśúbhiḥ pátasi yójanā purú
stanzas.translation: Not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed, nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas. None cometh near, O Indra, to thy thunderbolt, when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league.

translations.griffith: Not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed, nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas. None cometh near, O Indra, to thy thunderbolt, when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॒ ह्य॑स्मै यज॒ताय॑ धृ॒ष्णवे॒ क्रतुं॒ भर॑न्ति वृष॒भाय॒ सश्च॑ते वृषा॑ यजस्व ह॒विषा॑ वि॒दुष्ट॑रः॒ पिबे॑न्द्र॒ सोमं॑ वृष॒भेण॑ भा॒नुना॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśve hy àsmai yajatā́ya dhr̥ṣṇáve krátum bháranti vr̥ṣabhā́ya sáścate vŕ̥ṣā yajasva havíṣā vidúṣṭaraḥ píbendra sómaṃ vr̥ṣabhéṇa bhānúnā
stanzas.translation: For all men bring their will to him the Resolute, to him the Holy One, to him the Strong they cleave. Pay worship with oblation, strong and passing wise. Drink thou the Soma, Indra, through the mighty blaze.

translations.griffith: For all men bring their will to him the Resolute, to him the Holy One, to him the Strong they cleave. Pay worship with oblation, strong and passing wise. Drink thou the Soma, Indra, through the mighty blaze.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृष्णः॒ कोशः॑ पवते॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिर्वृ॑ष॒भान्ना॑य वृष॒भाय॒ पात॑वे वृष॑णाध्व॒र्यू वृ॑ष॒भासो॒ अद्र॑यो॒ वृष॑णं॒ सोमं॑ वृष॒भाय॑ सुष्वति
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ kóśaḥ pavate mádhva ūrmír vr̥ṣabhā́nnāya vr̥ṣabhā́ya pā́tave vŕ̥ṣaṇādhvaryū́ vr̥ṣabhā́so ádrayo vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ sómaṃ vr̥ṣabhā́ya suṣvati
stanzas.translation: The vessel of the strong flows forth, the flood of meath, unto the Strong who feeds upon the strong, for drink, Strong are the two Adhvaryus, strong are both the stones. They press the Soma that is strong for him the Strong.

translations.griffith: The vessel of the strong flows forth, the flood of meath, unto the Strong who feeds upon the strong, for drink, Strong are the two Adhvaryus, strong are both the stones. They press the Soma that is strong for him the Strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॑ ते॒ वज्र॑ उ॒त ते॒ वृषा॒ रथो॒ वृष॑णा॒ हरी॑ वृष॒भाण्यायु॑धा वृष्णो॒ मद॑स्य वृषभ॒ त्वमी॑शिष॒ इन्द्र॒ सोम॑स्य वृष॒भस्य॑ तृप्णुहि
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā te vájra utá te vŕ̥ṣā rátho vŕ̥ṣaṇā hárī vr̥ṣabhā́ṇy ā́yudhā vŕ̥ṣṇo mádasya vr̥ṣabha tvám īśiṣe- índra sómasya vr̥ṣabhásya tr̥pṇuhi
stanzas.translation: Strong is thy thunderbolt, yea, and thy car is strong; strong are thy Bay Steeds and thy weapons powerful. Thou, Indra, Bull, art Lord of the strong gladdening drink. with the strong Soma, Indra, satisfy thyself.

translations.griffith: Strong is thy thunderbolt, yea, and thy car is strong; strong are thy Bay Steeds and thy weapons powerful. Thou, Indra, Bull, art Lord of the strong gladdening drink. with the strong Soma, Indra, satisfy thyself.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॒ नावं॒ न सम॑ने वच॒स्युवं॒ ब्रह्म॑णा यामि॒ सव॑नेषु॒ दाधृ॑षिः कु॒विन्नो॑ अ॒स्य वच॑सो नि॒बोधि॑ष॒दिन्द्र॒मुत्सं॒ न वसु॑नः सिचामहे
stanzas.transliteration: prá te nā́vaṃ ná sámane vacasyúvam bráhmaṇā yāmi sávaneṣu dā́dhr̥ṣiḥ kuvín no asyá vácaso nibódhiṣad índram útsaṃ ná vásunaḥ sicāmahe
stanzas.translation: I, bold by prayer, come near thee in thy sacred rites, thee like a saving ship, thee shouting in the war. Verily he will hear and mark this word of ours: we will pour Indra forth as 'twere a spring of wealth.

translations.griffith: I, bold by prayer, come near thee in thy sacred rites, thee like a saving ship, thee shouting in the war. Verily he will hear and mark this word of ours: we will pour Indra forth as 'twere a spring of wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रा स॑म्बा॒धाद॒भ्या व॑वृत्स्व नो धे॒नुर्न व॒त्सं यव॑सस्य पि॒प्युषी॑ स॒कृत्सु ते॑ सुम॒तिभिः॑ शतक्रतो॒ सं पत्नी॑भि॒र्न वृष॑णो नसीमहि
stanzas.transliteration: purā́ sambādhā́d abhy ā́ vavr̥tsva no dhenúr ná vatsáṃ yávasasya pipyúṣī sakŕ̥t sú te sumatíbhiḥ śatakrato sám pátnībhir ná vŕ̥ṣaṇo nasīmahi
stanzas.translation: Turn thee unto us ere calamity come nigh, as a cow full of pasture turns her to her calf. Lord of a Hundred Powers, may we once firmly cling to thy fair favours even as husbands to their wives.

translations.griffith: Turn thee unto us ere calamity come nigh, as a cow full of pasture turns her to her calf. Lord of a Hundred Powers, may we once firmly cling to thy fair favours even as husbands to their wives.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद॑स्मै॒ नव्य॑मङ्गिर॒स्वद॑र्चत॒ शुष्मा॒ यद॑स्य प्र॒त्नथो॒दीर॑ते विश्वा॒ यद्गो॒त्रा सह॑सा॒ परी॑वृता॒ मदे॒ सोम॑स्य दृंहि॒तान्यैर॑यत्
stanzas.transliteration: tád asmai návyam aṅgirasvád arcata śúṣmā yád asya pratnáthodī́rate víśvā yád gotrā́ sáhasā párīvr̥tā máde sómasya dr̥ṃhitā́ny aírayat
stanzas.translation: LIKE the Angirases, sing this new song forth to him, for, as in ancient days, his mighty powers are shown, When in the rapture of the Soma he unclosed with strength the solid firm-shut stables of the kine.

translations.griffith: LIKE the Angirases, sing this new song forth to him, for, as in ancient days, his mighty powers are shown, When in the rapture of the Soma he unclosed with strength the solid firm-shut stables of the kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: स भू॑तु॒ यो ह॑ प्रथ॒माय॒ धाय॑स॒ ओजो॒ मिमा॑नो महि॒मान॒माति॑रत् शूरो॒ यो यु॒त्सु त॒न्वं॑ परि॒व्यत॑ शी॒र्षणि॒ द्यां म॑हि॒ना प्रत्य॑मुञ्चत
stanzas.transliteration: sá bhūtu yó ha prathamā́ya dhā́yase- ójo mímāno mahimā́nam ā́tirat śū́ro yó yutsú tanvàm parivyáta śīrṣáṇi dyā́m mahinā́ práty amuñcata
stanzas.translation: Let him be even that God who, for the earliest draught measuring out his power, increased his majesty; Hero who fortified his body in the wars, and through his greatness set the heaven upon his head.

translations.griffith: Let him be even that God who, for the earliest draught measuring out his power, increased his majesty; Hero who fortified his body in the wars, and through his greatness set the heaven upon his head.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑कृणोः प्रथ॒मं वी॒र्यं॑ म॒हद्यद॒स्याग्रे॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ शुष्म॒मैर॑यः र॒थे॒ष्ठेन॒ हर्य॑श्वेन॒ विच्यु॑ताः॒ प्र जी॒रयः॑ सिस्रते स॒ध्र्य१॒॑क्पृथ॑क्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhākr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ vīryàm mahád yád asyā́gre bráhmaṇā śúṣmam aírayaḥ ratheṣṭhéna háryaśvena vícyutāḥ prá jīráyaḥ sisrate sadhryàk pŕ̥thak
stanzas.translation: Thou didst perform thy first great deed of hero might what time thou showedst power, through prayer, before this folk. Hurled down by thee the car-borne Lord of Tawny Steeds, the congregated swift ones fled in sundry ways.

translations.griffith: Thou didst perform thy first great deed of hero might what time thou showedst power, through prayer, before this folk. Hurled down by thee the car-borne Lord of Tawny Steeds, the congregated swift ones fled in sundry ways.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि म॒ज्मने॑शान॒कृत्प्रव॑या अ॒भ्यव॑र्धत आद्रोद॑सी॒ ज्योति॑षा॒ वह्नि॒रात॑नो॒त्सीव्य॒न्तमां॑सि॒ दुधि॑ता॒ सम॑व्ययत्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā yó víśvā bhúvanābhí majmánā- -īśānakŕ̥t právayā abhy ávardhata ā́d ródasī jyótiṣā váhnir ā́tanot sī́vyan támāṃsi dúdhitā sám avyayat
stanzas.translation: He made himself by might Lord of all living things, and strong in vital power waxed great above them all. He, borne on high, o'erspread with light the heaven and earth, and, sewing up the turbid darkness, closed it in.

translations.griffith: He made himself by might Lord of all living things, and strong in vital power waxed great above them all. He, borne on high, o'erspread with light the heaven and earth, and, sewing up the turbid darkness, closed it in.

stanzas.sanskrit: स प्रा॒चीना॒न्पर्व॑तान्दृंह॒दोज॑साधरा॒चीन॑मकृणोद॒पामपः॑ अधा॑रयत्पृथि॒वीं वि॒श्वधा॑यस॒मस्त॑भ्नान्मा॒यया॒ द्याम॑व॒स्रसः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá prācī́nān párvatān dr̥ṃhad ójasā- -adharācī́nam akr̥ṇod apā́m ápaḥ ádhārayat pr̥thivī́ṃ viśvádhāyasam ástabhnān māyáyā dyā́m avasrásaḥ
stanzas.translation: He with his might made firm the forward-bending hills, the downward rushing of the waters he ordained. Fast he upheld the earth that nourisheth all life, and stayed the heaven from falling by his wondrous skill.

translations.griffith: He with his might made firm the forward-bending hills, the downward rushing of the waters he ordained. Fast he upheld the earth that nourisheth all life, and stayed the heaven from falling by his wondrous skill.

stanzas.sanskrit: सास्मा॒ अरं॑ बा॒हुभ्यां॒ यं पि॒ताकृ॑णो॒द्विश्व॑स्मा॒दा ज॒नुषो॒ वेद॑स॒स्परि॑ येना॑ पृथि॒व्यां नि क्रिविं॑ श॒यध्यै॒ वज्रे॑ण ह॒त्व्यवृ॑णक्तुवि॒ष्वणिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sā́smā áram bāhúbhyāṃ yám pitā́kr̥ṇod víśvasmād ā́ janúṣo védasas pári yénā pr̥thivyā́ṃ ní kríviṃ śayádhyai vájreṇa hatvy ávr̥ṇak tuviṣváṇiḥ
stanzas.translation: Fit for the grasping of his arms is what the Sire hath fabricated from all kind of precious wealth. The thunderbolt, wherewith, loud-roaring, he smote down, and striking him to death laid Krivi on the earth.

translations.griffith: Fit for the grasping of his arms is what the Sire hath fabricated from all kind of precious wealth. The thunderbolt, wherewith, loud-roaring, he smote down, and striking him to death laid Krivi on the earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒मा॒जूरि॑व पि॒त्रोः सचा॑ स॒ती स॑मा॒नादा सद॑स॒स्त्वामि॑ये॒ भग॑म् कृ॒धि प्र॑के॒तमुप॑ मा॒स्या भ॑र द॒द्धि भा॒गं त॒न्वो॒३॒॑ येन॑ मा॒महः॑
stanzas.transliteration: amājū́r iva pitróḥ sácā satī́ samānā́d ā́ sádasas tvā́m iye bhágam kr̥dhí praketám úpa māsy ā́ bhara daddhí bhāgáṃ tanvò yéna māmáhaḥ
stanzas.translation: As she who in her parents' house is growing old, I pray to thee as Bhaga from the seat of all. Grant knowledge, mete it out and bring it to us here: give us the share wherewith thou makest people glad.

translations.griffith: As she who in her parents' house is growing old, I pray to thee as Bhaga from the seat of all. Grant knowledge, mete it out and bring it to us here: give us the share wherewith thou makest people glad.

stanzas.sanskrit: भो॒जं त्वामि॑न्द्र व॒यं हु॑वेम द॒दिष्ट्वमि॒न्द्रापां॑सि॒ वाजा॑न् अ॒वि॒ड्ढी॑न्द्र चि॒त्रया॑ न ऊ॒ती कृ॒धि वृ॑षन्निन्द्र॒ वस्य॑सो नः
stanzas.transliteration: bhojáṃ tvā́m indra vayáṃ huvema dadíṣ ṭvám indrā́pāṃsi vā́jān aviḍḍhī̀ndra citráyā na ūtī́ kr̥dhí vr̥ṣann indra vásyaso naḥ
stanzas.translation: May we invoke thee as a liberal giver thou givest us, O Indra, strength and labours. Help us with manifold assistance, Indra: Migthy One, Indra, make us yet more wealthy.

translations.griffith: May we invoke thee as a liberal giver thou givest us, O Indra, strength and labours. Help us with manifold assistance, Indra: Migthy One, Indra, make us yet more wealthy.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now may that weaithy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Now may that weaithy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒ता रथो॒ नवो॑ योजि॒ सस्नि॒श्चतु॑र्युगस्त्रिक॒शः स॒प्तर॑श्मिः दशा॑रित्रो मनु॒ष्यः॑ स्व॒र्षाः स इ॒ष्टिभि॑र्म॒तिभी॒ रंह्यो॑ भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: prātā́ rátho návo yoji sásniś cáturyugas trikaśáḥ saptáraśmiḥ dáśāritro manuṣyàḥ svarṣā́ḥ sá iṣṭíbhir matíbhī ráṃhyo bhūt
stanzas.translation: THE rich new car hath been equipped at morning; four yokes it hath, three whips, seven reins to guide it: Ten-sided, friendly to mankind, light-winner, that must be urged to speed with prayers and wishes.

translations.griffith: THE rich new car hath been equipped at morning; four yokes it hath, three whips, seven reins to guide it: Ten-sided, friendly to mankind, light-winner, that must be urged to speed with prayers and wishes.

stanzas.sanskrit: सास्मा॒ अरं॑ प्रथ॒मं स द्वि॒तीय॑मु॒तो तृ॒तीयं॒ मनु॑षः॒ स होता॑ अ॒न्यस्या॒ गर्भ॑म॒न्य ऊ॑ जनन्त॒ सो अ॒न्येभिः॑ सचते॒ जेन्यो॒ वृषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: sā́smā áram prathamáṃ sá dvitī́yam utó tr̥tī́yam mánuṣaḥ sá hótā anyásyā gárbham anyá ū jananta só anyébhiḥ sacate jényo vŕ̥ṣā
stanzas.translation: This is prepared for him the first, the second, and the third time: he is man's Priest and Herald. Others get offspring of another parent he goeth, as a noble Bull, with others.

translations.griffith: This is prepared for him the first, the second, and the third time: he is man's Priest and Herald. Others get offspring of another parent he goeth, as a noble Bull, with others.

stanzas.sanskrit: हरी॒ नु कं॒ रथ॒ इन्द्र॑स्य योजमा॒यै सू॒क्तेन॒ वच॑सा॒ नवे॑न मो षु त्वामत्र॑ ब॒हवो॒ हि विप्रा॒ नि री॑रम॒न्यज॑मानासो अ॒न्ये
stanzas.transliteration: hárī nú kaṃ rátha índrasya yojam āyaí sūkténa vácasā návena mó ṣú tvā́m átra bahávo hí víprāḥ- ní rīraman yájamānāso anyé
stanzas.translation: To Indra's car the Bay Steeds have I harnessed, that new well-spoken words may bring him hither. Here let not other worshippers detain thee, for among us are many holy singers.

translations.griffith: To Indra's car the Bay Steeds have I harnessed, that new well-spoken words may bring him hither. Here let not other worshippers detain thee, for among us are many holy singers.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ द्वाभ्यां॒ हरि॑भ्यामिन्द्र या॒ह्या च॒तुर्भि॒रा ष॒ड्भिर्हू॒यमा॑नः आष्टा॒भिर्द॒शभिः॑ सोम॒पेय॑म॒यं सु॒तः सु॑मख॒ मा मृध॑स्कः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ dvā́bhyāṃ háribhyām indra yāhi- ā́ catúrbhir ā́ ṣaḍbhír hūyámānaḥ ā́ṣṭābhír daśábhiḥ somapéyam ayáṃ sutáḥ sumakha mā́ mŕ̥dhas kaḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra, come hitherward with two Bay Coursers, come thou with four, with six when invocated. Come thou with eight, with ten, to drink the Soma. Here is the juice, brave Warrior: do not scorn it.

translations.griffith: Indra, come hitherward with two Bay Coursers, come thou with four, with six when invocated. Come thou with eight, with ten, to drink the Soma. Here is the juice, brave Warrior: do not scorn it.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ विं॑श॒त्या त्रिं॒शता॑ याह्य॒र्वाङा च॑त्वारिं॒शता॒ हरि॑भिर्युजा॒नः आ प॑ञ्चा॒शता॑ सु॒रथे॑भिरि॒न्द्रा ष॒ष्ट्या स॑प्त॒त्या सो॑म॒पेय॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ viṃśatyā́ triṃśátā yāhy arvā́ṅ ā́ catvāriṃśátā háribhir yujānáḥ ā́ pañcāśátā suráthebhir indra- -ā́ ṣaṣṭyā́ saptatyā́ somapéyam
stanzas.translation: O Indra, come thou hither having harnessed thy car with twenty, thirty, forty horses. Come thou with fifty well trained coursers, Indra, sixty or seventy, to drink the Soma.

translations.griffith: O Indra, come thou hither having harnessed thy car with twenty, thirty, forty horses. Come thou with fifty well trained coursers, Indra, sixty or seventy, to drink the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: आशी॒त्या न॑व॒त्या या॑ह्य॒र्वाङा श॒तेन॒ हरि॑भिरु॒ह्यमा॑नः अ॒यं हि ते॑ शु॒नहो॑त्रेषु॒ सोम॒ इन्द्र॑ त्वा॒या परि॑षिक्तो॒ मदा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: ā́śītyā́ navatyā́ yāhy arvā́ṅ ā́ śaténa háribhir uhyámānaḥ ayáṃ hí te śunáhotreṣu sóma índra tvāyā́ páriṣikto mádāya
stanzas.translation: Come to us hitherward, O Indra, carried by eighty, ninety, or an hundred horses. This Soma juice among the Ṣunahotrâs hath been poured out, in love, to glad thee, Indra.

translations.griffith: Come to us hitherward, O Indra, carried by eighty, ninety, or an hundred horses. This Soma juice among the Ṣunahotrâs hath been poured out, in love, to glad thee, Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: मम॒ ब्रह्मे॑न्द्र या॒ह्यच्छा॒ विश्वा॒ हरी॑ धु॒रि धि॑ष्वा॒ रथ॑स्य पु॒रु॒त्रा हि वि॒हव्यो॑ ब॒भूथा॒स्मिञ्छू॑र॒ सव॑ने मादयस्व
stanzas.transliteration: máma bráhmendra yāhy áchā víśvā hárī dhurí dhiṣvā ráthasya purutrā́ hí vihávyo babhū́tha- -asmíñ chūra sávane mādayasva
stanzas.translation: To this my prayer, O Indra, come thou hither: bind to thy car's pole all thy two Bay Coursers. Thou art to be invoked in many places Hero, rejoice thyself in this libation.

translations.griffith: To this my prayer, O Indra, come thou hither: bind to thy car's pole all thy two Bay Coursers. Thou art to be invoked in many places Hero, rejoice thyself in this libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: न म॒ इन्द्रे॑ण स॒ख्यं वि यो॑षद॒स्मभ्य॑मस्य॒ दक्षि॑णा दुहीत उप॒ ज्येष्ठे॒ वरू॑थे॒ गभ॑स्तौ प्रा॒येप्रा॑ये जिगी॒वांसः॑ स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: ná ma índreṇa sakhyáṃ ví yoṣad asmábhyam asya dákṣiṇā duhīta úpa jyéṣṭhe várūthe gábhastau prāyé-prāye jigīvā́ṃsaḥ syāma
stanzas.translation: Ne'er be my love from Indra disunited still may his liberal Milch-cow yield us treasure. So may we under his supreme protection, safe in his arms, succeed in each forth-going.

translations.griffith: Ne'er be my love from Indra disunited still may his liberal Milch-cow yield us treasure. So may we under his supreme protection, safe in his arms, succeed in each forth-going.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now may that wealthy Cow Of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow Of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपा॑य्य॒स्यान्ध॑सो॒ मदा॑य॒ मनी॑षिणः सुवा॒नस्य॒ प्रय॑सः यस्मि॒न्निन्द्रः॑ प्र॒दिवि॑ वावृधा॒न ओको॑ द॒धे ब्र॑ह्म॒ण्यन्त॑श्च॒ नरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ápāyy asyā́ndhaso mádāya mánīṣiṇaḥ suvānásya práyasaḥ yásminn índraḥ pradívi vāvr̥dhānáḥ- óko dadhé brahmaṇyántaś ca náraḥ
stanzas.translation: DRAUGHTS of this sweet juice have been drunk for rapture, of the wise Soma-presser's offered dainty, Wherein, grown mighty in the days aforetime, Indra hath found delight, and men who worship.

translations.griffith: DRAUGHTS of this sweet juice have been drunk for rapture, of the wise Soma-presser's offered dainty, Wherein, grown mighty in the days aforetime, Indra hath found delight, and men who worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य म॑न्दा॒नो मध्वो॒ वज्र॑ह॒स्तोऽहि॒मिन्द्रो॑ अर्णो॒वृतं॒ वि वृ॑श्चत् प्र यद्वयो॒ न स्वस॑रा॒ण्यच्छा॒ प्रयां॑सि च न॒दीनां॒ चक्र॑मन्त
stanzas.transliteration: asyá mandānó mádhvo vájrahastaḥ- -áhim índro arṇovŕ̥taṃ ví vr̥ścat prá yád váyo ná svásarāṇy áchā práyāṃsi ca nadī́nāṃ cákramanta
stanzas.translation: Cheered by this meath Indra, whose hand wields thunder, rent piecemeal Ahi who barred up the waters, So that the quickening currents of the rivers flowed forth like birds unto their resting-places.

translations.griffith: Cheered by this meath Indra, whose hand wields thunder, rent piecemeal Ahi who barred up the waters, So that the quickening currents of the rivers flowed forth like birds unto their resting-places.

stanzas.sanskrit: स माहि॑न॒ इन्द्रो॒ अर्णो॑ अ॒पां प्रैर॑यदहि॒हाच्छा॑ समु॒द्रम् अज॑नय॒त्सूर्यं॑ वि॒दद्गा अ॒क्तुनाह्नां॑ व॒युना॑नि साधत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá mā́hina índro árṇo apā́m praírayad ahihā́chā samudrám ájanayat sū́ryaṃ vidád gā́ḥ- aktúnā́hnāṃ vayúnāni sādhat
stanzas.translation: Indra, this Mighty One, the Dragon's slayer, sent forth the flood of waters to the ocean. He gave the Sun his life, he found the cattle, and with the night the works of days completed.

translations.griffith: Indra, this Mighty One, the Dragon's slayer, sent forth the flood of waters to the ocean. He gave the Sun his life, he found the cattle, and with the night the works of days completed.

stanzas.sanskrit: सो अ॑प्र॒तीनि॒ मन॑वे पु॒रूणीन्द्रो॑ दाशद्दा॒शुषे॒ हन्ति॑ वृ॒त्रम् स॒द्यो यो नृभ्यो॑ अत॒साय्यो॒ भूत्प॑स्पृधा॒नेभ्यः॒ सूर्य॑स्य सा॒तौ
stanzas.transliteration: só apratī́ni mánave purū́ṇi- -índro dāśad dāśúṣe hánti vr̥trám sadyó yó nŕ̥bhyo atasā́yyo bhū́t paspr̥dhānébhyaḥ sū́ryasya sātaú
stanzas.translation: To him who worshippeth hath Indra given many and matchless gifts. He slayeth Vr̥itra. Straight was he to be sought with supplications by men who struggled to obtain the sunlight.

translations.griffith: To him who worshippeth hath Indra given many and matchless gifts. He slayeth Vr̥itra. Straight was he to be sought with supplications by men who struggled to obtain the sunlight.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सु॑न्व॒त इन्द्रः॒ सूर्य॒मा दे॒वो रि॑ण॒ङ्मर्त्या॑य स्त॒वान् आ यद्र॒यिं गु॒हद॑वद्यमस्मै॒ भर॒दंशं॒ नैत॑शो दश॒स्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: sá sunvatá índraḥ sū́ryam ā́ devó riṇaṅ mártyāya stavā́n ā́ yád rayíṃ guhádavadyam asmai bhárad áṃśaṃ naítaśo daśasyán
stanzas.translation: To him who poured him gifts he gave up Sûrya,– Indra, the God, the Mighty, to the mortal; For Etaṣa with worship brought him riches that keep distress afar, as 'twere his portion.

translations.griffith: To him who poured him gifts he gave up Sûrya,– Indra, the God, the Mighty, to the mortal; For Etaṣa with worship brought him riches that keep distress afar, as 'twere his portion.

stanzas.sanskrit: स र॑न्धयत्स॒दिवः॒ सार॑थये॒ शुष्ण॑म॒शुषं॒ कुय॑वं॒ कुत्सा॑य दिवो॑दासाय नव॒तिं च॒ नवेन्द्रः॒ पुरो॒ व्यै॑र॒च्छम्ब॑रस्य
stanzas.transliteration: sá randhayat sadívaḥ sā́rathaye śúṣṇam aśúṣaṃ kúyavaṃ kútsāya dívodāsāya navatíṃ ca náva- -índraḥ púro vy aìrac chámbarasya
stanzas.translation: Once to the driver of his chariot, Kutsa, he gave up greedy Sûrya, plague of harvest; And Indra, for the sake of Divodâsa demolished Ṣambara's nine-and-ninety castles.

translations.griffith: Once to the driver of his chariot, Kutsa, he gave up greedy Sûrya, plague of harvest; And Indra, for the sake of Divodâsa demolished Ṣambara's nine-and-ninety castles.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा त॑ इन्द्रो॒चथ॑महेम श्रव॒स्या न त्मना॑ वा॒जय॑न्तः अ॒श्याम॒ तत्साप्त॑माशुषा॒णा न॒नमो॒ वध॒रदे॑वस्य पी॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ ta indrocátham ahema śravasyā́ ná tmánā vājáyantaḥ aśyā́ma tát sā́ptam āśuṣāṇā́ḥ- nanámo vádhar ádevasya pīyóḥ
stanzas.translation: So have we brought our hymn to thee, O Indra, strengthening thee and fain ourselves for glory. May we with best endeavours gain this friendship, and mayst thou bend the godless scorner's weapons.

translations.griffith: So have we brought our hymn to thee, O Indra, strengthening thee and fain ourselves for glory. May we with best endeavours gain this friendship, and mayst thou bend the godless scorner's weapons.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा ते॑ गृत्सम॒दाः शू॑र॒ मन्मा॑व॒स्यवो॒ न व॒युना॑नि तक्षुः ब्र॒ह्म॒ण्यन्त॑ इन्द्र ते॒ नवी॑य॒ इष॒मूर्जं॑ सुक्षि॒तिं सु॒म्नम॑श्युः
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ te gr̥tsamadā́ḥ śūra mánma- -avasyávo ná vayúnāni takṣuḥ brahmaṇyánta indra te návīyaḥ- íṣam ū́rjaṃ sukṣitíṃ sumnám aśyuḥ
stanzas.translation: Thus the Gr̥itsamadas for thee, O Hero, have wrought their hymn and task as seeking favour. May they who worship thee afresh, O Indra, gain food and strength, bliss, and a happy dwelling.

translations.griffith: Thus the Gr̥itsamadas for thee, O Hero, have wrought their hymn and task as seeking favour. May they who worship thee afresh, O Indra, gain food and strength, bliss, and a happy dwelling.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee, Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee, Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं ते॒ वय॑ इन्द्र वि॒द्धि षु णः॒ प्र भ॑रामहे वाज॒युर्न रथ॑म् वि॒प॒न्यवो॒ दीध्य॑तो मनी॒षा सु॒म्नमिय॑क्षन्त॒स्त्वाव॑तो॒ नॄन्
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ te váya indra viddhí ṣú ṇaḥ prá bharāmahe vājayúr ná rátham vipanyávo dī́dhyato manīṣā́ sumnám íyakṣantas tvā́vato nr̥̄́n
stanzas.translation: As one brings forth his car when fain for combat, so bring we power to thee- regard us, Indra- Well skilled in song, thoughtful in spirit, seeking great bliss from one like thee amid the Heroes.

translations.griffith: As one brings forth his car when fain for combat, so bring we power to thee- regard us, Indra- Well skilled in song, thoughtful in spirit, seeking great bliss from one like thee amid the Heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं न॑ इन्द्र॒ त्वाभि॑रू॒ती त्वा॑य॒तो अ॑भिष्टि॒पासि॒ जना॑न् त्वमि॒नो दा॒शुषो॑ वरू॒तेत्थाधी॑र॒भि यो नक्ष॑ति त्वा
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ na indra tvā́bhir ūtī́ tvāyató abhiṣṭipā́si jánān tvám inó dāśúṣo varūtā́- -itthā́dhīr abhí yó nákṣati tvā
stanzas.translation: Indra, thou art our own with thy protection, a guardian near to men who love thee truly, Active art thou, the liberal man's defender, his who draws near to thee with right devotion.
