translations.griffith: Indra, thou art our own with thy protection, a guardian near to men who love thee truly, Active art thou, the liberal man's defender, his who draws near to thee with right devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॒ युवेन्द्रो॑ जो॒हूत्रः॒ सखा॑ शि॒वो न॒राम॑स्तु पा॒ता यः शंस॑न्तं॒ यः श॑शमा॒नमू॒ती पच॑न्तं च स्तु॒वन्तं॑ च प्र॒णेष॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: sá no yúvéndro johū́traḥ sákhā śivó narā́m astu pātā́ yáḥ śáṃsantaṃ yáḥ śaśamānám ūtī́ pácantaṃ ca stuvántaṃ ca praṇéṣat
stanzas.translation: May Indra, called with solemn invocations. the young, the Friend, be men's auspicious keeper, One who will further with his aid the singer, the toiler, praiser, dresser of oblations.

translations.griffith: May Indra, called with solemn invocations. the young, the Friend, be men's auspicious keeper, One who will further with his aid the singer, the toiler, praiser, dresser of oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ स्तुष॒ इन्द्रं॒ तं गृ॑णीषे॒ यस्मि॑न्पु॒रा वा॑वृ॒धुः शा॑श॒दुश्च॑ स वस्वः॒ कामं॑ पीपरदिया॒नो ब्र॑ह्मण्य॒तो नूत॑नस्या॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: tám u stuṣa índraṃ táṃ gr̥ṇīṣe yásmin purā́ vāvr̥dhúḥ śāśadúś ca sá vásvaḥ kā́mam pīparad iyānó brahmaṇyató nū́tanasyāyóḥ
stanzas.translation: With laud and song let me extol that Indra in whom of old men prospered and were mighty. May he, implored, fulfil the prayer for plenty of him who worships, of the living mortal.

translations.griffith: With laud and song let me extol that Indra in whom of old men prospered and were mighty. May he, implored, fulfil the prayer for plenty of him who worships, of the living mortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: सो अङ्गि॑रसामु॒चथा॑ जुजु॒ष्वान्ब्रह्मा॑ तूतो॒दिन्द्रो॑ गा॒तुमि॒ष्णन् मु॒ष्णन्नु॒षसः॒ सूर्ये॑ण स्त॒वानश्न॑स्य चिच्छिश्नथत्पू॒र्व्याणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: só áṅgirasām ucáthā jujuṣvā́n bráhmā tūtod índro gātúm iṣṇán muṣṇánn uṣásaḥ sū́ryeṇa stavā́n áśnasya cic chiśnathat pūrvyā́ṇi
stanzas.translation: He, Indra whom the Angirases' praise delighted, strengthened their prayer and made their goings prosper. Stealing away the mornings with the sunlight, he, lauded, crushed even Aṣna's ancient powers.

translations.griffith: He, Indra whom the Angirases' praise delighted, strengthened their prayer and made their goings prosper. Stealing away the mornings with the sunlight, he, lauded, crushed even Aṣna's ancient powers.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ह॑ श्रु॒त इन्द्रो॒ नाम॑ दे॒व ऊ॒र्ध्वो भु॑व॒न्मनु॑षे द॒स्मत॑मः अव॑ प्रि॒यम॑र्शसा॒नस्य॑ सा॒ह्वाञ्छिरो॑ भरद्दा॒सस्य॑ स्व॒धावा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sá ha śrutá índro nā́ma deváḥ- ūrdhvó bhuvan mánuṣe dasmátamaḥ áva priyám arśasānásya sāhvā́ñ -śíro bharad dāsásya svadhā́vān
stanzas.translation: He verily, the God, the glorious Indra, hath raised him up for man, best Wonder-Worker. He, self-reliant, mighty and triumphant, brought low the dear head of the wicked Dâsa.

translations.griffith: He verily, the God, the glorious Indra, hath raised him up for man, best Wonder-Worker. He, self-reliant, mighty and triumphant, brought low the dear head of the wicked Dâsa.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वृ॑त्र॒हेन्द्रः॑ कृ॒ष्णयो॑नीः पुरंद॒रो दासी॑रैरय॒द्वि अज॑नय॒न्मन॑वे॒ क्षाम॒पश्च॑ स॒त्रा शंसं॒ यज॑मानस्य तूतोत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá vr̥trahéndraḥ kr̥ṣṇáyonīḥ puraṃdaró dā́sīr airayad ví ájanayan mánave kṣā́m apáś ca satrā́ śáṃsaṃ yájamānasya tūtot
stanzas.translation: Indra theVr̥itra-slayer, Fort-destroyer, scattered the Dâsa hosts who dwelt in darkness. For men hath he created earth and waters, and ever helped the prayer of him who worships.

translations.griffith: Indra theVr̥itra-slayer, Fort-destroyer, scattered the Dâsa hosts who dwelt in darkness. For men hath he created earth and waters, and ever helped the prayer of him who worships.

stanzas.sanskrit: तस्मै॑ तव॒स्य१॒॑मनु॑ दायि स॒त्रेन्द्रा॑य दे॒वेभि॒रर्ण॑सातौ प्रति॒ यद॑स्य॒ वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोर्धुर्ह॒त्वी दस्यू॒न्पुर॒ आय॑सी॒र्नि ता॑रीत्
stanzas.transliteration: tásmai tavasyàm ánu dāyi satrā́- -índrāya devébhir árṇasātau práti yád asya vájram bāhvór dhúr hatvī́ dásyūn púra ā́yasīr ní tārīt
stanzas.translation: To him in might the Gods have ever yielded, to Indra in the tumult of thebattle. When in his arms they laid the bolt, he slaughtered the Dasyus and cast down their forts of iron.

translations.griffith: To him in might the Gods have ever yielded, to Indra in the tumult of thebattle. When in his arms they laid the bolt, he slaughtered the Dasyus and cast down their forts of iron.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒श्व॒जिते॑ धन॒जिते॑ स्व॒र्जिते॑ सत्रा॒जिते॑ नृ॒जित॑ उर्वरा॒जिते॑ अ॒श्व॒जिते॑ गो॒जिते॑ अ॒ब्जिते॑ भ॒रेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॑ यज॒ताय॑ हर्य॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: viśvajíte dhanajíte svarjíte satrājíte nr̥jíta urvarājíte aśvajíte gojíte abjíte bhara- -índrāya sómaṃ yajatā́ya haryatám
stanzas.translation: To him the Lord of all, the Lord of wealth, of light; him who is Lord for ever, Lord of men and tilth, Him who is Lord of horses, Lord of kine,of floods, to Indra, to the Holy bring sweet Soma juice.

translations.griffith: To him the Lord of all, the Lord of wealth, of light; him who is Lord for ever, Lord of men and tilth, Him who is Lord of horses, Lord of kine,of floods, to Indra, to the Holy bring sweet Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि॒भुवे॑ऽभिभ॒ङ्गाय॑ वन्व॒तेऽषा॑ळ्हाय॒ सह॑मानाय वे॒धसे॑ तु॒वि॒ग्रये॒ वह्न॑ये दु॒ष्टरी॑तवे सत्रा॒साहे॒ नम॒ इन्द्रा॑य वोचत
stanzas.transliteration: abhibhúve 'bhibhaṅgā́ya vanvaté -áṣāḷhāya sáhamānāya vedháse tuvigráye váhnaye duṣṭárītave satrāsā́he náma índrāya vocata
stanzas.translation: To him the potent One, who conquers and breaks down, the Victor never vanquished who disposes all, The mighty-voiced, the rider, unassailable, to Indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.

translations.griffith: To him the potent One, who conquers and breaks down, the Victor never vanquished who disposes all, The mighty-voiced, the rider, unassailable, to Indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा॒सा॒हो ज॑नभ॒क्षो ज॑नंस॒हश्च्यव॑नो यु॒ध्मो अनु॒ जोष॑मुक्षि॒तः वृ॒तं॒च॒यः सहु॑रिर्वि॒क्ष्वा॑रि॒त इन्द्र॑स्य वोचं॒ प्र कृ॒तानि॑ वी॒र्या॑
stanzas.transliteration: satrāsāhó janabhakṣó janaṃsaháś cyávano yudhmó ánu jóṣam ukṣitáḥ vr̥taṃcayáḥ sáhurir vikṣv ā̀ritáḥ- índrasya vocam prá kr̥tā́ni vīryā̀
stanzas.translation: Still Victor, loved by mortals, ruler over men, o'erthrower, warrior, he hath waxen as he would; Host-gatherer, triumphant, honoured mid the folk. Indra's heroic deeds will I tell forth to all.

translations.griffith: Still Victor, loved by mortals, ruler over men, o'erthrower, warrior, he hath waxen as he would; Host-gatherer, triumphant, honoured mid the folk. Indra's heroic deeds will I tell forth to all.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ना॒नु॒दो वृ॑ष॒भो दोध॑तो व॒धो ग॑म्भी॒र ऋ॒ष्वो अस॑मष्टकाव्यः र॒ध्र॒चो॒दः श्नथ॑नो वीळि॒तस्पृ॒थुरिन्द्रः॑ सुय॒ज्ञ उ॒षसः॒ स्व॑र्जनत्
stanzas.transliteration: anānudó vr̥ṣabhó dódhato vadhó gambhīrá r̥ṣvó ásamaṣṭakāvyaḥ radhracodáḥ śnáthano vīḷitás pr̥thúr índraḥ suyajñá uṣásaḥ svàr janat
stanzas.translation: The strong who never yields, who slew the furious fiend, the deep, the vast, of wisdom unattainable; Who speeds the good, the breaker-down, the firm, the vast,– Indra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of Dawn.

translations.griffith: The strong who never yields, who slew the furious fiend, the deep, the vast, of wisdom unattainable; Who speeds the good, the breaker-down, the firm, the vast,– Indra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of Dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञेन॑ गा॒तुम॒प्तुरो॑ विविद्रिरे॒ धियो॑ हिन्वा॒ना उ॒शिजो॑ मनी॒षिणः॑ अ॒भि॒स्वरा॑ नि॒षदा॒ गा अ॑व॒स्यव॒ इन्द्रे॑ हिन्वा॒ना द्रवि॑णान्याशत
stanzas.transliteration: yajñéna gātúm aptúro vividrire dhíyo hinvānā́ uśíjo manīṣíṇaḥ abhisvárā niṣádā gā́ avasyávaḥ- índre hinvānā́ dráviṇāny āśata
stanzas.translation: By sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood. In Indra seeking help with worship and with hymn, they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.

translations.griffith: By sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood. In Indra seeking help with worship and with hymn, they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ श्रेष्ठा॑नि॒ द्रवि॑णानि धेहि॒ चित्तिं॒ दक्ष॑स्य सुभग॒त्वम॒स्मे पोषं॑ रयी॒णामरि॑ष्टिं त॒नूनां॑ स्वा॒द्मानं॑ वा॒चः सु॑दिन॒त्वमह्ना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índra śréṣṭhāni dráviṇāni dhehi cíttiṃ dákṣasya subhagatvám asmé póṣaṃ rayīṇā́m áriṣṭiṃ tanū́nāṃ svādmā́naṃ vācáḥ sudinatvám áhnām
stanzas.translation: Indra, bestow on us the best of treasures, the spirit of ability and fortune; Increase of riches, safety of our bodies, charm of sweet speech, and days of pleasant weather.

translations.griffith: Indra, bestow on us the best of treasures, the spirit of ability and fortune; Increase of riches, safety of our bodies, charm of sweet speech, and days of pleasant weather.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रिक॑द्रुकेषु महि॒षो यवा॑शिरं तुवि॒शुष्म॑स्तृ॒पत्सोम॑मपिब॒द्विष्णु॑ना सु॒तं यथाव॑शत् स ईं॑ ममाद॒ महि॒ कर्म॒ कर्त॑वे म॒हामु॒रुं सैनं॑ सश्चद्दे॒वो दे॒वं स॒त्यमिन्द्रं॑ स॒त्य इन्दुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tríkadrukeṣu mahiṣó yávāśiraṃ tuviśúṣmas tr̥pát sómam apibad víṣṇunā sutáṃ yáthā́vaśat sá īm mamāda máhi kárma kártave mahā́m urúṃ saínaṃ saścad devó deváṃ satyám índraṃ satyá índuḥ
stanzas.translation: At the Trikadrukas the Great and Strong hath drunk drink blent with meal. With Vishṇu hath he quaffed the poured out Soma juice, all that he would. That hath so heightened him the Great, the Wide, to do his mighty work. So may the God attain the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

translations.griffith: At the Trikadrukas the Great and Strong hath drunk drink blent with meal. With Vishṇu hath he quaffed the poured out Soma juice, all that he would. That hath so heightened him the Great, the Wide, to do his mighty work. So may the God attain the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॒ त्विषी॑माँ अ॒भ्योज॑सा॒ क्रिविं॑ यु॒धाभ॑व॒दा रोद॑सी अपृणदस्य म॒ज्मना॒ प्र वा॑वृधे अध॑त्ता॒न्यं ज॒ठरे॒ प्रेम॑रिच्यत॒ सैनं॑ सश्चद्दे॒वो दे॒वं स॒त्यमिन्द्रं॑ स॒त्य इन्दुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádha tvíṣīmām̐ abhy ójasā kríviṃ yudhā́bhavad ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇad asya majmánā prá vāvr̥dhe ádhattānyáṃ jaṭháre prém aricyata saínaṃ saścad devó deváṃ satyám índraṃ satyá índuḥ
stanzas.translation: So he resplendent in the battle overcame Krivi by might. He with his majesty hath filled the earth and heaven, and waxen strong. One share of the libation hath he swallowed down: one share he left. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

translations.griffith: So he resplendent in the battle overcame Krivi by might. He with his majesty hath filled the earth and heaven, and waxen strong. One share of the libation hath he swallowed down: one share he left. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा॒कं जा॒तः क्रतु॑ना सा॒कमोज॑सा ववक्षिथ सा॒कं वृ॒द्धो वी॒र्यैः॑ सास॒हिर्मृधो॒ विच॑र्षणिः दाता॒ राधः॑ स्तुव॒ते काम्यं॒ वसु॒ सैनं॑ सश्चद्दे॒वो दे॒वं स॒त्यमिन्द्रं॑ स॒त्य इन्दुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sākáṃ jātáḥ krátunā sākám ójasā vavakṣitha sākáṃ vr̥ddhó vīryaìḥ sāsahír mŕ̥dho vícarṣaṇiḥ dā́tā rā́dha stuvaté kā́myaṃ vásu saínaṃ saścad devó deváṃ satyám índraṃ satyá índuḥ
stanzas.translation: Brought forth together with wisdom and mighty power thou grewest great; with hero deeds subduing the malevolent, most swift in act; Giving prosperity, and lovely wealth to him who praiseth thee. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

translations.griffith: Brought forth together with wisdom and mighty power thou grewest great; with hero deeds subduing the malevolent, most swift in act; Giving prosperity, and lovely wealth to him who praiseth thee. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ त्यन्नर्यं॑ नृ॒तोऽप॑ इन्द्र प्रथ॒मं पू॒र्व्यं दि॒वि प्र॒वाच्यं॑ कृ॒तम् यद्दे॒वस्य॒ शव॑सा॒ प्रारि॑णा॒ असुं॑ रि॒णन्न॒पः भुव॒द्विश्व॑म॒भ्यादे॑व॒मोज॑सा वि॒दादूर्जं॑ श॒तक्र॑तुर्वि॒दादिष॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táva tyán náryaṃ nr̥to- -ápa indra prathamám pūrvyáṃ diví pravā́cyaṃ kr̥tám yád devásya śávasā prā́riṇā ásuṃ riṇánn apáḥ bhúvad víśvam abhy ā́devam ójasā vidā́d ū́rjaṃ śatákratur vidā́d íṣam
stanzas.translation: This, Indra, was thy hero deed, Dancer, thy first and ancient work, worthy to be told forth in heaven, What time thou sentest down life with a God's own power, freeing the floods. All that is godless may he conquer with his might, and, Lord of Hundred Powers, find for us strength and food.

translations.griffith: This, Indra, was thy hero deed, Dancer, thy first and ancient work, worthy to be told forth in heaven, What time thou sentest down life with a God's own power, freeing the floods. All that is godless may he conquer with his might, and, Lord of Hundred Powers, find for us strength and food.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग॒णानां॑ त्वा ग॒णप॑तिं हवामहे क॒विं क॑वी॒नामु॑प॒मश्र॑वस्तमम् ज्ये॒ष्ठ॒राजं॒ ब्रह्म॑णां ब्रह्मणस्पत॒ आ नः॑ शृ॒ण्वन्नू॒तिभिः॑ सीद॒ साद॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: gaṇā́nāṃ tvā gaṇápatiṃ havāmahe kavíṃ kavīnā́m upamáśravastamam jyeṣṭharā́jam bráhmaṇām brahmaṇas pate- ā́ naḥ śr̥ṇvánn ūtíbhiḥ sīda sā́danam
stanzas.translation: WE call thee, Lord and Leader of the heavenly hosts, the wise among the wise, the famousest of all, The King supreme of prayers, O Brahmaṇaspati: hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice.

translations.griffith: WE call thee, Lord and Leader of the heavenly hosts, the wise among the wise, the famousest of all, The King supreme of prayers, O Brahmaṇaspati: hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वाश्चि॑त्ते असुर्य॒ प्रचे॑तसो॒ बृह॑स्पते य॒ज्ञियं॑ भा॒गमा॑नशुः उ॒स्रा इ॑व॒ सूर्यो॒ ज्योति॑षा म॒हो विश्वे॑षा॒मिज्ज॑नि॒ता ब्रह्म॑णामसि
stanzas.transliteration: devā́ś cit te asurya prácetaso bŕ̥haspate yajñíyam bhāgám ānaśuḥ usrā́ iva sū́ryo jyótiṣā mahó víśveṣām íj janitā́ bráhmaṇām asi
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati, God immortal! verily the Gods have gained from thee, the wise, a share in holy rites. As with great light the Sun brings forth the rays of morn, so thou alone art Father of all sacred prayer.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati, God immortal! verily the Gods have gained from thee, the wise, a share in holy rites. As with great light the Sun brings forth the rays of morn, so thou alone art Father of all sacred prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वि॒बाध्या॑ परि॒राप॒स्तमां॑सि च॒ ज्योति॑ष्मन्तं॒ रथ॑मृ॒तस्य॑ तिष्ठसि बृह॑स्पते भी॒मम॑मित्र॒दम्भ॑नं रक्षो॒हणं॑ गोत्र॒भिदं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vibā́dhyā parirā́pas támāṃsi ca jyótiṣmantaṃ rátham r̥tásya tiṣṭhasi bŕ̥haspate bhīmám amitradámbhanaṃ rakṣoháṇaṃ gotrabhídaṃ svarvídam
stanzas.translation: When thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom, thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice; The awful car, Br̥ihaspati, that quells the foe, slays demons, cleaves the stall of kine, and finds the light.

translations.griffith: When thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom, thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice; The awful car, Br̥ihaspati, that quells the foe, slays demons, cleaves the stall of kine, and finds the light.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒नी॒तिभि॑र्नयसि॒ त्राय॑से॒ जनं॒ यस्तुभ्यं॒ दाशा॒न्न तमंहो॑ अश्नवत् ब्र॒ह्म॒द्विष॒स्तप॑नो मन्यु॒मीर॑सि॒ बृह॑स्पते॒ महि॒ तत्ते॑ महित्व॒नम्
stanzas.transliteration: sunītíbhir nayasi trā́yase jánaṃ yás túbhyaṃ dā́śān ná tám áṃho aśnavat brahmadvíṣas tápano manyumī́r asi bŕ̥haspate máhi tát te mahitvanám
stanzas.translation: Thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men; distress o'ertakes not him who offers gifts to thee. Him who hates prayer thou punishest, Br̥ihaspati, quelling his wrath: herein is thy great mightiness.

translations.griffith: Thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men; distress o'ertakes not him who offers gifts to thee. Him who hates prayer thou punishest, Br̥ihaspati, quelling his wrath: herein is thy great mightiness.

stanzas.sanskrit: न तमंहो॒ न दु॑रि॒तं कुत॑श्च॒न नारा॑तयस्तितिरु॒र्न द्व॑या॒विनः॑ विश्वा॒ इद॑स्माद्ध्व॒रसो॒ वि बा॑धसे॒ यं सु॑गो॒पा रक्ष॑सि ब्रह्मणस्पते
stanzas.transliteration: ná tám áṃho ná duritáṃ kútaś caná nā́rātayas titirur ná dvayāvínaḥ víśvā íd asmād dhvaráso ví bādhase yáṃ sugopā́ rákṣasi brahmaṇas pate
stanzas.translation: No sorrow, no distress from any side, no foes, no creatures double-tongued have overcome the man,– Thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom, careful guard, thou keepest Brahmaṇaspati.

translations.griffith: No sorrow, no distress from any side, no foes, no creatures double-tongued have overcome the man,– Thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom, careful guard, thou keepest Brahmaṇaspati.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ गो॒पाः प॑थि॒कृद्वि॑चक्ष॒णस्तव॑ व्र॒ताय॑ म॒तिभि॑र्जरामहे बृह॑स्पते॒ यो नो॑ अ॒भि ह्वरो॑ द॒धे स्वा तं म॑र्मर्तु दु॒च्छुना॒ हर॑स्वती
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no gopā́ḥ pathikŕ̥d vicakṣaṇás táva vratā́ya matíbhir jarāmahe bŕ̥haspate yó no abhí hváro dadhé svā́ tám marmartu duchúnā hárasvatī
stanzas.translation: Thou art our keeper, wise, preparer of our paths: we, for thy service, sing to thee with hymns of praise. Br̥ihaspati, whoever lays a snare for us, him may his evil fate, precipitate, destroy.

translations.griffith: Thou art our keeper, wise, preparer of our paths: we, for thy service, sing to thee with hymns of praise. Br̥ihaspati, whoever lays a snare for us, him may his evil fate, precipitate, destroy.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त वा॒ यो नो॑ म॒र्चया॒दना॑गसोऽराती॒वा मर्तः॑ सानु॒को वृकः॑ बृह॑स्पते॒ अप॒ तं व॑र्तया प॒थः सु॒गं नो॑ अ॒स्यै दे॒ववी॑तये कृधि
stanzas.transliteration: utá vā yó no marcáyād ánāgaso -arātīvā́ mártaḥ sānukó vŕ̥kaḥ bŕ̥haspate ápa táṃ vartayā patháḥ sugáṃ no asyaí devávītaye kr̥dhi
stanzas.translation: Him, too, who threatens us without offence of ours, the evilminded, arrogant, rapacious man,– Him turn thou from our path away, Br̥ihaspati: give us fair access to this banquet of the Gods.

translations.griffith: Him, too, who threatens us without offence of ours, the evilminded, arrogant, rapacious man,– Him turn thou from our path away, Br̥ihaspati: give us fair access to this banquet of the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रा॒तारं॑ त्वा त॒नूनां॑ हवाम॒हेऽव॑स्पर्तरधिव॒क्तार॑मस्म॒युम् बृह॑स्पते देव॒निदो॒ नि ब॑र्हय॒ मा दु॒रेवा॒ उत्त॑रं सु॒म्नमुन्न॑शन्
stanzas.transliteration: trātā́raṃ tvā tanū́nāṃ havāmahe- -ávaspartar adhivaktā́ram asmayúm bŕ̥haspate devanído ní barhaya mā́ durévā úttaraṃ sumnám ún naśan
stanzas.translation: Thee as protector of our bodies we invoke, thee, saviour, as the comforter who loveth us. Strike, O Br̥ihaspati, the Gods' revilers down, and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss.

translations.griffith: Thee as protector of our bodies we invoke, thee, saviour, as the comforter who loveth us. Strike, O Br̥ihaspati, the Gods' revilers down, and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वया॑ व॒यं सु॒वृधा॑ ब्रह्मणस्पते स्पा॒र्हा वसु॑ मनु॒ष्या द॑दीमहि या नो॑ दू॒रे त॒ळितो॒ या अरा॑तयो॒ऽभि सन्ति॑ ज॒म्भया॒ ता अ॑न॒प्नसः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tváyā vayáṃ suvŕ̥dhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā́ vásu manuṣyā́ dadīmahi yā́ no dūré taḷíto yā́ árātayo -abhí sánti jambháyā tā́ anapnásaḥ
stanzas.translation: Through thee, kind -prosperer, O Brahmaṇaspati, may we obtain the wealth of Men which all desire: And all our enemies, who near or far away prevail against us, crush, and leave them destitute.

translations.griffith: Through thee, kind -prosperer, O Brahmaṇaspati, may we obtain the wealth of Men which all desire: And all our enemies, who near or far away prevail against us, crush, and leave them destitute.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वया॑ व॒यमु॑त्त॒मं धी॑महे॒ वयो॒ बृह॑स्पते॒ पप्रि॑णा॒ सस्नि॑ना यु॒जा मा नो॑ दुः॒शंसो॑ अभिदि॒प्सुरी॑शत॒ प्र सु॒शंसा॑ म॒तिभि॑स्तारिषीमहि
stanzas.transliteration: tváyā vayám uttamáṃ dhīmahe váyo bŕ̥haspate pápriṇā sásninā yujā́ mā́ no duḥśáṃso abhidipsúr īśata prá suśáṃsā matíbhis tāriṣīmahi
stanzas.translation: With thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we, Br̥ihaspati, gain highest power of life. Let not the guileful wicked man be lord of us:-still may we prosper, singing goodly hymns of praise.

translations.griffith: With thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we, Br̥ihaspati, gain highest power of life. Let not the guileful wicked man be lord of us:-still may we prosper, singing goodly hymns of praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ना॒नु॒दो वृ॑ष॒भो जग्मि॑राह॒वं निष्ट॑प्ता॒ शत्रुं॒ पृत॑नासु सास॒हिः असि॑ स॒त्य ऋ॑ण॒या ब्र॑ह्मणस्पत उ॒ग्रस्य॑ चिद्दमि॒ता वी॑ळुह॒र्षिणः॑
stanzas.transliteration: anānudó vr̥ṣabhó jágmir āhaváṃ níṣṭaptā śátrum pŕ̥tanāsu sāsahíḥ ási satyá r̥ṇayā́ brahmaṇas pate- ugrásya cid damitā́ vīḷuharṣíṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: Strong, never yielding, hastening to the battle-cry, consumer of the foe, victorious in the strife, Thou art sin's true avenger, Brahmaṇaspati, who tamest e'en the fierce, the wildly passionate.

translations.griffith: Strong, never yielding, hastening to the battle-cry, consumer of the foe, victorious in the strife, Thou art sin's true avenger, Brahmaṇaspati, who tamest e'en the fierce, the wildly passionate.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदे॑वेन॒ मन॑सा॒ यो रि॑ष॒ण्यति॑ शा॒सामु॒ग्रो मन्य॑मानो॒ जिघां॑सति बृह॑स्पते॒ मा प्रण॒क्तस्य॑ नो व॒धो नि क॑र्म म॒न्युं दु॒रेव॑स्य॒ शर्ध॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: ádevena mánasā yó riṣaṇyáti śāsā́m ugró mányamāno jíghāṃsati bŕ̥haspate mā́ práṇak tásya no vadhó ní karma manyúṃ durévasya śárdhataḥ
stanzas.translation: Whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm, who, deeming him a man of might mid lords, would slay,– Let not his deadly blow reach us, Br̥ihaspati; may we humiliate the strong ill-doer's wrath.

translations.griffith: Whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm, who, deeming him a man of might mid lords, would slay,– Let not his deadly blow reach us, Br̥ihaspati; may we humiliate the strong ill-doer's wrath.

stanzas.sanskrit: भरे॑षु॒ हव्यो॒ नम॑सोप॒सद्यो॒ गन्ता॒ वाजे॑षु॒ सनि॑ता॒ धनं॑धनम् विश्वा॒ इद॒र्यो अ॑भिदि॒प्स्वो॒३॒॑ मृधो॒ बृह॒स्पति॒र्वि व॑वर्हा॒ रथाँ॑ इव
stanzas.transliteration: bháreṣu hávyo námasopasádyo gántā vā́jeṣu sánitā dhánaṃ-dhanam víśvā íd aryó abhidipsvò mŕ̥dho bŕ̥haspátir ví vavarhā ráthām̐ iva
stanzas.translation: The mover mid the spoil, the winner of all wealth, to be invoked in fight and reverently adored, Br̥ihaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us.

translations.griffith: The mover mid the spoil, the winner of all wealth, to be invoked in fight and reverently adored, Br̥ihaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us.

stanzas.sanskrit: तेजि॑ष्ठया तप॒नी र॒क्षस॑स्तप॒ ये त्वा॑ नि॒दे द॑धि॒रे दृ॒ष्टवी॑र्यम् आ॒विस्तत्कृ॑ष्व॒ यदस॑त्त उ॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ बृह॑स्पते॒ वि प॑रि॒रापो॑ अर्दय
stanzas.transliteration: téjiṣṭhayā tapanī́ rakṣásas tapa yé tvā nidé dadhiré dr̥ṣṭávīryam āvís tát kr̥ṣva yád ásat ta ukthyàm bŕ̥haspate ví parirā́po ardaya
stanzas.translation: Burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand, those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might. Show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise: destroy the evil speakers, O Br̥ihaspati.

translations.griffith: Burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand, those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might. Show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise: destroy the evil speakers, O Br̥ihaspati.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृह॑स्पते॒ अति॒ यद॒र्यो अर्हा॑द्द्यु॒मद्वि॒भाति॒ क्रतु॑म॒ज्जने॑षु यद्दी॒दय॒च्छव॑स ऋतप्रजात॒ तद॒स्मासु॒ द्रवि॑णं धेहि चि॒त्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate áti yád aryó árhād dyumád vibhā́ti krátumaj jáneṣu yád dīdáyac chávasa r̥taprajāta tád asmā́su dráviṇaṃ dhehi citrám
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati, that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual, splendid, That, Son of Law I which is with might refulgent-that treasure wonderful bestow thou on us.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati, that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual, splendid, That, Son of Law I which is with might refulgent-that treasure wonderful bestow thou on us.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नः॑ स्ते॒नेभ्यो॒ ये अ॒भि द्रु॒हस्प॒दे नि॑रा॒मिणो॑ रि॒पवोऽन्ने॑षु जागृ॒धुः आ दे॒वाना॒मोह॑ते॒ वि व्रयो॑ हृ॒दि बृह॑स्पते॒ न प॒रः साम्नो॑ विदुः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ na stenébhyo yé abhí druhás padé nirāmíṇo ripávó 'nneṣu jāgr̥dhúḥ ā́ devā́nām óhate ví vráyo hr̥dí bŕ̥haspate ná paráḥ sā́mno viduḥ
stanzas.translation: Give us not up to those who, foes in ambuscade, are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease, Who cherish in their heart abandonment of Gods. Br̥ihaspati, no further rest shall they obtain.

translations.griffith: Give us not up to those who, foes in ambuscade, are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease, Who cherish in their heart abandonment of Gods. Br̥ihaspati, no further rest shall they obtain.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑भ्यो॒ हि त्वा॒ भुव॑नेभ्य॒स्परि॒ त्वष्टाज॑न॒त्साम्नः॑साम्नः क॒विः स ऋ॑ण॒चिदृ॑ण॒या ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॑र्द्रु॒हो ह॒न्ता म॒ह ऋ॒तस्य॑ ध॒र्तरि॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśvebhyo hí tvā bhúvanebhyas pári tváṣṭā́janat sā́mnaḥ-sāmnaḥ kavíḥ sá r̥ṇacíd r̥ṇayā́ bráhmaṇas pátir druhó hantā́ mahá r̥tásya dhartári
stanzas.translation: For Tvashṭar, he who knows each sacred song, brought thee to life, preeminent o'er all the things that be. Guilt-scourger, guilt-avenger is Br̥ihaspati, who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty Law.

translations.griffith: For Tvashṭar, he who knows each sacred song, brought thee to life, preeminent o'er all the things that be. Guilt-scourger, guilt-avenger is Br̥ihaspati, who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty Law.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ श्रि॒ये व्य॑जिहीत॒ पर्व॑तो॒ गवां॑ गो॒त्रमु॒दसृ॑जो॒ यद॑ङ्गिरः इन्द्रे॑ण यु॒जा तम॑सा॒ परी॑वृतं॒ बृह॑स्पते॒ निर॒पामौ॑ब्जो अर्ण॒वम्
stanzas.transliteration: táva śriyé vy àjihīta párvato gávāṃ gotrám udásr̥jo yád aṅgiraḥ índreṇa yujā́ támasā párīvr̥tam bŕ̥haspate nír apā́m aubjo arṇavám
stanzas.translation: The mountain, for thy glory, cleft itself apart when, Angiras! thou openedst the stall of kine. Thoul O Br̥ihaspati, with Indra for ally didst hurl down water-floods which gloom had compa-sed round.

translations.griffith: The mountain, for thy glory, cleft itself apart when, Angiras! thou openedst the stall of kine. Thoul O Br̥ihaspati, with Indra for ally didst hurl down water-floods which gloom had compa-sed round.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्म॑णस्पते॒ त्वम॒स्य य॒न्ता सू॒क्तस्य॑ बोधि॒ तन॑यं च जिन्व विश्वं॒ तद्भ॒द्रं यदव॑न्ति दे॒वा बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: bráhmaṇas pate tvám asyá yantā́ sūktásya bodhi tánayaṃ ca jinva víśvaṃ tád bhadráṃ yád ávanti devā́ḥ- br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children. All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children. All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: सेमाम॑विड्ढि॒ प्रभृ॑तिं॒ य ईशि॑षे॒ऽया वि॑धेम॒ नव॑या म॒हा गि॒रा यथा॑ नो मी॒ढ्वान्त्स्तव॑ते॒ सखा॒ तव॒ बृह॑स्पते॒ सीष॑धः॒ सोत नो॑ म॒तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: sémā́m aviḍḍhi prábhr̥tiṃ yá ī́śiṣe -ayā́ vidhema návayā mahā́ girā́ yáthā no mīḍhvā́n stávate sákhā táva bŕ̥haspate sī́ṣadhaḥ sótá no matím
stanzas.translation: BE pleased with this our offering, thou who art the Lord; we will adore thee with this new and mighty song. As this thy friend, our liberal patron, praises thee, do thou, Br̥ihaspati, fulfil our hearts' desire.

translations.griffith: BE pleased with this our offering, thou who art the Lord; we will adore thee with this new and mighty song. As this thy friend, our liberal patron, praises thee, do thou, Br̥ihaspati, fulfil our hearts' desire.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो नन्त्वा॒न्यन॑म॒न्न्योज॑सो॒ताद॑र्दर्म॒न्युना॒ शम्ब॑राणि॒ वि प्राच्या॑वय॒दच्यु॑ता॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒रा चावि॑श॒द्वसु॑मन्तं॒ वि पर्व॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: yó nántvāny ánaman ny ójasā- -utā́dardar manyúnā śámbarāṇi ví prā́cyāvayad ácyutā bráhmaṇas pátir ā́ cā́viśad vásumantaṃ ví párvatam
stanzas.translation: He who with might bowed down the things that should be bowed, and in his fury rent the holds of Ṣambara: Who overthrew what shook not, Brahmapaspati,– he made his way within the mountain stored with wealth.

translations.griffith: He who with might bowed down the things that should be bowed, and in his fury rent the holds of Ṣambara: Who overthrew what shook not, Brahmapaspati,– he made his way within the mountain stored with wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्दे॒वानां॑ दे॒वत॑माय॒ कर्त्व॒मश्र॑थ्नन्दृ॒ळ्हाव्र॑दन्त वीळि॒ता उद्गा आ॑ज॒दभि॑न॒द्ब्रह्म॑णा व॒लमगू॑ह॒त्तमो॒ व्य॑चक्षय॒त्स्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tád devā́nāṃ devátamāya kártvam áśrathnan dr̥ḷhā́vradanta vīḷitā́ úd gā́ ājad ábhinad bráhmaṇā valám ágūhat támo vy àcakṣayat svàḥ
stanzas.translation: That was a great deed for the Godliest of the Gods: strong things were loosened and the firmly fixed gave way. He drave the kine forth and cleft Vala through by prayer, dispelled the darkness and displayed the light of heaven.

translations.griffith: That was a great deed for the Godliest of the Gods: strong things were loosened and the firmly fixed gave way. He drave the kine forth and cleft Vala through by prayer, dispelled the darkness and displayed the light of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्मा॑स्यमव॒तं ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒र्मधु॑धारम॒भि यमोज॒सातृ॑णत् तमे॒व विश्वे॑ पपिरे स्व॒र्दृशो॑ ब॒हु सा॒कं सि॑सिचु॒रुत्स॑मु॒द्रिण॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: áśmāsyam avatám bráhmaṇas pátir mádhudhāram abhí yám ójasā́tr̥ṇat tám evá víśve papire svardŕ̥śo bahú sākáṃ sisicur útsam udríṇam
stanzas.translation: The well with mouth of stone that poured a flood of meath, which Brahmapaspati hath opened with his might- All they who see the light have drunk their fill thereat: together they have made the watery fount flow forth.

translations.griffith: The well with mouth of stone that poured a flood of meath, which Brahmapaspati hath opened with his might- All they who see the light have drunk their fill thereat: together they have made the watery fount flow forth.

stanzas.sanskrit: सना॒ ता का चि॒द्भुव॑ना॒ भवी॑त्वा मा॒द्भिः श॒रद्भि॒र्दुरो॑ वरन्त वः अय॑तन्ता चरतो अ॒न्यद॑न्य॒दिद्या च॒कार॑ व॒युना॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sánā tā́ kā́ cid bhúvanā bhávītvā mādbhíḥ śarádbhir dúro varanta vaḥ áyatantā carato anyád-anyad íd yā́ cakā́ra vayúnā bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: Ancient will be those creatures, whatsoe'er they be; with moons, with autumns, doors unclose themselves to you. Effortless they pass on to perfect this and that, appointed works which Brahmaṇaspati ordained.

translations.griffith: Ancient will be those creatures, whatsoe'er they be; with moons, with autumns, doors unclose themselves to you. Effortless they pass on to perfect this and that, appointed works which Brahmaṇaspati ordained.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि॒नक्ष॑न्तो अ॒भि ये तमा॑न॒शुर्नि॒धिं प॑णी॒नां प॑र॒मं गुहा॑ हि॒तम् ते वि॒द्वांसः॑ प्रति॒चक्ष्यानृ॑ता॒ पुन॒र्यत॑ उ॒ आय॒न्तदुदी॑युरा॒विश॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: abhinákṣanto abhí yé tám ānaśúr nidhím paṇīnā́m paramáṃ gúhā hitám té vidvā́ṃsaḥ praticákṣyā́nr̥tā púnar yáta u ā́yan tád úd īyur āvíśam
stanzas.translation: They who with much endeavour searching round obtained the Paṇis' noblest treasure hidden in the cave,– Those sages, having marked the falsehoods, turned them back whence they had come, and sought again to enter in.

translations.griffith: They who with much endeavour searching round obtained the Paṇis' noblest treasure hidden in the cave,– Those sages, having marked the falsehoods, turned them back whence they had come, and sought again to enter in.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तावा॑नः प्रति॒चक्ष्यानृ॑ता॒ पुन॒रात॒ आ त॑स्थुः क॒वयो॑ म॒हस्प॒थः ते बा॒हुभ्यां॑ धमि॒तम॒ग्निमश्म॑नि॒ नकिः॒ षो अ॒स्त्यर॑णो ज॒हुर्हि तम्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tā́vānaḥ praticákṣyā́nr̥tā púnar ā́ta ā́ tasthuḥ kaváyo mahás patháḥ té bāhúbhyāṃ dhamitám agním áśmani nákiḥ ṣó asty áraṇo jahúr hí tám
stanzas.translation: The pious ones when they had seen the falsehoods turned them back, the sages stood again upon the lofty ways. Cast down with both their arms upon the rock they left the kindled fire, and said, No enemy is he.

translations.griffith: The pious ones when they had seen the falsehoods turned them back, the sages stood again upon the lofty ways. Cast down with both their arms upon the rock they left the kindled fire, and said, No enemy is he.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तज्ये॑न क्षि॒प्रेण॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒र्यत्र॒ वष्टि॒ प्र तद॑श्नोति॒ धन्व॑ना तस्य॑ सा॒ध्वीरिष॑वो॒ याभि॒रस्य॑ति नृ॒चक्ष॑सो दृ॒शये॒ कर्ण॑योनयः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tájyena kṣipréṇa bráhmaṇas pátir yátra váṣṭi prá tád aśnoti dhánvanā tásya sādhvī́r íṣavo yā́bhir ásyati nr̥cákṣaso dr̥śáye kárṇayonayaḥ
stanzas.translation: With his swift bow, strung truly, Brahmaṇaspati reaches the mark whate'er it be that he desires. Excellent are the arrows wherewithal he shoots, keen-eyed to look on men and springing from his ear.

translations.griffith: With his swift bow, strung truly, Brahmaṇaspati reaches the mark whate'er it be that he desires. Excellent are the arrows wherewithal he shoots, keen-eyed to look on men and springing from his ear.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सं॑न॒यः स वि॑न॒यः पु॒रोहि॑तः॒ स सुष्टु॑तः॒ स यु॒धि ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑ चा॒क्ष्मो यद्वाजं॒ भर॑ते म॒ती धनादित्सूर्य॑स्तपति तप्य॒तुर्वृथा॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá saṃnayáḥ sá vinayáḥ puróhitaḥ sá súṣṭutaḥ sá yudhí bráhmaṇas pátiḥ cākṣmó yád vā́jam bhárate matī́ dhánā- -ā́d ít sū́ryas tapati tapyatúr vŕ̥thā
stanzas.translation: He brings together and he parts, the great High Priest; extolled is he, in battle Brahmapaspati. When, gracious, for the hymn he brings forth food and wealth, the glowing Sun untroubled sends forth fervent heat.

translations.griffith: He brings together and he parts, the great High Priest; extolled is he, in battle Brahmapaspati. When, gracious, for the hymn he brings forth food and wealth, the glowing Sun untroubled sends forth fervent heat.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒भु प्र॒भु प्र॑थ॒मं मे॒हना॑वतो॒ बृह॒स्पतेः॑ सुवि॒दत्रा॑णि॒ राध्या॑ इ॒मा सा॒तानि॑ वे॒न्यस्य॑ वा॒जिनो॒ येन॒ जना॑ उ॒भये॑ भुञ्ज॒ते विशः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vibhú prabhú prathamám mehánāvato bŕ̥haspáteḥ suvidátrāṇi rā́dhyā imā́ sātā́ni venyásya vājíno yéna jánā ubháye bhuñjaté víśaḥ
stanzas.translation: First and preeminent, excelling all besides are the kind gifts of liberal Br̥ihaspati. These are the boons of him the Strong who should be loved, whereby both classes and the people have delight.

translations.griffith: First and preeminent, excelling all besides are the kind gifts of liberal Br̥ihaspati. These are the boons of him the Strong who should be loved, whereby both classes and the people have delight.

stanzas.sanskrit: योऽव॑रे वृ॒जने॑ वि॒श्वथा॑ वि॒भुर्म॒हामु॑ र॒ण्वः शव॑सा व॒वक्षि॑थ स दे॒वो दे॒वान्प्रति॑ पप्रथे पृ॒थु विश्वेदु॒ ता प॑रि॒भूर्ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó 'vare vr̥jáne viśváthā vibhúr mahā́m u raṇváḥ śávasā vavákṣitha sá devó devā́n práti paprathe pr̥thú víśvéd u tā́ paribhū́r bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou who in every way supreme in earthly power, rejoicing, by thy mighty strength hast waxen great,– He is the God spread forth in breadth against the Gods: he, Brahmaṇaspati, encompasseth this All.

translations.griffith: Thou who in every way supreme in earthly power, rejoicing, by thy mighty strength hast waxen great,– He is the God spread forth in breadth against the Gods: he, Brahmaṇaspati, encompasseth this All.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वं॑ स॒त्यं म॑घवाना यु॒वोरिदाप॑श्च॒न प्र मि॑नन्ति व्र॒तं वा॑म् अच्छे॑न्द्राब्रह्मणस्पती ह॒विर्नोऽन्नं॒ युजे॑व वा॒जिना॑ जिगातम्
stanzas.transliteration: víśvaṃ satyám maghavānā yuvór íd ā́paś caná prá minanti vratáṃ vām áchendrābrahmaṇaspatī havír naḥ- -ánnaṃ yújeva vājínā jigātam
stanzas.translation: From you, twain Maghavans, all truth proceedeth: even the waters break not your commandment. Come to us, Brahmaṇaspati and Indra, to our oblation Iiie yoked steeds to fodder.

translations.griffith: From you, twain Maghavans, all truth proceedeth: even the waters break not your commandment. Come to us, Brahmaṇaspati and Indra, to our oblation Iiie yoked steeds to fodder.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ताशि॑ष्ठा॒ अनु॑ शृण्वन्ति॒ वह्न॑यः स॒भेयो॒ विप्रो॑ भरते म॒ती धना॑ वी॒ळु॒द्वेषा॒ अनु॒ वश॑ ऋ॒णमा॑द॒दिः स ह॑ वा॒जी स॑मि॒थे ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: utā́śiṣṭhā ánu śr̥ṇvanti váhnayaḥ sabhéyo vípro bharate matī́ dhánā vīḷudvéṣā ánu váśa r̥ṇám ādadíḥ sá ha vājī́ samithé bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: The sacrificial flames most swiftly hear the call: the priest of the assembly gaineth wealth for hymns. Hating the stern, remitting at his will the debt, strong in the shock of fight is Brahmaṇaspati.

translations.griffith: The sacrificial flames most swiftly hear the call: the priest of the assembly gaineth wealth for hymns. Hating the stern, remitting at his will the debt, strong in the shock of fight is Brahmaṇaspati.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पते॑रभवद्यथाव॒शं स॒त्यो म॒न्युर्महि॒ कर्मा॑ करिष्य॒तः यो गा उ॒दाज॒त्स दि॒वे वि चा॑भजन्म॒हीव॑ री॒तिः शव॑सासर॒त्पृथ॑क्
stanzas.transliteration: bráhmaṇas páter abhavad yathāvaśáṃ satyó manyúr máhi kármā kariṣyatáḥ yó gā́ udā́jat sá divé ví cābhajat- mahī́va rītíḥ śávasāsarat pŕ̥thak
stanzas.translation: The wrath of Brahmaṇaspati according to his will had full effect when he would do a mighty deed. The kine he drave forth and distributed to heaven, even as a copious flood with strength flows sundry ways.

translations.griffith: The wrath of Brahmaṇaspati according to his will had full effect when he would do a mighty deed. The kine he drave forth and distributed to heaven, even as a copious flood with strength flows sundry ways.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्म॑णस्पते सु॒यम॑स्य वि॒श्वहा॑ रा॒यः स्या॑म र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ वय॑स्वतः वी॒रेषु॑ वी॒राँ उप॑ पृङ्धि न॒स्त्वं यदीशा॑नो॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ वेषि॑ मे॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: bráhmaṇas pate suyámasya viśváhā rāyáḥ syāma rathyò váyasvataḥ vīréṣu vīrā́m̐ úpa pr̥ṅdhi nas tváṃ yád ī́śāno bráhmaṇā véṣi me hávam
stanzas.translation: O Brahmaṇaspati, may we be evermore masters of wealth well-guided, full of vital strength. Heroes on heroes send abundantly to us, when thou omnipotent through prayer seekest my call.

translations.griffith: O Brahmaṇaspati, may we be evermore masters of wealth well-guided, full of vital strength. Heroes on heroes send abundantly to us, when thou omnipotent through prayer seekest my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्म॑णस्पते॒ त्वम॒स्य य॒न्ता सू॒क्तस्य॑ बोधि॒ तन॑यं च जिन्व विश्वं॒ तद्भ॒द्रं यदव॑न्ति दे॒वा बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: bráhmaṇas pate tvám asyá yantā́ sūktásya bodhi tánayaṃ ca jinva víśvaṃ tád bhadráṃ yád ávanti devā́ḥ- br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn, and prosper thou our children. All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: O Brahmaṇaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn, and prosper thou our children. All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्धा॑नो अ॒ग्निं व॑नवद्वनुष्य॒तः कृ॒तब्र॑ह्मा शूशुवद्रा॒तह॑व्य॒ इत् जा॒तेन॑ जा॒तमति॒ स प्र स॑र्सृते॒ यंयं॒ युजं॑ कृणु॒ते ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: índhāno agníṃ vanavad vanuṣyatáḥ kr̥tábrahmā śūśuvad rātáhavya ít jāténa jātám áti sá prá sarsr̥te yáṃ-yaṃ yújaṃ kr̥ṇuté bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: HE lighting up the flame shall conquer enemies: strong shall he be who offers prayer and brings his gift. He with his seed spreads forth beyond another's seed, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

translations.griffith: HE lighting up the flame shall conquer enemies: strong shall he be who offers prayer and brings his gift. He with his seed spreads forth beyond another's seed, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: वी॒रेभि॑र्वी॒रान्व॑नवद्वनुष्य॒तो गोभी॑ र॒यिं प॑प्रथ॒द्बोध॑ति॒ त्मना॑ तो॒कं च॒ तस्य॒ तन॑यं च वर्धते॒ यंयं॒ युजं॑ कृणु॒ते ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vīrébhir vīrā́n vanavad vanuṣyató góbhī rayím paprathad bódhati tmánā tokáṃ ca tásya tánayaṃ ca vardhate yáṃ-yaṃ yújaṃ kr̥ṇuté bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: With heroes he shall overcome his hero foes, and spread his wealth by kine wise by himself is be. His children and his children's children grow in strength, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

translations.griffith: With heroes he shall overcome his hero foes, and spread his wealth by kine wise by himself is be. His children and his children's children grow in strength, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: सिन्धु॒र्न क्षोदः॒ शिमी॑वाँ ऋघाय॒तो वृषे॑व॒ वध्रीँ॑र॒भि व॒ष्ट्योज॑सा अ॒ग्नेरि॑व॒ प्रसि॑ति॒र्नाह॒ वर्त॑वे॒ यंयं॒ युजं॑ कृणु॒ते ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: síndhur ná kṣódaḥ śímīvām̐ r̥ghāyató vŕ̥ṣeva vádhrīm̐r abhí vaṣṭy ójasā agnér iva prásitir nā́ha vártave yáṃ-yaṃ yújaṃ kr̥ṇuté bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: He, mighty like a raving river's billowy flood, as a bull conquers oxen, overcomes with strength. Like Agni's blazing rush he may not be restrained, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

translations.griffith: He, mighty like a raving river's billowy flood, as a bull conquers oxen, overcomes with strength. Like Agni's blazing rush he may not be restrained, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: तस्मा॑ अर्षन्ति दि॒व्या अ॑स॒श्चतः॒ स सत्व॑भिः प्रथ॒मो गोषु॑ गच्छति अनि॑भृष्टतविषिर्ह॒न्त्योज॑सा॒ यंयं॒ युजं॑ कृणु॒ते ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tásmā arṣanti divyā́ asaścátaḥ sá sátvabhiḥ prathamó góṣu gachati ánibhr̥ṣṭataviṣir hanty ójasā yáṃ-yaṃ yújaṃ kr̥ṇuté bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: For him the floods of heaven flow never failing down: first with the heroes he goes forth to war for kine. He slays in unabated vigour with great might, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

translations.griffith: For him the floods of heaven flow never failing down: first with the heroes he goes forth to war for kine. He slays in unabated vigour with great might, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: तस्मा॒ इद्विश्वे॑ धुनयन्त॒ सिन्ध॒वोऽच्छि॑द्रा॒ शर्म॑ दधिरे पु॒रूणि॑ दे॒वानां॑ सु॒म्ने सु॒भगः॒ स ए॑धते॒ यंयं॒ युजं॑ कृणु॒ते ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tásmā íd víśve dhunayanta síndhavaḥ- -áchidrā śárma dadhire purū́ṇi devā́nāṃ sumné subhágaḥ sá edhate yáṃ-yaṃ yújaṃ kr̥ṇuté bráhmaṇas pátiḥ
stanzas.translation: All roaring rivers pour their waters down for him, and many a flawless shelter hath been granted him. Blest with the happiness of Gods he prospers well, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

translations.griffith: All roaring rivers pour their waters down for him, and many a flawless shelter hath been granted him. Blest with the happiness of Gods he prospers well, whomever Brahmaṇaspati takes for his friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒जुरिच्छंसो॑ वनवद्वनुष्य॒तो दे॑व॒यन्निददे॑वयन्तम॒भ्य॑सत् सु॒प्रा॒वीरिद्व॑नवत्पृ॒त्सु दु॒ष्टरं॒ यज्वेदय॑ज्यो॒र्वि भ॑जाति॒ भोज॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥júr íc cháṃso vanavad vanuṣyató devayánn íd ádevayantam abhy àsat suprāvī́r íd vanavat pr̥tsú duṣṭáraṃ yájvéd áyajyor ví bhajāti bhójanam
stanzas.translation: THE righteous singer shall o'ercome his enemies, and he who serves the Gods subdue the godless man. The zealous man shall vanquish the invincible, the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.

translations.griffith: THE righteous singer shall o'ercome his enemies, and he who serves the Gods subdue the godless man. The zealous man shall vanquish the invincible, the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.

stanzas.sanskrit: यज॑स्व वीर॒ प्र वि॑हि मनाय॒तो भ॒द्रं मनः॑ कृणुष्व वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑ ह॒विष्कृ॑णुष्व सु॒भगो॒ यथास॑सि॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पते॒रव॒ आ वृ॑णीमहे
stanzas.transliteration: yájasva vīra prá vihi manāyató bhadrám mánaḥ kr̥ṇuṣva vr̥tratū́rye havíṣ kr̥ṇuṣva subhágo yáthā́sasi bráhmaṇas páter áva ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe
stanzas.translation: Worship, thou hero, chase the arrogant afar: put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes. Prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success. we crave the favouring help of Brahmaṇaspati.

translations.griffith: Worship, thou hero, chase the arrogant afar: put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes. Prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success. we crave the favouring help of Brahmaṇaspati.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इज्जने॑न॒ स वि॒शा स जन्म॑ना॒ स पु॒त्रैर्वाजं॑ भरते॒ धना॒ नृभिः॑ दे॒वानां॒ यः पि॒तर॑मा॒विवा॑सति श्र॒द्धाम॑ना ह॒विषा॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá íj jánena sá viśā́ sá jánmanā sá putraír vā́jam bharate dhánā nŕ̥bhiḥ devā́nāṃ yáḥ pitáram āvívāsati śraddhā́manā havíṣā bráhmaṇas pátim
stanzas.translation: He with his folk, his house, his family, his sons, gains booty for himself, and, with the heroes, wealth,believing Who with oblation and a true heart serves Brahmaṇaspati the Father of the Gods.

translations.griffith: He with his folk, his house, his family, his sons, gains booty for himself, and, with the heroes, wealth,believing Who with oblation and a true heart serves Brahmaṇaspati the Father of the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो अ॑स्मै ह॒व्यैर्घृ॒तव॑द्भि॒रवि॑ध॒त्प्र तं प्रा॒चा न॑यति॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑ उ॒रु॒ष्यती॒मंह॑सो॒ रक्ष॑ती रि॒षों॒३॒॑ऽहोश्चि॑दस्मा उरु॒चक्रि॒रद्भु॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: yó asmai havyaír ghr̥távadbhir ávidhat prá tám prācā́ nayati bráhmaṇas pátiḥ uruṣyátīm áṃhaso rákṣatī riṣáḥ- -aṃhóś cid asmā urucákrir ádbhutaḥ
stanzas.translation: Whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil, him Brahmaṇaspati leads forward on his way, Saves him from sorrow, frees him from his enemy, and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.

translations.griffith: Whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil, him Brahmaṇaspati leads forward on his way, Saves him from sorrow, frees him from his enemy, and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा गिर॑ आदि॒त्येभ्यो॑ घृ॒तस्नूः॑ स॒नाद्राज॑भ्यो जु॒ह्वा॑ जुहोमि शृ॒णोतु॑ मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा भगो॑ नस्तुविजा॒तो वरु॑णो॒ दक्षो॒ अंशः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ gíra ādityébhyo ghr̥tásnūḥ sanā́d rā́jabhyo juhvā̀ juhomi śr̥ṇótu mitró aryamā́ bhágo nas tuvijātó váruṇo dákṣo áṃśaḥ
stanzas.translation: THESE hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer tothe Kings Âdityas. May Mitra, Aryanian, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuṇa Daksha, and Anṣa.

translations.griffith: THESE hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer tothe Kings Âdityas. May Mitra, Aryanian, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuṇa Daksha, and Anṣa.
translations.macdonell: These songs that drip with butter, with the ladle I ever to the kings, Ādityas, offer. May Mitra, Aryaman, and Bhaga hear us, Dakṣa, the mighty Varuṇa, and Aṃśa.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं स्तोमं॒ सक्र॑तवो मे अ॒द्य मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णो जुषन्त आ॒दि॒त्यासः॒ शुच॑यो॒ धार॑पूता॒ अवृ॑जिना अनव॒द्या अरि॑ष्टाः
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ stómaṃ sákratavo me adyá mitró aryamā́ váruṇo juṣanta ādityā́saḥ śúcayo dhā́rapūtāḥ- ávr̥jinā anavadyā́ áriṣṭāḥ
stanzas.translation: With one accord may Aryaman and Mitra and Varuṇa this day accept this praise-song- Âdityas bright and pure as streams of water, free from all guile and falsehood, blameless, perfect.

translations.griffith: With one accord may Aryaman and Mitra and Varuṇa this day accept this praise-song- Âdityas bright and pure as streams of water, free from all guile and falsehood, blameless, perfect.
translations.macdonell: This praise of mine may Aryaman and Mitra And Varuṇa to-day accept united: The radiant Ādityas, like sword-blades shining, From guile and falsehood free, unscathed, and blameless.

stanzas.sanskrit: त आ॑दि॒त्यास॑ उ॒रवो॑ गभी॒रा अद॑ब्धासो॒ दिप्स॑न्तो भूर्य॒क्षाः अ॒न्तः प॑श्यन्ति वृजि॒नोत सा॒धु सर्वं॒ राज॑भ्यः पर॒मा चि॒दन्ति॑
stanzas.transliteration: tá ādityā́sa urávo gabhīrā́ḥ- ádabdhāso dípsanto bhūryakṣā́ḥ antáḥ paśyanti vr̥jinótá sādhú sárvaṃ rā́jabhyaḥ paramā́ cid ánti
stanzas.translation: These Gods, Âdityas, vast, profound, and faithful, with many eyes, fain to deceive the wicked, Looking within behold the good and evil near to the Kings is even the thing most distant.

translations.griffith: These Gods, Âdityas, vast, profound, and faithful, with many eyes, fain to deceive the wicked, Looking within behold the good and evil near to the Kings is even the thing most distant.
translations.macdonell: These Ādityas are deep and far-extending, With many eyes, deceived not, but deceiving. They look within, and see the straight and crooked. Nigh to the kings is all, even what is farthest.

stanzas.sanskrit: धा॒रय॑न्त आदि॒त्यासो॒ जग॒त्स्था दे॒वा विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य गो॒पाः दी॒र्घाधि॑यो॒ रक्ष॑माणा असु॒र्य॑मृ॒तावा॑न॒श्चय॑माना ऋ॒णानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: dhāráyanta ādityā́so jágat sthā́ḥ- devā́ víśvasya bhúvanasya gopā́ḥ dīrghā́dhiyo rákṣamāṇā asuryàm r̥tā́vānaś cáyamānā r̥ṇā́ni
stanzas.translation: Upholding that which moves and that which moves not, Âdityas, Gods, protectors of all being, Provident, guarding well the world of spirits, true to eternal Law, the debt-exactors.

translations.griffith: Upholding that which moves and that which moves not, Âdityas, Gods, protectors of all being, Provident, guarding well the world of spirits, true to eternal Law, the debt-exactors.
translations.macdonell: The Ādityas support what's fixed and moving; These gods are guardians of the whole creation: Far-sighted, cherishing their spirit-power, Observing holy law and guilt chastising.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒द्यामा॑दित्या॒ अव॑सो वो अ॒स्य यद॑र्यमन्भ॒य आ चि॑न्मयो॒भु यु॒ष्माकं॑ मित्रावरुणा॒ प्रणी॑तौ॒ परि॒ श्वभ्रे॑व दुरि॒तानि॑ वृज्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: vidyā́m ādityā ávaso vo asyá yád aryaman bhayá ā́ cin mayobhú yuṣmā́kam mitrāvaruṇā práṇītau pári śvábhreva duritā́ni vr̥jyām
stanzas.translation: May I, Âdityas, share m this your favour which, Aryaman, brings profit e'en in danger. Under your guidance, Varuṇa and Mitra, round troubles may I pass, like rugged places.

translations.griffith: May I, Âdityas, share m this your favour which, Aryaman, brings profit e'en in danger. Under your guidance, Varuṇa and Mitra, round troubles may I pass, like rugged places.
translations.macdonell: May I, O Ādityas, meet with your favour, Which even in danger, Aryaman, brings comfort. Guided by you, O Varuṇa and Mitra, May I avoid all troublous times, like pitfalls.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒गो हि वो॑ अर्यमन्मित्र॒ पन्था॑ अनृक्ष॒रो व॑रुण सा॒धुरस्ति॑ तेना॑दित्या॒ अधि॑ वोचता नो॒ यच्छ॑ता नो दुष्परि॒हन्तु॒ शर्म॑
stanzas.transliteration: sugó hí vo aryaman mitra pánthāḥ- anr̥kṣaró varuṇa sādhúr ásti ténādityā ádhi vocatā no yáchatā no duṣparihántu śárma
stanzas.translation: Smooth is your path, O Aryaman and Mitra; excellent is it, Varuṇa, and thornless. Thereon, Âdityas, send us down your blessing: grant us a shelter hard to be demolished.

translations.griffith: Smooth is your path, O Aryaman and Mitra; excellent is it, Varuṇa, and thornless. Thereon, Âdityas, send us down your blessing: grant us a shelter hard to be demolished.
translations.macdonell: Smooth is your path, O Aryaman and Mitra; It is straightforward, Varuṇa, and thornless. On that, O Ādityas, speak in our favour; Bestow on us invincible protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: पिप॑र्तु नो॒ अदि॑ती॒ राज॑पु॒त्राति॒ द्वेषां॑स्यर्य॒मा सु॒गेभिः॑ बृ॒हन्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ शर्मोप॑ स्याम पुरु॒वीरा॒ अरि॑ष्टाः
stanzas.transliteration: pípartu no áditī rā́japutrā- -áti dvéṣāṃsy aryamā́ sugébhiḥ br̥hán mitrásya váruṇasya śárma- -úpa syāma puruvī́rā áriṣṭāḥ
stanzas.translation: Mother of Kings, may Aditi transport us, by fair paths Aryaman, beyond all hatred. May we uninjured, girt by many heroes, win Varuṇa's and Mitra's high protection.

translations.griffith: Mother of Kings, may Aditi transport us, by fair paths Aryaman, beyond all hatred. May we uninjured, girt by many heroes, win Varuṇa's and Mitra's high protection.
translations.macdonell: May Aryaman, may Aditi, kings' mother, By easy paths through enmities transport us. We would unscathed, possessed of many heroes, Win Varuṇa's and Mitra's high protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: ति॒स्रो भूमी॑र्धारय॒न्त्रीँरु॒त द्यून्त्रीणि॑ व्र॒ता वि॒दथे॑ अ॒न्तरे॑षाम् ऋ॒तेना॑दित्या॒ महि॑ वो महि॒त्वं तद॑र्यमन्वरुण मित्र॒ चारु॑
stanzas.transliteration: tisró bhū́mīr dhārayan trī́m̐r utá dyū́n trī́ṇi vratā́ vidáthe antár eṣām r̥ténādityā máhi vo mahitváṃ tád aryaman varuṇa mitra cā́ru
stanzas.translation: With their support they stay three earths, three heavens; three are their functions in the Gods' assembly. Mighty through Law, Âdityas, is your greatness; fair is it, Aryaman, Varuṇa, and Mitra.

translations.griffith: With their support they stay three earths, three heavens; three are their functions in the Gods' assembly. Mighty through Law, Âdityas, is your greatness; fair is it, Aryaman, Varuṇa, and Mitra.
translations.macdonell: Three earths, three heavens, too, these gods supported, Three are their services within our synod. By Law is mighty, Ādityas, your greatness And fair, Aryaman, Varuṇa and Mitra.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्री रो॑च॒ना दि॒व्या धा॑रयन्त हिर॒ण्ययाः॒ शुच॑यो॒ धार॑पूताः अस्व॑प्नजो अनिमि॒षा अद॑ब्धा उरु॒शंसा॑ ऋ॒जवे॒ मर्त्या॑य
stanzas.transliteration: trī́ rocanā́ divyā́ dhārayanta hiraṇyáyāḥ śúcayo dhā́rapūtāḥ ásvapnajo animiṣā́ ádabdhāḥ- uruśáṃsā r̥jáve mártyāya
stanzas.translation: Golden and splendid, pure like streams of water, they hold aloft the three bright heavenly regions. Ne'er do they slumber, never close their eyelids, faithful, far-ruling for the righteous mortal.

translations.griffith: Golden and splendid, pure like streams of water, they hold aloft the three bright heavenly regions. Ne'er do they slumber, never close their eyelids, faithful, far-ruling for the righteous mortal.
translations.macdonell: Of golden aspect, radiant, bright, as sword-blades, They have upheld the three light realms of heaven. They slumber not, nor close their eyes, unfailing They rule afar to help the truthful mortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं विश्वे॑षां वरुणासि॒ राजा॒ ये च॑ दे॒वा अ॑सुर॒ ये च॒ मर्ताः॑ श॒तं नो॑ रास्व श॒रदो॑ वि॒चक्षे॒ऽश्यामायूं॑षि॒ सुधि॑तानि॒ पूर्वा॑
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ víśveṣāṃ varuṇāsi rā́jā yé ca devā́ asura yé ca mártāḥ śatáṃ no rāsva śarádo vicákṣe -aśyā́mā́yūṃṣi súdhitāni pū́rvā
stanzas.translation: Thou over all, O Varuṇa, art Sovran, be they Gods, Asura! or be they mortals. Grant unto us to see a hundred autumns ours be the blest long lives of our forefathers.

translations.griffith: Thou over all, O Varuṇa, art Sovran, be they Gods, Asura! or be they mortals. Grant unto us to see a hundred autumns ours be the blest long lives of our forefathers.
translations.macdonell: Thou art, O Varuṇa, of all the sovereign, Both of the gods, O Asura, and mortals. To us vouchsafe to see a hundred autumns: May we attain to lives prolonged and happy.

stanzas.sanskrit: न द॑क्षि॒णा वि चि॑किते॒ न स॒व्या न प्रा॒चीन॑मादित्या॒ नोत प॒श्चा पा॒क्या॑ चिद्वसवो धी॒र्या॑ चिद्यु॒ष्मानी॑तो॒ अभ॑यं॒ ज्योति॑रश्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: ná dakṣiṇā́ ví cikite ná savyā́ ná prācī́nam ādityā nótá paścā́ pākyā̀ cid vasavo dhīryā̀ cid yuṣmā́nīto ábhayaṃ jyótir aśyām
stanzas.translation: Neither the right nor left do I distinguish, neither the cast nor yet the west, Âdityas. Simple and guided by your wisdom, Vasus! may I attain the light that brings no danger.

translations.griffith: Neither the right nor left do I distinguish, neither the cast nor yet the west, Âdityas. Simple and guided by your wisdom, Vasus! may I attain the light that brings no danger.
translations.macdonell: Neither the right nor left can I distinguish. Neither before nor yet behind, Ādityas. May I by you directed, reach with safety. Bright gods, the light by innocence or wisdom.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो राज॑भ्य ऋत॒निभ्यो॑ द॒दाश॒ यं व॒र्धय॑न्ति पु॒ष्टय॑श्च॒ नित्याः॑ स रे॒वान्या॑ति प्रथ॒मो रथे॑न वसु॒दावा॑ वि॒दथे॑षु प्रश॒स्तः
stanzas.transliteration: yó rā́jabhya r̥taníbhyo dadā́śa yáṃ vardháyanti puṣṭáyaś ca nítyāḥ sá revā́n yāti prathamó ráthena vasudā́vā vidátheṣu praśastáḥ
stanzas.translation: He who bears gifts unto the Kings, true Leaders, he whom their everlasting blessings prosper, Moves with his chariot first in rank and wealthy, munificent and lauded in assemblies.

translations.griffith: He who bears gifts unto the Kings, true Leaders, he whom their everlasting blessings prosper, Moves with his chariot first in rank and wealthy, munificent and lauded in assemblies.
translations.macdonell: Who to the kings that lead the law pays worship, And whom thus constant blessings cause to flourish, He, affluent, rides foremost in his chariot. Bestowing gifts and in assemblies lauded.

stanzas.sanskrit: शुचि॑र॒पः सू॒यव॑सा॒ अद॑ब्ध॒ उप॑ क्षेति वृ॒द्धव॑याः सु॒वीरः॑ नकि॒ष्टं घ्न॒न्त्यन्ति॑तो॒ न दू॒राद्य आ॑दि॒त्यानां॒ भव॑ति॒ प्रणी॑तौ
stanzas.transliteration: śúcir apáḥ sūyávasā ádabdhaḥ- úpa kṣeti vr̥ddhávayāḥ suvī́raḥ nákiṣ ṭáṃ ghnanty ántito ná dūrā́d yá ādityā́nām bhávati práṇītau
stanzas.translation: Pure, faithful, very strong, with heroes round him, he dwells beside the waters rich with pasture. None slays, from near at hand or from a distance, him who is under the Âdityas' guidance.

translations.griffith: Pure, faithful, very strong, with heroes round him, he dwells beside the waters rich with pasture. None slays, from near at hand or from a distance, him who is under the Âdityas' guidance.
translations.macdonell: He pure, unhurt by guile, with many heroes, Robust, abides by waters rich in pasture. Either from near or from afar none slay him Who lives beneath the Ādityas' direction.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदि॑ते॒ मित्र॒ वरु॑णो॒त मृ॑ळ॒ यद्वो॑ व॒यं च॑कृ॒मा कच्चि॒दागः॑ उ॒र्व॑श्या॒मभ॑यं॒ ज्योति॑रिन्द्र॒ मा नो॑ दी॒र्घा अ॒भि न॑श॒न्तमि॑स्राः
stanzas.transliteration: ádite mítra váruṇotá mr̥ḷa yád vo vayáṃ cakr̥mā́ kác cid ā́gaḥ urv àśyām ábhayaṃ jyótir indra mā́ no dīrghā́ abhí naśan támisrāḥ
stanzas.translation: Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, forgive us however we have erred and sinned against you. May I obtain the broad light free from peril: O Indra, let not during darkness seize us.

translations.griffith: Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, forgive us however we have erred and sinned against you. May I obtain the broad light free from peril: O Indra, let not during darkness seize us.
translations.macdonell: O Aditi and Varuṇa and Mitra, Forgive us any sin we have committed. May I obtain the light, secure and spacious, O Indra; may long darkness never reach us.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒भे अ॑स्मै पीपयतः समी॒ची दि॒वो वृ॒ष्टिं सु॒भगो॒ नाम॒ पुष्य॑न् उ॒भा क्षया॑वा॒जय॑न्याति पृ॒त्सूभावर्धौ॑ भवतः सा॒धू अ॑स्मै
stanzas.transliteration: ubhé asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī́ divó vr̥ṣṭíṃ subhágo nā́ma púṣyan ubhā́ kṣáyāv ājáyan yāti pr̥tsú- -ubhā́v árdhau bhavataḥ sādhū́ asmai
stanzas.translation: For him the Twain united pour their fulness, the rain from heaven: he thrives most highly favoured. He goes to war mastering both the mansions: to him both portions of the world are gracious.

translations.griffith: For him the Twain united pour their fulness, the rain from heaven: he thrives most highly favoured. He goes to war mastering both the mansions: to him both portions of the world are gracious.
translations.macdonell: Both worlds, combined, for him shed in abundance The rain of heaven; fortunate and thriving He goes to battle, both the mansions winning. For him the world's two halves remain propitious.

stanzas.sanskrit: या वो॑ मा॒या अ॑भि॒द्रुहे॑ यजत्राः॒ पाशा॑ आदित्या रि॒पवे॒ विचृ॑त्ताः अ॒श्वीव॒ ताँ अति॑ येषं॒ रथे॒नारि॑ष्टा उ॒रावा शर्म॑न्त्स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ vo māyā́ abhidrúhe yajatrāḥ pā́śā ādityā ripáve vícr̥ttāḥ aśvī́va tā́m̐ áti yeṣaṃ ráthena- -áriṣṭā urā́v ā́ śárman syāma
stanzas.translation: Your guiles, ye Holy Ones, to quell oppressors, your snares spread out against the foe, Âdityas, May I car-borne pass like a skilful horseman: uninjured may we dwell in spacious shelter.

translations.griffith: Your guiles, ye Holy Ones, to quell oppressors, your snares spread out against the foe, Âdityas, May I car-borne pass like a skilful horseman: uninjured may we dwell in spacious shelter.
translations.macdonell: Your wiles, intended, holy gods, for plotters. Your nooses, Ādityas, for foes unloosened: These would I pass, as with his car a driver; May we unscathed be in your wide protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: माहं म॒घोनो॑ वरुण प्रि॒यस्य॑ भूरि॒दाव्न॒ आ वि॑दं॒ शून॑मा॒पेः मा रा॒यो रा॑जन्त्सु॒यमा॒दव॑ स्थां बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́hám maghóno varuṇa priyásya bhūridā́vna ā́ vidaṃ śū́nam āpéḥ mā́ rāyó rājan suyámād áva sthām br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Lond may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Lond may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
translations.macdonell: May I not ever lack a friendly patron, Nor, Varuṇa, an open-handed comrade. May I, O King, not want well-managed riches, May we speak loud, with heroes, in the synod.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं क॒वेरा॑दि॒त्यस्य॑ स्व॒राजो॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ सान्त्य॒भ्य॑स्तु म॒ह्ना अति॒ यो म॒न्द्रो य॒जथा॑य दे॒वः सु॑की॒र्तिं भि॑क्षे॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ भूरेः॑
stanzas.transliteration: idáṃ kavér ādityásya svarā́jo víśvāni sā́nty abhy àstu mahnā́ áti yó mandró yajáthāya deváḥ sukīrtím bhikṣe váruṇasya bhū́reḥ
stanzas.translation: THIS laud of the self-radiant wise Âditya shall be supreme o'er all that is in greatness.

translations.griffith: THIS laud of the self-radiant wise Âditya shall be supreme o'er all that is in greatness.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ व्र॒ते सु॒भगा॑सः स्याम स्वा॒ध्यो॑ वरुण तुष्टु॒वांसः॑ उ॒पाय॑न उ॒षसां॒ गोम॑तीनाम॒ग्नयो॒ न जर॑माणा॒ अनु॒ द्यून्
stanzas.transliteration: táva vraté subhágāsaḥ syāma svādhyò varuṇa tuṣṭuvā́ṃsaḥ upā́yana uṣásāṃ gómatīnām agnáyo ná járamāṇā ánu dyū́n
stanzas.translation: , Having extolled thee. Varuṇa, with thoughtful care may we have high fortune in thy service, Sinffing thy praises like the fires at coming, day after day, of mornings rich in cattle.

translations.griffith: , Having extolled thee. Varuṇa, with thoughtful care may we have high fortune in thy service, Sinffing thy praises like the fires at coming, day after day, of mornings rich in cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ स्याम पुरु॒वीर॑स्य॒ शर्म॑न्नुरु॒शंस॑स्य वरुण प्रणेतः यू॒यं नः॑ पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धा अ॒भि क्ष॑मध्वं॒ युज्या॑य देवाः
stanzas.transliteration: táva syāma puruvī́rasya śármann uruśáṃsasya varuṇa praṇetaḥ yūyáṃ naḥ putrā aditer adabdhāḥ- abhí kṣamadhvaṃ yújyāya devāḥ
stanzas.translation: May we be in thy keeping, O thou Leader wide-ruling Varuṇa, Lord of many heroes. O sons of Aditi, for ever faithful, pardon us, Gods, admit us to your friendship.

translations.griffith: May we be in thy keeping, O thou Leader wide-ruling Varuṇa, Lord of many heroes. O sons of Aditi, for ever faithful, pardon us, Gods, admit us to your friendship.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र सी॑मादि॒त्यो अ॑सृजद्विध॒र्ताँ ऋ॒तं सिन्ध॑वो॒ वरु॑णस्य यन्ति न श्रा॑म्यन्ति॒ न वि मु॑चन्त्ये॒ते वयो॒ न प॑प्तू रघु॒या परि॑ज्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: prá sīm ādityó asr̥jad vidhartā́m̐ r̥táṃ síndhavo váruṇasya yanti ná śrāmyanti ná ví mucanty eté váyo ná paptū raghuyā́ párijman
stanzas.translation: He made them flow, the Âditya, the Sustainer: the rivers run by Varuṇa's commandment. These feel no weariness, nor cease from flowing: swift have they flown like birds in air around us.

translations.griffith: He made them flow, the Âditya, the Sustainer: the rivers run by Varuṇa's commandment. These feel no weariness, nor cease from flowing: swift have they flown like birds in air around us.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि मच्छ्र॑थाय रश॒नामि॒वाग॑ ऋ॒ध्याम॑ ते वरुण॒ खामृ॒तस्य॑ मा तन्तु॑श्छेदि॒ वय॑तो॒ धियं॑ मे॒ मा मात्रा॑ शार्य॒पसः॑ पु॒र ऋ॒तोः
stanzas.transliteration: ví mác chrathāya raśanā́m ivā́gaḥ- r̥dhyā́ma te varuṇa khā́m r̥tásya mā́ tántuś chedi váyato dhíyam me mā́ mā́trā śāry apásaḥ purá r̥tóḥ
stanzas.translation: Loose me from sin as from a bond that binds me: may we swell, Varuṇa, thy spring of Order. Let not my thread, while I weave song, be severed, nor my work's sum, before the time, be shattered.

translations.griffith: Loose me from sin as from a bond that binds me: may we swell, Varuṇa, thy spring of Order. Let not my thread, while I weave song, be severed, nor my work's sum, before the time, be shattered.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपो॒ सु म्य॑क्ष वरुण भि॒यसं॒ मत्सम्रा॒ळृता॒वोऽनु॑ मा गृभाय दामे॑व व॒त्साद्वि मु॑मु॒ग्ध्यंहो॑ न॒हि त्वदा॒रे नि॒मिष॑श्च॒नेशे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ápo sú myakṣa varuṇa bhiyásam mát sámrāḷ ŕ̥tāvó 'nu mā gr̥bhāya dā́meva vatsā́d ví mumugdhy áṃho nahí tvád āré nimíṣaś canéśe
stanzas.translation: Far from me, Varuṇa, remove all danger accept me graciously, thou Holy Sovran. Cast off, like cords that hold a calf, my troubles: I am not even mine eyelid's lord without thee.

translations.griffith: Far from me, Varuṇa, remove all danger accept me graciously, thou Holy Sovran. Cast off, like cords that hold a calf, my troubles: I am not even mine eyelid's lord without thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नो॑ व॒धैर्व॑रुण॒ ये त॑ इ॒ष्टावेनः॑ कृ॒ण्वन्त॑मसुर भ्री॒णन्ति॑ मा ज्योति॑षः प्रवस॒थानि॑ गन्म॒ वि षू मृधः॑ शिश्रथो जी॒वसे॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ no vadhaír varuṇa yé ta iṣṭā́v énaḥ kr̥ṇvántam asura bhrīṇánti mā́ jyótiṣaḥ pravasathā́ni ganma ví ṣū́ mŕ̥dhaḥ śiśratho jīváse naḥ
stanzas.translation: Strike us not, Varuṇa, with those dread weapons which, Asura, at thy bidding wound the sinner. Let us not pass away from light to exile. Scatter, that we may live, the men who hate us

translations.griffith: Strike us not, Varuṇa, with those dread weapons which, Asura, at thy bidding wound the sinner. Let us not pass away from light to exile. Scatter, that we may live, the men who hate us

stanzas.sanskrit: नमः॑ पु॒रा ते॑ वरुणो॒त नू॒नमु॒ताप॒रं तु॑विजात ब्रवाम त्वे हि कं॒ पर्व॑ते॒ न श्रि॒तान्यप्र॑च्युतानि दूळभ व्र॒तानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: námaḥ purā́ te varuṇotá nūnám utā́paráṃ tuvijāta bravāma tvé hí kam párvate ná śritā́ni- ápracyutāni dūḷabha vratā́ni
stanzas.translation: O mighty Varuṇa, now and hereafter, even as of old, will we speak forth our worship. For in thyself, invincible God, thy statutes ne'er to be moved are fixed as on a mountain.

translations.griffith: O mighty Varuṇa, now and hereafter, even as of old, will we speak forth our worship. For in thyself, invincible God, thy statutes ne'er to be moved are fixed as on a mountain.

stanzas.sanskrit: पर॑ ऋ॒णा सा॑वी॒रध॒ मत्कृ॑तानि॒ माहं रा॑जन्न॒न्यकृ॑तेन भोजम् अव्यु॑ष्टा॒ इन्नु भूय॑सीरु॒षास॒ आ नो॑ जी॒वान्व॑रुण॒ तासु॑ शाधि
stanzas.transliteration: pára r̥ṇā́ sāvīr ádha mátkr̥tāni mā́háṃ rājann anyákr̥tena bhojam ávyuṣṭā ín nú bhū́yasīr uṣā́saḥ- ā́ no jīvā́n varuṇa tā́su śādhi
stanzas.translation: Move far from me what sins I have committed: let me not suffer, King, for guilt of others. Full many a morn remains to dawn upon us: in these, O Varuṇa, while we live direct us.

translations.griffith: Move far from me what sins I have committed: let me not suffer, King, for guilt of others. Full many a morn remains to dawn upon us: in these, O Varuṇa, while we live direct us.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो मे॑ राज॒न्युज्यो॑ वा॒ सखा॑ वा॒ स्वप्ने॑ भ॒यं भी॒रवे॒ मह्य॒माह॑ स्ते॒नो वा॒ यो दिप्स॑ति नो॒ वृको॑ वा॒ त्वं तस्मा॑द्वरुण पाह्य॒स्मान्
stanzas.transliteration: yó me rājan yújyo vā sákhā vā svápne bhayám bhīráve máhyam ā́ha stenó vā yó dípsati no vŕ̥ko vā tváṃ tásmād varuṇa pāhy asmā́n
stanzas.translation: O King, whoever, be he friend or kinsman, hath threatened me affrighted in my slumber- If any wolf or robber fain would harm us, therefrom, O Varuṇa, give thou us protection.

translations.griffith: O King, whoever, be he friend or kinsman, hath threatened me affrighted in my slumber- If any wolf or robber fain would harm us, therefrom, O Varuṇa, give thou us protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: माहं म॒घोनो॑ वरुण प्रि॒यस्य॑ भूरि॒दाव्न॒ आ वि॑दं॒ शून॑मा॒पेः मा रा॒यो रा॑जन्त्सु॒यमा॒दव॑ स्थां बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́hám maghóno varuṇa priyásya bhūridā́vna ā́ vidaṃ śū́nam āpéḥ mā́ rāyó rājan suyámād áva sthām br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: May I not live O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: May I not live O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: धृत॑व्रता॒ आदि॑त्या॒ इषि॑रा आ॒रे मत्क॑र्त रह॒सूरि॒वागः॑ शृ॒ण्व॒तो वो॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ देवा॑ भ॒द्रस्य॑ वि॒द्वाँ अव॑से हुवे वः
stanzas.transliteration: dhŕ̥tavratā ā́dityā íṣirāḥ- āré mát karta rahasū́r ivā́gaḥ śr̥ṇvató vo váruṇa mítra dévāḥ- bhadrásya vidvā́m̐ ávase huve vaḥ
stanzas.translation: UPHOLDERS of the Law, ye strong Âdityas, remove my sin like her who bears in secret. You, Varuṇa, Mitra and all Gods who listen, I call to help me, I who know your goodness.

translations.griffith: UPHOLDERS of the Law, ye strong Âdityas, remove my sin like her who bears in secret. You, Varuṇa, Mitra and all Gods who listen, I call to help me, I who know your goodness.

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं दे॑वाः॒ प्रम॑तिर्यू॒यमोजो॑ यू॒यं द्वेषां॑सि सनु॒तर्यु॑योत अ॒भि॒क्ष॒त्तारो॑ अ॒भि च॒ क्षम॑ध्वम॒द्या च॑ नो मृ॒ळय॑ताप॒रं च॑
stanzas.transliteration: yūyáṃ devāḥ prámatir yūyám ójo yūyáṃ dvéṣāṃsi sanutár yuyota abhikṣattā́ro abhí ca kṣámadhvam adyā́ ca no mr̥ḷáyatāparáṃ ca
stanzas.translation: Ye, Gods, are providence and ye are power: remove ye utterly all those who hate us. As givers of good things deal with us kindly: this day be gracious to us and hereafter.

translations.griffith: Ye, Gods, are providence and ye are power: remove ye utterly all those who hate us. As givers of good things deal with us kindly: this day be gracious to us and hereafter.

stanzas.sanskrit: किमू॒ नु वः॑ कृणवा॒माप॑रेण॒ किं सने॑न वसव॒ आप्ये॑न यू॒यं नो॑ मित्रावरुणादिते च स्व॒स्तिमि॑न्द्रामरुतो दधात
stanzas.transliteration: kím ū nú vaḥ kr̥ṇavāmā́pareṇa kíṃ sánena vasava ā́pyena yūyáṃ no mitrāvaruṇādite ca svastím indrāmaruto dadhāta
stanzas.translation: What service may we do you with our future, what service, Vasus, with our ancient friendship? O Aditi, and VaruVa and Mitra, Indra and Maruts, make us well and happy.

translations.griffith: What service may we do you with our future, what service, Vasus, with our ancient friendship? O Aditi, and VaruVa and Mitra, Indra and Maruts, make us well and happy.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह॒ये दे॑वा यू॒यमिदा॒पयः॑ स्थ॒ ते मृ॑ळत॒ नाध॑मानाय॒ मह्य॑म् मा वो॒ रथो॑ मध्यम॒वाळृ॒ते भू॒न्मा यु॒ष्माव॑त्स्वा॒पिषु॑ श्रमिष्म
stanzas.transliteration: hayé devā yūyám íd āpáya stha té mr̥ḷata nā́dhamānāya máhyam mā́ vo rátho madhyamavā́ḷ r̥té bhūt- mā́ yuṣmā́vatsv āpíṣu śramiṣma
stanzas.translation: Ye, O ye Gods, are verily our kinsmen as such be kind to me who now implore you. Let not your car come slowly to our worship: of kinsmen such as you ne'er let us weary.

translations.griffith: Ye, O ye Gods, are verily our kinsmen as such be kind to me who now implore you. Let not your car come slowly to our worship: of kinsmen such as you ne'er let us weary.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र व॒ एको॑ मिमय॒ भूर्यागो॒ यन्मा॑ पि॒तेव॑ कित॒वं श॑शा॒स आ॒रे पाशा॑ आ॒रे अ॒घानि॑ देवा॒ मा माधि॑ पु॒त्रे विमि॑व ग्रभीष्ट
stanzas.transliteration: prá va éko mimaya bhū́ry ā́go yán mā pitéva kitaváṃ śaśāsá āré pā́śā āré aghā́ni devāḥ- mā́ mā́dhi putré vím iva grabhīṣṭa
stanzas.translation: I singly have sinned many a sin against you, and ye chastised me as a sire the gambler. Far be your nets, far, Gods, be mine offences: seize me not like a bird upon her offspring.

translations.griffith: I singly have sinned many a sin against you, and ye chastised me as a sire the gambler. Far be your nets, far, Gods, be mine offences: seize me not like a bird upon her offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वाञ्चो॑ अ॒द्या भ॑वता यजत्रा॒ आ वो॒ हार्दि॒ भय॑मानो व्ययेयम् त्राध्वं॑ नो देवा नि॒जुरो॒ वृक॑स्य॒ त्राध्वं॑ क॒र्ताद॑व॒पदो॑ यजत्राः
stanzas.transliteration: arvā́ñco adyā́ bhavatā yajatrāḥ- ā́ vo hā́rdi bháyamāno vyayeyam trā́dhvaṃ no devā nijúro vŕ̥kasya trā́dhvaṃ kartā́d avapádo yajatrāḥ
stanzas.translation: Turn yourselves hitherward this day, ye Holy, that fearing in my heart I may approach you. Protect us, God; let not the wolf destroy us. Save us, ye Holy, from the pit and falling.

translations.griffith: Turn yourselves hitherward this day, ye Holy, that fearing in my heart I may approach you. Protect us, God; let not the wolf destroy us. Save us, ye Holy, from the pit and falling.

stanzas.sanskrit: माहं म॒घोनो॑ वरुण प्रि॒यस्य॑ भूरि॒दाव्न॒ आ वि॑दं॒ शून॑मा॒पेः मा रा॒यो रा॑जन्त्सु॒यमा॒दव॑ स्थां बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́hám maghóno varuṇa priyásya bhūridā́vna ā́ vidaṃ śū́nam āpéḥ mā́ rāyó rājan suyámād áva sthām br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: May I not live, O Varuṇa, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तं दे॒वाय॑ कृण्व॒ते स॑वि॒त्र इन्द्रा॑याहि॒घ्ने न र॑मन्त॒ आपः॑ अह॑रहर्यात्य॒क्तुर॒पां किया॒त्या प्र॑थ॒मः सर्ग॑ आसाम्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥táṃ devā́ya kr̥ṇvaté savitré- índrāyāhighné ná ramanta ā́paḥ áhar-ahar yāty aktúr apā́ṃ kíyāty ā́ prathamáḥ sárga āsām
stanzas.translation: THE streams unceasing flow to Indra, slayer of Ahi, Savitar, God, Law's fulfiller, Day after day goes on the sheen of waters. What time hath past since they were first set flowing?

translations.griffith: THE streams unceasing flow to Indra, slayer of Ahi, Savitar, God, Law's fulfiller, Day after day goes on the sheen of waters. What time hath past since they were first set flowing?

stanzas.sanskrit: यो वृ॒त्राय॒ सिन॒मत्राभ॑रिष्य॒त्प्र तं जनि॑त्री वि॒दुष॑ उवाच प॒थो रद॑न्ती॒रनु॒ जोष॑मस्मै दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ धुन॑यो य॒न्त्यर्थ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yó vr̥trā́ya sínam átrā́bhariṣyat prá táṃ jánitrī vidúṣa uvāca pathó rádantīr ánu jóṣam asmai divé-dive dhúnayo yanty ártham
stanzas.translation: His Mother-for she knew-spake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at Vr̥itra. Cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.

translations.griffith: His Mother-for she knew-spake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at Vr̥itra. Cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्वो ह्यस्था॒दध्य॒न्तरि॒क्षेऽधा॑ वृ॒त्राय॒ प्र व॒धं ज॑भार मिहं॒ वसा॑न॒ उप॒ हीमदु॑द्रोत्ति॒ग्मायु॑धो अजय॒च्छत्रु॒मिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhvó hy ásthād ádhy antárikṣe- -ádhā vr̥trā́ya prá vadháṃ jabhāra míhaṃ vásāna úpa hī́m ádudrot tigmā́yudho ajayac chátrum índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Aloft he stood above the airy region, and against Vr̥itra shot his deadly missile. Enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him. Indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons.

translations.griffith: Aloft he stood above the airy region, and against Vr̥itra shot his deadly missile. Enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him. Indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृह॑स्पते॒ तपु॒षाश्ने॑व विध्य॒ वृक॑द्वरसो॒ असु॑रस्य वी॒रान् यथा॑ ज॒घन्थ॑ धृष॒ता पु॒रा चि॑दे॒वा ज॑हि॒ शत्रु॑म॒स्माक॑मिन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate tápuṣā́śneva vidhya vŕ̥kadvaraso ásurasya vīrā́n yáthā jaghántha dhr̥ṣatā́ purā́ cid evā́ jahi śátrum asmā́kam indra
stanzas.translation: As with a bolt, Br̥ihaspati, fiercely flaming, pierce thou Vr̥ikadvaras', the Asura's, heroes. Even as in time of old with might thou slewest, so slay even now our enemy, O Indra.

translations.griffith: As with a bolt, Br̥ihaspati, fiercely flaming, pierce thou Vr̥ikadvaras', the Asura's, heroes. Even as in time of old with might thou slewest, so slay even now our enemy, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑ क्षिप दि॒वो अश्मा॑नमु॒च्चा येन॒ शत्रुं॑ मन्दसा॒नो नि॒जूर्वाः॑ तो॒कस्य॑ सा॒तौ तन॑यस्य॒ भूरे॑र॒स्माँ अ॒र्धं कृ॑णुतादिन्द्र॒ गोना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: áva kṣipa divó áśmānam uccā́ yéna śátrum mandasānó nijū́rvāḥ tokásya sātaú tánayasya bhū́rer asmā́m̐ ardháṃ kr̥ṇutād indra gónām
stanzas.translation: Cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman. For gain of children make us thine, O Indra, of many children's children and of cattle.

translations.griffith: Cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman. For gain of children make us thine, O Indra, of many children's children and of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र हि क्रतुं॑ वृ॒हथो॒ यं व॑नु॒थो र॒ध्रस्य॑ स्थो॒ यज॑मानस्य चो॒दौ इन्द्रा॑सोमा यु॒वम॒स्माँ अ॑विष्टम॒स्मिन्भ॒यस्थे॑ कृणुतमु लो॒कम्
stanzas.transliteration: prá hí krátuṃ vr̥hátho yáṃ vanuthó radhrásya stho yájamānasya codaú índrāsomā yuvám asmā́m̐ aviṣṭam asmín bhayásthe kr̥ṇutam ulokám
stanzas.translation: Whomso ye love, his power ye aid and strengthen; ye Twain are the rich worshipper's advancers. Graciously favour us, Indra and Soma; give us firm standing in this time of danger.

translations.griffith: Whomso ye love, his power ye aid and strengthen; ye Twain are the rich worshipper's advancers. Graciously favour us, Indra and Soma; give us firm standing in this time of danger.

stanzas.sanskrit: न मा॑ तम॒न्न श्र॑म॒न्नोत त॑न्द्र॒न्न वो॑चाम॒ मा सु॑नो॒तेति॒ सोम॑म् यो मे॑ पृ॒णाद्यो दद॒द्यो नि॒बोधा॒द्यो मा॑ सु॒न्वन्त॒मुप॒ गोभि॒राय॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ná mā taman ná śraman nótá tandrat- ná vocāma mā́ sunotéti sómam yó me pr̥ṇā́d yó dádad yó nibódhād yó mā sunvántam úpa góbhir ā́yat
stanzas.translation: Let it not vex me, tire me, make me slothful, and never let us say, Press not the Soma; For him who cares for me, gives gifts, supports me, who comes with kine to me who pour libations.

translations.griffith: Let it not vex me, tire me, make me slothful, and never let us say, Press not the Soma; For him who cares for me, gives gifts, supports me, who comes with kine to me who pour libations.

stanzas.sanskrit: सर॑स्वति॒ त्वम॒स्माँ अ॑विड्ढि म॒रुत्व॑ती धृष॒ती जे॑षि॒ शत्रू॑न् त्यं चि॒च्छर्ध॑न्तं तविषी॒यमा॑ण॒मिन्द्रो॑ हन्ति वृष॒भं शण्डि॑कानाम्
stanzas.transliteration: sárasvati tvám asmā́m̐ aviḍḍhi marútvatī dhr̥ṣatī́ jeṣi śátrūn tyáṃ cic chárdhantaṃ taviṣīyámāṇam índro hanti vr̥ṣabháṃ śáṇḍikānām
stanzas.translation: Sarasvatî, protect us: with the Maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen, While Indra does to death the daring chieftain of Ṣaṇḍikas exulting in his prowess.
