translations.griffith: Sarasvatî, protect us: with the Maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen, While Indra does to death the daring chieftain of Ṣaṇḍikas exulting in his prowess.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो नः॒ सनु॑त्य उ॒त वा॑ जिघ॒त्नुर॑भि॒ख्याय॒ तं ति॑गि॒तेन॑ विध्य बृह॑स्पत॒ आयु॑धैर्जेषि॒ शत्रू॑न्द्रु॒हे रीष॑न्तं॒ परि॑ धेहि राजन्
stanzas.transliteration: yó naḥ sánutya utá vā jighatnúr abhikhyā́ya táṃ tigiténa vidhya bŕ̥haspata ā́yudhair jeṣi śátrūn druhé rī́ṣantam pári dhehi rājan
stanzas.translation: Him who waylays, yea, him who would destroy us,– aim at him, pierce him with thy sharpened weapon. Br̥ihaspati, with arms thou slayest foemen O King, give up the spoiler to destruction.

translations.griffith: Him who waylays, yea, him who would destroy us,– aim at him, pierce him with thy sharpened weapon. Br̥ihaspati, with arms thou slayest foemen O King, give up the spoiler to destruction.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माके॑भिः॒ सत्व॑भिः शूर॒ शूरै॑र्वी॒र्या॑ कृधि॒ यानि॑ ते॒ कर्त्वा॑नि ज्योग॑भूव॒न्ननु॑धूपितासो ह॒त्वी तेषा॒मा भ॑रा नो॒ वसू॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kebhiḥ sátvabhiḥ śūra śū́rair vīryā̀ kr̥dhi yā́ni te kártvāni jyóg abhūvann ánudhūpitāso hatvī́ téṣām ā́ bharā no vásūni
stanzas.translation: Perform, O Hero, with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish. Long have they been inflated with presumption: slay them, and bring us hither their possessions.

translations.griffith: Perform, O Hero, with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish. Long have they been inflated with presumption: slay them, and bring us hither their possessions.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वः॒ शर्धं॒ मारु॑तं सुम्न॒युर्गि॒रोप॑ ब्रुवे॒ नम॑सा॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॑म् यथा॑ र॒यिं सर्व॑वीरं॒ नशा॑महा अपत्य॒साचं॒ श्रुत्यं॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ śárdham mā́rutaṃ sumnayúr girā́- -úpa bruve námasā daívyaṃ jánam yáthā rayíṃ sárvavīraṃ náśāmahai- apatyasā́caṃ śrútyaṃ divé-dive
stanzas.translation: I craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host, the company of Maruts, That we may gain wealth with full store of heroes, each day more famous, and with troops of children.

translations.griffith: I craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host, the company of Maruts, That we may gain wealth with full store of heroes, each day more famous, and with troops of children.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माकं॑ मित्रावरुणावतं॒ रथ॑मादि॒त्यै रु॒द्रैर्वसु॑भिः सचा॒भुवा॑ प्र यद्वयो॒ न पप्त॒न्वस्म॑न॒स्परि॑ श्रव॒स्यवो॒ हृषी॑वन्तो वन॒र्षदः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam mitrāvaruṇāvataṃ rátham ādityaí rudraír vásubhiḥ sacābhúvā prá yád váyo ná páptan vásmanas pári śravasyávo hŕ̥ṣīvanto vanarṣádaḥ
stanzas.translation: HELP, Varuṇa and Mitra, O ye Twain allied with Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas, help our car, That, as the wild birds of the forest from their home, our horses may fly forth, glad, eager for renown.

translations.griffith: HELP, Varuṇa and Mitra, O ye Twain allied with Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas, help our car, That, as the wild birds of the forest from their home, our horses may fly forth, glad, eager for renown.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ स्मा न॒ उद॑वता सजोषसो॒ रथं॑ देवासो अ॒भि वि॒क्षु वा॑ज॒युम् यदा॒शवः॒ पद्या॑भि॒स्तित्र॑तो॒ रजः॑ पृथि॒व्याः सानौ॒ जङ्घ॑नन्त पा॒णिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádha smā na úd avatā sajoṣaso ráthaṃ devāso abhí vikṣú vājayúm yád āśávaḥ pádyābhis títrato rájaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ sā́nau jáṅghananta pāṇíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Yea, now ye Gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might; When, hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs, our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.

translations.griffith: Yea, now ye Gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might; When, hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs, our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्य न॒ इन्द्रो॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिर्दि॒वः शर्धे॑न॒ मारु॑तेन सु॒क्रतुः॑ अनु॒ नु स्था॑त्यवृ॒काभि॑रू॒तिभी॒ रथं॑ म॒हे स॒नये॒ वाज॑सातये
stanzas.transliteration: utá syá na índro viśvácarṣaṇir diváḥ śárdhena mā́rutena sukrátuḥ ánu nú sthāty avr̥kā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ- rátham mahé sanáye vā́jasātaye
stanzas.translation: Or may our Indra here, the Friend of all mankind, coming from heaven, most.wise, girt by the Marut host, Accompany, with aid untroubled by a foe, our car to mighty gain, to win the meed of strength.

translations.griffith: Or may our Indra here, the Friend of all mankind, coming from heaven, most.wise, girt by the Marut host, Accompany, with aid untroubled by a foe, our car to mighty gain, to win the meed of strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्य दे॒वो भुव॑नस्य स॒क्षणि॒स्त्वष्टा॒ ग्नाभिः॑ स॒जोषा॑ जूजुव॒द्रथ॑म् इळा॒ भगो॑ बृहद्दि॒वोत रोद॑सी पू॒षा पुरं॑धिर॒श्विना॒वधा॒ पती॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá syá devó bhúvanasya sakṣáṇis tváṣṭā gnā́bhiḥ sajóṣā jūjuvad rátham íḷā bhágo br̥haddivótá ródasī pūṣā́ púraṃdhir aśvínāv ádhā pátī
stanzas.translation: Or may this Tvashṭar, God who rules the world with power, one-minded with the Goddesses speed forth our car; Iḷâ and Bhaga the celestial, Earth and Heaven, Pûshan, Purandhi, and the Aṣvins, ruling Lords.

translations.griffith: Or may this Tvashṭar, God who rules the world with power, one-minded with the Goddesses speed forth our car; Iḷâ and Bhaga the celestial, Earth and Heaven, Pûshan, Purandhi, and the Aṣvins, ruling Lords.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्ये दे॒वी सु॒भगे॑ मिथू॒दृशो॒षासा॒नक्ता॒ जग॑तामपी॒जुवा॑ स्तु॒षे यद्वां॑ पृथिवि॒ नव्य॑सा॒ वचः॑ स्था॒तुश्च॒ वय॒स्त्रिव॑या उप॒स्तिरे॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyé devī́ subháge mithūdŕ̥śā- -uṣā́sānáktā jágatām apījúvā stuṣé yád vām pr̥thivi návyasā vácaḥ- sthātúś ca váyas trívayā upastíre
stanzas.translation: Or, seen alternate, those two blessed Goddesses, Morning and Night who stir all living things to act: While with my newest song I praise you both, O Earth, that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.

translations.griffith: Or, seen alternate, those two blessed Goddesses, Morning and Night who stir all living things to act: While with my newest song I praise you both, O Earth, that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त वः॒ शंस॑मु॒शिजा॑मिव श्म॒स्यहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यो॒३॒॑ऽज एक॑पादु॒त त्रि॒त ऋ॑भु॒क्षाः स॑वि॒ता चनो॑ दधे॒ऽपां नपा॑दाशु॒हेमा॑ धि॒या शमि॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá vaḥ śáṃsam uśíjām iva śmasi- áhir budhnyò 'já ékapād utá tritá r̥bhukṣā́ḥ savitā́ cáno dadhe -apā́ṃ nápād āśuhémā dhiyā́ śámi
stanzas.translation: Your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire: the Dragon of the Deep, and Aja-Ekapad, Trita, R̥ibhukshan, Savitar shall joy in us, and the Floods' swift Child in our worship and our prayer.

translations.griffith: Your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire: the Dragon of the Deep, and Aja-Ekapad, Trita, R̥ibhukshan, Savitar shall joy in us, and the Floods' swift Child in our worship and our prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता वो॑ व॒श्म्युद्य॑ता यजत्रा॒ अत॑क्षन्ना॒यवो॒ नव्य॑से॒ सम् श्र॒व॒स्यवो॒ वाजं॑ चका॒नाः सप्ति॒र्न रथ्यो॒ अह॑ धी॒तिम॑श्याः
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ vo vaśmy údyatā yajatrāḥ- átakṣann āyávo návyase sám śravasyávo vā́jaṃ cakānā́ḥ sáptir ná ráthyo áha dhītím aśyāḥ
stanzas.translation: These earnest prayers I pray to you, ye Holy: to pay you honour, living men have formed them, Men fain to win the prize and glory. May they win, as a car-horse might the goal, your notice.

translations.griffith: These earnest prayers I pray to you, ye Holy: to pay you honour, living men have formed them, Men fain to win the prize and glory. May they win, as a car-horse might the goal, your notice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य मे॑ द्यावापृथिवी ऋताय॒तो भू॒तम॑वि॒त्री वच॑सः॒ सिषा॑सतः ययो॒रायुः॑ प्रत॒रं ते इ॒दं पु॒र उप॑स्तुते वसू॒युर्वां॑ म॒हो द॑धे
stanzas.transliteration: asyá me dyāvāpr̥thivī r̥tāyató bhūtám avitrī́ vácasaḥ síṣāsataḥ yáyor ā́yuḥ prataráṃ té idám puráḥ- úpastute vasūyúr vām mahó dadhe
stanzas.translation: GRACIOUSLY further, O ye Heaven and Earth, this speech striving to win reward, of me your worshipper. First rank I give to you, Immortal, high extolled! I, fain to win me wealth, to you the migbty Pair.

translations.griffith: GRACIOUSLY further, O ye Heaven and Earth, this speech striving to win reward, of me your worshipper. First rank I give to you, Immortal, high extolled! I, fain to win me wealth, to you the migbty Pair.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नो॒ गुह्या॒ रिप॑ आ॒योरह॑न्दभ॒न्मा न॑ आ॒भ्यो री॑रधो दु॒च्छुना॑भ्यः मा नो॒ वि यौः॑ स॒ख्या वि॒द्धि तस्य॑ नः सुम्नाय॒ता मन॑सा॒ तत्त्वे॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ no gúhyā rípa āyór áhan dabhan mā́ na ābhyó rīradho duchúnābhyaḥ mā́ no ví yauḥ sakhyā́ viddhí tásya naḥ sumnāyatā́ mánasā tát tvemahe
stanzas.translation: Let not man's guile annoy us, secret or by day: give not us up a prey to these calamities. Sever not thou our friendship: think thereon for us. This, with a heart that longs for bliss, we seek from thee.

translations.griffith: Let not man's guile annoy us, secret or by day: give not us up a prey to these calamities. Sever not thou our friendship: think thereon for us. This, with a heart that longs for bliss, we seek from thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: अहे॑ळता॒ मन॑सा श्रु॒ष्टिमा व॑ह॒ दुहा॑नां धे॒नुं पि॒प्युषी॑मस॒श्चत॑म् पद्या॑भिरा॒शुं वच॑सा च वा॒जिनं॒ त्वां हि॑नोमि पुरुहूत वि॒श्वहा॑
stanzas.transliteration: áheḷatā mánasā śruṣṭím ā́ vaha dúhānāṃ dhenúm pipyúṣīm asaścátam pádyābhir āśúṃ vácasā ca vājínaṃ tvā́ṃ hinomi puruhūta viśváhā
stanzas.translation: Bring hither with benignant mind the willing Cow teeming with plenteous milk, full, inexhaustible. O thou invoked by many, day by day I urge thee with my word, a charger rapid in his tread.

translations.griffith: Bring hither with benignant mind the willing Cow teeming with plenteous milk, full, inexhaustible. O thou invoked by many, day by day I urge thee with my word, a charger rapid in his tread.

stanzas.sanskrit: रा॒काम॒हं सु॒हवां॑ सुष्टु॒ती हु॑वे शृ॒णोतु॑ नः सु॒भगा॒ बोध॑तु॒ त्मना॑ सीव्य॒त्वपः॑ सू॒च्याच्छि॑द्यमानया॒ ददा॑तु वी॒रं श॒तदा॑यमु॒क्थ्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: rākā́m aháṃ suhávāṃ suṣṭutī́ huve śr̥ṇótu naḥ subhágā bódhatu tmánā sī́vyatv ápaḥ sūcyā́chidyamānayā dádātu vīráṃ śatádāyam ukthyàm
stanzas.translation: With eulogy I call on Râkâ swift to hear may she, auspicious, hear us, and herself observe. With never-breaking needle may she sew her work, and give a hero son most wealthy, meet for praise.

translations.griffith: With eulogy I call on Râkâ swift to hear may she, auspicious, hear us, and herself observe. With never-breaking needle may she sew her work, and give a hero son most wealthy, meet for praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: यास्ते॑ राके सुम॒तयः॑ सु॒पेश॑सो॒ याभि॒र्ददा॑सि दा॒शुषे॒ वसू॑नि ताभि॑र्नो अ॒द्य सु॒मना॑ उ॒पाग॑हि सहस्रपो॒षं सु॑भगे॒ ररा॑णा
stanzas.transliteration: yā́s te rāke sumatáyaḥ supéśaso yā́bhir dádāsi dāśúṣe vásūni tā́bhir no adyá sumánā upā́gahi sahasrapoṣáṃ subhage rárāṇā
stanzas.translation: All thy kind thoughts, O Râkâ, lovely in their form, wherewith thou grantest wealth to him who offers gifts- With these come thou to us this day benevolent, O Blessed One, bestowing food of thousand sorts.

translations.griffith: All thy kind thoughts, O Râkâ, lovely in their form, wherewith thou grantest wealth to him who offers gifts- With these come thou to us this day benevolent, O Blessed One, bestowing food of thousand sorts.

stanzas.sanskrit: सिनी॑वालि॒ पृथु॑ष्टुके॒ या दे॒वाना॒मसि॒ स्वसा॑ जु॒षस्व॑ ह॒व्यमाहु॑तं प्र॒जां दे॑वि दिदिड्ढि नः
stanzas.transliteration: sínīvāli pŕ̥thuṣṭuke yā́ devā́nām ási svásā juṣásva havyám ā́hutam prajā́ṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
stanzas.translation: O broad-tressed Sinîvâlî, thou who art the Sister of the Gods, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.

translations.griffith: O broad-tressed Sinîvâlî, thou who art the Sister of the Gods, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.

stanzas.sanskrit: या सु॑बा॒हुः स्व॑ङ्गु॒रिः सु॒षूमा॑ बहु॒सूव॑री तस्यै॑ वि॒श्पत्न्यै॑ ह॒विः सि॑नीवा॒ल्यै जु॑होतन
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ subāhúḥ svaṅguríḥ suṣū́mā bahusū́varī tásyai viśpátnyai havíḥ sinīvālyaí juhotana
stanzas.translation: With lovely fingers, lovely arms, prolific Mother of many sons- Present the sacred gifts to her, to Sinîvâlî Queen of men.

translations.griffith: With lovely fingers, lovely arms, prolific Mother of many sons- Present the sacred gifts to her, to Sinîvâlî Queen of men.

stanzas.sanskrit: या गु॒ङ्गूर्या सि॑नीवा॒ली या रा॒का या सर॑स्वती इ॒न्द्रा॒णीम॑ह्व ऊ॒तये॑ वरुणा॒नीं स्व॒स्तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ guṅgū́r yā́ sinīvālī́ yā́ rākā́ yā́ sárasvatī indrāṇī́m ahva ūtáye varuṇānī́ṃ svastáye
stanzas.translation: Her, Sinîvâlî, her, Gungû, her, Râkâ, her, Sarasvatî, Indrâṇî to mine aid I call, and Vartunani for my weal.

translations.griffith: Her, Sinîvâlî, her, Gungû, her, Râkâ, her, Sarasvatî, Indrâṇî to mine aid I call, and Vartunani for my weal.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ पितर्मरुतां सु॒म्नमे॑तु॒ मा नः॒ सूर्य॑स्य सं॒दृशो॑ युयोथाः अ॒भि नो॑ वी॒रो अर्व॑ति क्षमेत॒ प्र जा॑येमहि रुद्र प्र॒जाभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te pitar marutāṃ sumnám etu mā́ naḥ sū́ryasya saṃdŕ̥śo yuyothāḥ abhí no vīró árvati kṣameta prá jāyemahi rudra prajā́bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight. Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.

translations.griffith: FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight. Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.
translations.macdonell: Let thy goodwill, O father of the Maruts, Light on us: part us not from Sūrya's vision. In mercy may the hero spare our horses: May we, O Rudra, have abundant offspring.
translations.müller: O father of the Maruts, let thy favour come near, and do not deprive us of the sight of the sun; may the hero (Rudra) be gracious to our horse 1, and may we increase in offspring, O Rudra!

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाद॑त्तेभी रुद्र॒ शंत॑मेभिः श॒तं हिमा॑ अशीय भेष॒जेभिः॑ व्य१॒॑स्मद्द्वेषो॑ वित॒रं व्यंहो॒ व्यमी॑वाश्चातयस्वा॒ विषू॑चीः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́dattebhī rudra śáṃtamebhiḥ śatáṃ hímā aśīya bheṣajébhiḥ vy àsmád dvéṣo vitaráṃ vy áṃho vy ámīvāś cātayasvā víṣūcīḥ
stanzas.translation: With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters. Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.

translations.griffith: With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters. Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.
translations.macdonell: By thy most wholesome remedies, O Rudra, Thy gifts, I would attain a hundred autumns. Drive far away from us distress and hatred, Drive far away, wide-scattered, all diseases.
translations.müller: May I attain to a hundred winters through the most blissful medicines which thou hast given! Put away far 1 from us all hatred, put away anguish, put away sicknesses in all directions!

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रेष्ठो॑ जा॒तस्य॑ रुद्र श्रि॒यासि॑ त॒वस्त॑मस्त॒वसां॑ वज्रबाहो पर्षि॑ णः पा॒रमंह॑सः स्व॒स्ति विश्वा॑ अ॒भी॑ती॒ रप॑सो युयोधि
stanzas.transliteration: śréṣṭho jātásya rudra śriyā́si tavástamas tavásāṃ vajrabāho párṣi ṇaḥ pārám áṃhasaḥ svastí víśvā abhī̀tī rápaso yuyodhi
stanzas.translation: Chief of all born art thou in glory, Rudra, armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty. Transport us over trouble to well-being repel thou from us all assaults of mis. chief.

translations.griffith: Chief of all born art thou in glory, Rudra, armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty. Transport us over trouble to well-being repel thou from us all assaults of mis. chief.
translations.macdonell: Of what is born thou art the chief in glory, Armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty. Transport us to the farther shore of trouble In safety; frustrate all attacks of mischief.
translations.müller: In beauty thou art the most beautiful of all that exists, O Rudra, the strongest of the strong, thou wielder of the thunderbolt! Carry us happily to the other shore of our anguish, and ward off all assaults of mischief 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा त्वा॑ रुद्र चुक्रुधामा॒ नमो॑भि॒र्मा दुष्टु॑ती वृषभ॒ मा सहू॑ती उन्नो॑ वी॒राँ अ॑र्पय भेष॒जेभि॑र्भि॒षक्त॑मं त्वा भि॒षजां॑ शृणोमि
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ tvā rudra cukrudhāmā námobhir mā́ dúṣṭutī vr̥ṣabha mā́ sáhūtī ún no vīrā́m̐ arpaya bheṣajébhir bhiṣáktamaṃ tvā bhiṣájāṃ śr̥ṇomi
stanzas.translation: Let us not anger thee with worship, Rudra, ill praise, Strong God! or mingled invocation. Do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes: I hear thee famed as best of all physicians.

translations.griffith: Let us not anger thee with worship, Rudra, ill praise, Strong God! or mingled invocation. Do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes: I hear thee famed as best of all physicians.
translations.macdonell: May we not anger thee with homage, Rudra, Nor with ill-praises, nor joint invocation. Raise up, O Bull, with remedies our heroes: I hear of thee as best of all physicians.
translations.müller: Let us not incense thee, O Rudra, by our worship, not by bad praise, O hero, and not by divided praise! Raise up our men by thy medicines, for I hear thou art the best of all physicians.

stanzas.sanskrit: हवी॑मभि॒र्हव॑ते॒ यो ह॒विर्भि॒रव॒ स्तोमे॑भी रु॒द्रं दि॑षीय ऋ॒दू॒दरः॑ सु॒हवो॒ मा नो॑ अ॒स्यै ब॒भ्रुः सु॒शिप्रो॑ रीरधन्म॒नायै॑
stanzas.transliteration: hávīmabhir hávate yó havírbhir áva stómebhī rudráṃ diṣīya r̥dūdáraḥ suhávo mā́ no asyaí babhrúḥ suśípro rīradhan manā́yai
stanzas.translation: May I with praise-songs win that Rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations. Ne'er may the tawny God, fair-checked, and gracious, swifthearing, yield us to this evil purpose.

translations.griffith: May I with praise-songs win that Rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations. Ne'er may the tawny God, fair-checked, and gracious, swifthearing, yield us to this evil purpose.
translations.macdonell: With invocations and oblations summoned Rudra I would appease with my laudations: May he, soft-hearted, easily appealed to, Brown-hued, fair-lipped, not to his wrath subject us.
translations.müller: He who is invoked 1 by invocations and libations, may I pay off 2 that Rudra with my hymns of praise. Let not him who is kind-hearted 3, who readily hears our call, the tawny, with beautiful cheeks, deliver us to this wrath!

stanzas.sanskrit: उन्मा॑ ममन्द वृष॒भो म॒रुत्वा॒न्त्वक्षी॑यसा॒ वय॑सा॒ नाध॑मानम् घृणी॑व च्छा॒याम॑र॒पा अ॑शी॒या वि॑वासेयं रु॒द्रस्य॑ सु॒म्नम्
stanzas.transliteration: ún mā mamanda vr̥ṣabhó marútvān tvákṣīyasā váyasā nā́dhamānam ghŕ̥ṇīva chāyā́m arapā́ aśīya- -ā́ vivāseyaṃ rudrásya sumnám
stanzas.translation: The Strong, begirt by Maruts, hath refreshed me, with most invigorating food, imploring. As he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may I, uninjured, win the bliss of Rudra.

translations.griffith: The Strong, begirt by Maruts, hath refreshed me, with most invigorating food, imploring. As he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may I, uninjured, win the bliss of Rudra.
translations.macdonell: The bull, escorted by the Maruts, gladdens Me who invokes, with his most forceful vigour. I, sound, would reach, as in the heat, a shelter: Rudra's good will I would desire to capture.
translations.müller: The manly hero with the Maruts has gladdened me, the suppliant, with more vigorous health. May I without mischief find shade, as if from sunshine 1, may I gain the favour of Rudra!

stanzas.sanskrit: क्व१॒॑ स्य ते॑ रुद्र मृळ॒याकु॒र्हस्तो॒ यो अस्ति॑ भेष॒जो जला॑षः अ॒प॒भ॒र्ता रप॑सो॒ दैव्य॑स्या॒भी नु मा॑ वृषभ चक्षमीथाः
stanzas.transliteration: kvà syá te rudra mr̥ḷayā́kur hásto yó ásti bheṣajó jálāṣaḥ apabhartā́ rápaso daívyasya- -abhī́ nú mā vr̥ṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ
stanzas.translation: Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort, Remover of the woe that Gods have sent us? O Strong One, look thou on me with compassion.

translations.griffith: Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort, Remover of the woe that Gods have sent us? O Strong One, look thou on me with compassion.
translations.macdonell: Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, That is so full of remedies and coolness? As the remover of all god-sent damage, Do thou, O Bull, now show compassion towards me.
translations.müller: O Rudra, where is thy softly stroking hand which cures and relieves 1? Thou, the remover of all heaven-sent mischief, wilt thou, O strong hero, bear with me?

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ब॒भ्रवे॑ वृष॒भाय॑ श्विती॒चे म॒हो म॒हीं सु॑ष्टु॒तिमी॑रयामि न॒म॒स्या क॑ल्मली॒किनं॒ नमो॑भिर्गृणी॒मसि॑ त्वे॒षं रु॒द्रस्य॒ नाम॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá babhráve vr̥ṣabhā́ya śvitīcé mahó mahī́ṃ suṣṭutím īrayāmi namasyā́ kalmalīkínaṃ námobhir gr̥ṇīmási tveṣáṃ rudrásya nā́ma
stanzas.translation: To him the strong, great, tawny, fair-complexioned, I utter forth a mighty hymn of praises. We serve the brilliant God with adorations, we glorify, the splendid name of Rudra.

translations.griffith: To him the strong, great, tawny, fair-complexioned, I utter forth a mighty hymn of praises. We serve the brilliant God with adorations, we glorify, the splendid name of Rudra.
translations.macdonell: Forth for the brown and whitish bull I utter A mighty panegyric of the mighty. I will adore the radiant god with homage. We praise the terrifying name of Rudra.
translations.müller: I send forth a great, great hymn of praise to the bright tawny bull. Let me reverence 1 the fiery god 2 with prostrations; we celebrate the flaring name 3 of Rudra.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्थि॒रेभि॒रङ्गैः॑ पुरु॒रूप॑ उ॒ग्रो ब॒भ्रुः शु॒क्रेभिः॑ पिपिशे॒ हिर॑ण्यैः ईशा॑नाद॒स्य भुव॑नस्य॒ भूरे॒र्न वा उ॑ योषद्रु॒द्राद॑सु॒र्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sthirébhir áṅgaiḥ pururū́pa ugró babhrúḥ śukrébhiḥ pipiśe híraṇyaiḥ ī́śānād asyá bhúvanasya bhū́rer ná vā́ u yoṣad rudrā́d asuryàm
stanzas.translation: With firm limbs, multiform, the strong, the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations: The strength of Godhead ne'er departs from Rudra, him who is Sovran of this world, the mighty.

translations.griffith: With firm limbs, multiform, the strong, the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations: The strength of Godhead ne'er departs from Rudra, him who is Sovran of this world, the mighty.
translations.macdonell: He, mighty, brown-hued, multiform, has decked out His stalwart limbs with jewels bright and golden, From Rudra, this great universe's ruler, Let not be severed his divine dominion.
translations.müller: He, the fierce god, with strong limbs, assuming many forms, the tawny Rudra, decked himself with brilliant golden ornaments. From Rudra, who is lord of this wide world, divine power 1 will never depart.

stanzas.sanskrit: अर्ह॑न्बिभर्षि॒ साय॑कानि॒ धन्वार्ह॑न्नि॒ष्कं य॑ज॒तं वि॒श्वरू॑पम् अर्ह॑न्नि॒दं द॑यसे॒ विश्व॒मभ्वं॒ न वा ओजी॑यो रुद्र॒ त्वद॑स्ति
stanzas.transliteration: árhan bibharṣi sā́yakāni dhánva- -árhan niṣkáṃ yajatáṃ viśvárūpam árhann idáṃ dayase víśvam ábhvaṃ ná vā́ ójīyo rudra tvád asti
stanzas.translation: Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, worthy, thy manyhued and honoured necklace. Worthy, thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces: a mightier than thou there is not, Rudra.

translations.griffith: Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, worthy, thy manyhued and honoured necklace. Worthy, thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces: a mightier than thou there is not, Rudra.
translations.macdonell: Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, Worthy, thine honourèd and all-hued necklace Worthy, thou wieldest all this mighty power. Naught that exists is mightier than thou art.
translations.müller: Worthily thou bearest arrows and bow, worthily, O worshipful 1, the golden, variegated chain; worthily thou cuttest every fiend 2 here to pieces, for there is nothing indeed stronger than thou, O Rudra.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तु॒हि श्रु॒तं ग॑र्त॒सदं॒ युवा॑नं मृ॒गं न भी॒ममु॑पह॒त्नुमु॒ग्रम् मृ॒ळा ज॑रि॒त्रे रु॑द्र॒ स्तवा॑नो॒ऽन्यं ते॑ अ॒स्मन्नि व॑पन्तु॒ सेनाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: stuhí śrutáṃ gartasádaṃ yúvānam mr̥gáṃ ná bhīmám upahatnúm ugrám mr̥ḷā́ jaritré rudra stávāno -anyáṃ te asmán ní vapantu sénāḥ
stanzas.translation: Praise him the chariot-borne, the young, the famous, fierce, slaying like a dread beast of the forest. O Rudra, praised, be gracious to the singer. let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.

translations.griffith: Praise him the chariot-borne, the young, the famous, fierce, slaying like a dread beast of the forest. O Rudra, praised, be gracious to the singer. let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.
translations.macdonell: Praise him the famed, who sits upon the car-seat The young, the fierce, like a dread beast, a slayer. When praised, be gracious, Rudra, to the singer Let thy darts pass us and lay low another.
translations.müller: Praise him, the famous, sitting in his chariot 1, the youthful, who is fierce and attacks like a terrible wild beast 2 (the lion). And when thou hast been praised, O Rudra, be gracious to him who magnifies thee, and let thy armies 3 mow down others than us!

stanzas.sanskrit: कु॒मा॒रश्चि॑त्पि॒तरं॒ वन्द॑मानं॒ प्रति॑ नानाम रुद्रोप॒यन्त॑म् भूरे॑र्दा॒तारं॒ सत्प॑तिं गृणीषे स्तु॒तस्त्वं भे॑ष॒जा रा॑स्य॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: kumāráś cit pitáraṃ vándamānam práti nānāma rudropayántam bhū́rer dātā́raṃ sátpatiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe stutás tvám bheṣajā́ rāsy asmé
stanzas.translation: I bend to thee as thou approachest, Rudra, even as a boy before the sire who greets him. I praise thee Bounteous Giver, Lord of heroes: give medicines to us as thou art lauded.

translations.griffith: I bend to thee as thou approachest, Rudra, even as a boy before the sire who greets him. I praise thee Bounteous Giver, Lord of heroes: give medicines to us as thou art lauded.
translations.macdonell: I bow down like a son before his father, Who with good will comes nigh to him, O Rudra. I praise the true lord, of much wealth the giver: To us thou grantest remedies when lauded.
translations.müller: O Rudra, a boy indeed makes obeisance to his father who comes to greet him 1: I praise the lord of brave men, the giver of many gifts, and thou, when thou hast been praised, wilt give us thy medicines.

stanzas.sanskrit: या वो॑ भेष॒जा म॑रुतः॒ शुची॑नि॒ या शंत॑मा वृषणो॒ या म॑यो॒भु यानि॒ मनु॒रवृ॑णीता पि॒ता न॒स्ता शं च॒ योश्च॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ वश्मि
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ vo bheṣajā́ marutaḥ śúcīni yā́ śáṃtamā vr̥ṣaṇo yā́ mayobhú yā́ni mánur ávr̥ṇītā pitā́ nas tā́ śáṃ ca yóś ca rudrásya vaśmi
stanzas.translation: Of your pure medicines, O potent Martits, those that are wholesomest and healthbestowing, Those which our father Manu hath selected, I crave from. Rudra for our gain and welfare.

translations.griffith: Of your pure medicines, O potent Martits, those that are wholesomest and healthbestowing, Those which our father Manu hath selected, I crave from. Rudra for our gain and welfare.
translations.macdonell: Those remedies of yours, the pure, O Maruts, That are most wholesome, mighty ones, and potent, That Manu chose in ancient days, our Father: Those I desire, and Rudra's balm and blessing.
translations.müller: O Maruts, those pure medicines of yours, the most beneficent and delightful, O heroes, those which Manu 1, our father, chose, those I crave from Rudra, as health and wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॑ णो हे॒ती रु॒द्रस्य॑ वृज्याः॒ परि॑ त्वे॒षस्य॑ दुर्म॒तिर्म॒ही गा॑त् अव॑ स्थि॒रा म॒घव॑द्भ्यस्तनुष्व॒ मीढ्व॑स्तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय मृळ
stanzas.transliteration: pári ṇo hetī́ rudrásya vr̥jyāḥ pári tveṣásya durmatír mahī́ gāt áva sthirā́ maghávadbhyas tanuṣva mī́ḍhvas tokā́ya tánayāya mr̥ḷa
stanzas.translation: May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great wrath of the impetuous One avoid us. Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.

translations.griffith: May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great wrath of the impetuous One avoid us. Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.
translations.macdonell: May Rudra's missile turn aside and pass us, May the fierce Rudra's great ill-will go by us. Relax thy rigid bow to save our patrons; Spare, O thou god of bounty, child and grandchild.
translations.müller: May the weapon of Rudra avoid us 1, may the great anger of the flaring one pass us by. Unstring thy strong bows 2 for the sake of our liberal lords, O bounteous Rudra, be gracious to our kith and kin.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा ब॑भ्रो वृषभ चेकितान॒ यथा॑ देव॒ न हृ॑णी॒षे न हंसि॑ ह॒व॒न॒श्रुन्नो॑ रुद्रे॒ह बो॑धि बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ babhro vr̥ṣabha cekitāna yáthā deva ná hr̥ṇīṣé ná háṃsi havanaśrún no rudrehá bodhi br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: O tawny Bull, thus showing forth thy nature, as neither to be wroth, O God, nor slay us. Here, Rudra, listen to our invocation. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: O tawny Bull, thus showing forth thy nature, as neither to be wroth, O God, nor slay us. Here, Rudra, listen to our invocation. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
translations.macdonell: So brown-hued, mighty Rudra, widely famous, Here to our invocations be attentive, As not, O god, to rise in wrath and slay us. May we speak loud with heroes in the synod.
translations.müller: Thus, O tawny and manly god, showing thyself 1, so as neither to be angry nor to kill, be mindful of our invocations 2, and, rich in brave sons, we shall magnify thee in the congregation.

stanzas.sanskrit: धा॒रा॒व॒रा म॒रुतो॑ धृ॒ष्ण्वो॑जसो मृ॒गा न भी॒मास्तवि॑षीभिर॒र्चिनः॑ अ॒ग्नयो॒ न शु॑शुचा॒ना ऋ॑जी॒षिणो॒ भृमिं॒ धम॑न्तो॒ अप॒ गा अ॑वृण्वत
stanzas.transliteration: dhārāvarā́ marúto dhr̥ṣṇvòjaso mr̥gā́ ná bhīmā́s táviṣībhir arcínaḥ agnáyo ná śuśucānā́ r̥jīṣíṇo bhŕ̥miṃ dhámanto ápa gā́ avr̥ṇvata
stanzas.translation: THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength, Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering raincloud, have disclosed the kine.

translations.griffith: THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength, Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering raincloud, have disclosed the kine.
translations.müller: The Maruts charged with rain 1, endowed with fierce force, terrible like wild beasts 2, blazing 3 in their strength 4, brilliant like fires, and impetuous 5, have uncovered the (rain-giving) cows by blowing away the cloud 6.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यावो॒ न स्तृभि॑श्चितयन्त खा॒दिनो॒ व्य१॒॑भ्रिया॒ न द्यु॑तयन्त वृ॒ष्टयः॑ रु॒द्रो यद्वो॑ मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो॒ वृषाज॑नि॒ पृश्न्याः॑ शु॒क्र ऊध॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: dyā́vo ná stŕ̥bhiś citayanta khādíno vy àbhríyā ná dyutayanta vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ rudró yád vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vŕ̥ṣā́jani pŕ̥śnyāḥ śukrá ū́dhani
stanzas.translation: They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain. Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Pr̥iṣni's radiant lap.

translations.griffith: They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain. Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Pr̥iṣni's radiant lap.
translations.müller: The (Maruts) with their rings 1 appeared like the heavens with their stars 2, they shone wide like streams from clouds as soon as Rudra, the strong man, was born for you, O golden-breasted Maruts, in the bright lap of Prisni 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒क्षन्ते॒ अश्वाँ॒ अत्याँ॑ इवा॒जिषु॑ न॒दस्य॒ कर्णै॑स्तुरयन्त आ॒शुभिः॑ हिर॑ण्यशिप्रा मरुतो॒ दवि॑ध्वतः पृ॒क्षं या॑थ॒ पृष॑तीभिः समन्यवः
stanzas.transliteration: ukṣánte áśvām̐ átyām̐ ivājíṣu nadásya kárṇais turayanta āśúbhiḥ híraṇyaśiprā maruto dávidhvataḥ pr̥kṣáṃ yātha pŕ̥ṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
stanzas.translation: They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way. Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake, con e with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.

translations.griffith: They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way. Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake, con e with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.
translations.müller: They wash 1 their horses like racers in the courses, they hasten with the points of the reed 2 on their quick steeds. O golden jawed 3 Maruts, violently shaking (your jaws), you go quick 4 with your spotted deer 5, being friends of one mind.

stanzas.sanskrit: पृ॒क्षे ता विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना ववक्षिरे मि॒त्राय॑ वा॒ सद॒मा जी॒रदा॑नवः पृष॑दश्वासो अनव॒भ्ररा॑धस ऋजि॒प्यासो॒ न व॒युने॑षु धू॒र्षदः॑
stanzas.transliteration: pr̥kṣé tā́ víśvā bhúvanā vavakṣire mitrā́ya vā sádam ā́ jīrádānavaḥ pŕ̥ṣadaśvāso anavabhrárādhasaḥ- r̥jipyā́so ná vayúneṣu dhūrṣádaḥ
stanzas.translation: They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow; Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.

translations.griffith: They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow; Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.
translations.müller: Those Maruts have grown to feed 1 all these beings, or, it may be, (they have come) hither for the sake of a friend, they who always bring quickening rain. They have spotted horses, their bounties cannot be taken away, they are like headlong charioteers on their ways 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्ध॑न्वभिर्धे॒नुभी॑ र॒प्शदू॑धभिरध्व॒स्मभिः॑ प॒थिभि॑र्भ्राजदृष्टयः आ हं॒सासो॒ न स्वस॑राणि गन्तन॒ मधो॒र्मदा॑य मरुतः समन्यवः
stanzas.transliteration: índhanvabhir dhenúbhī rapśádūdhabhir adhvasmábhiḥ pathíbhir bhrājadr̥ṣṭayaḥ ā́ haṃsā́so ná svásarāṇi gantana mádhor mádāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ
stanzas.translation: With brightly-flarning kine whose udders swell with milk, idth glittering lances on your unobstructed paths, O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.

translations.griffith: With brightly-flarning kine whose udders swell with milk, idth glittering lances on your unobstructed paths, O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.
translations.müller: O Maruts, wielding your brilliant spears, come hither on smooth 1 roads with your fiery 2 cows (clouds) whose udders are swelling; (come hither), being of one mind, like swans toward their nests, to enjoy the sweet offering.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि मरुतः समन्यवो न॒रां न शंसः॒ सव॑नानि गन्तन अश्वा॑मिव पिप्यत धे॒नुमूध॑नि॒ कर्ता॒ धियं॑ जरि॒त्रे वाज॑पेशसम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no bráhmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo narā́ṃ ná śáṃsaḥ sávanāni gantana áśvām iva pipyata dhenúm ū́dhani kártā dhíyaṃ jaritré vā́japeśasam
stanzas.translation: To these our prayers, O Maruts, come unanimous, come ye to our libations like the praise of men. Make it swell like a mare, in udder like a cow, and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.

translations.griffith: To these our prayers, O Maruts, come unanimous, come ye to our libations like the praise of men. Make it swell like a mare, in udder like a cow, and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.
translations.müller: O one-minded Maruts, come to our prayers, come to our libations like (Indra) praised by men 1![paragraph continues] Fulfil (our prayer) like the udder of a barren cow 2, and make the prayer glorious by booty to the singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं नो॑ दात मरुतो वा॒जिनं॒ रथ॑ आपा॒नं ब्रह्म॑ चि॒तय॑द्दि॒वेदि॑वे इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ वृ॒जने॑षु का॒रवे॑ स॒निं मे॒धामरि॑ष्टं दु॒ष्टरं॒ सहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ no dāta maruto vājínaṃ ráthe- āpānám bráhma citáyad divé-dive íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhyo vr̥jáneṣu kāráve saním medhā́m áriṣṭaṃ duṣṭáraṃ sáhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Give us a steed, O Maruts migbty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day; Food to your praisers, to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom, power uninjured, unsurpassed.

translations.griffith: Give us a steed, O Maruts migbty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day; Food to your praisers, to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom, power uninjured, unsurpassed.
translations.müller: Grant us this strong horse for our chariot, a draught 1 that rouses our prayers, from day to day, food to the singers, and to the poet in our homesteads 2 luck 3, wisdom, inviolable and invincible strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद्यु॒ञ्जते॑ म॒रुतो॑ रु॒क्मव॑क्ष॒सोऽश्वा॒न्रथे॑षु॒ भग॒ आ सु॒दान॑वः धे॒नुर्न शिश्वे॒ स्वस॑रेषु पिन्वते॒ जना॑य रा॒तह॑विषे म॒हीमिष॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yád yuñjáte marúto rukmávakṣasaḥ- -áśvān rátheṣu bhága ā́ sudā́navaḥ dhenúr ná śíśve svásareṣu pinvate jánāya rātáhaviṣe mahī́m íṣam
stanzas.translation: When the bright-chested Maruts, lavish of their gifts, bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars, Then, as the milch-cow feeds her calf within the stalls, they pour forth food for all oblation-bringing men.

translations.griffith: When the bright-chested Maruts, lavish of their gifts, bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars, Then, as the milch-cow feeds her calf within the stalls, they pour forth food for all oblation-bringing men.
translations.müller: When the gold-breasted Maruts harness the horses to their chariots, bounteous 1 in wealth, then it is as if a cow in the folds poured out 2 to her calf copious food, to every man who has offered libations.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो नो॑ मरुतो वृ॒कता॑ति॒ मर्त्यो॑ रि॒पुर्द॒धे व॑सवो॒ रक्ष॑ता रि॒षः व॒र्तय॑त॒ तपु॑षा च॒क्रिया॒भि तमव॑ रुद्रा अ॒शसो॑ हन्तना॒ वधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó no maruto vr̥kátāti mártyo ripúr dadhé vasavo rákṣatā riṣáḥ vartáyata tápuṣā cakríyābhí tám áva rudrā aśáso hantanā vádhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Save us, O Maruts, Vasus, from the injurer, the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves. With chariot all aflame compass him round about: O Rudras, cast away the foeman's deadly bolt.

translations.griffith: Save us, O Maruts, Vasus, from the injurer, the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves. With chariot all aflame compass him round about: O Rudras, cast away the foeman's deadly bolt.
translations.müller: Whatever mortal enemy may have placed us among wolves 1, shield us from hurt, ye Vasus! Turn the wheels with burning heat2 against him, and strike down the weapon of the impious fiend, O Rudras!

stanzas.sanskrit: चि॒त्रं तद्वो॑ मरुतो॒ याम॑ चेकिते॒ पृश्न्या॒ यदूध॒रप्या॒पयो॑ दु॒हुः यद्वा॑ नि॒दे नव॑मानस्य रुद्रियास्त्रि॒तं जरा॑य जुर॒ताम॑दाभ्याः
stanzas.transliteration: citráṃ tád vo maruto yā́ma cekite pŕ̥śnyā yád ū́dhar ápy āpáyo duhúḥ yád vā nidé návamānasya rudriyās tritáṃ járāya juratā́m adābhyāḥ
stanzas.translation: Well-known, ye Maruts, is that wondrous course of yours, when they milked Pr̥iṣni's udder, close akin to her. Or when to shame the bard who lauded, Rudra's Sons, ye O infallible brought Trita to decay.

translations.griffith: Well-known, ye Maruts, is that wondrous course of yours, when they milked Pr̥iṣni's udder, close akin to her. Or when to shame the bard who lauded, Rudra's Sons, ye O infallible brought Trita to decay.
translations.müller: Your march, O Maruts, appears brilliant, whether even friends have milked the udder of Prisni, or whether, O sons of Rudra, you mean to blame him who praises you, and to weaken those who are weakening Trita, O unbeguiled heroes 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: तान्वो॑ म॒हो म॒रुत॑ एव॒याव्नो॒ विष्णो॑रे॒षस्य॑ प्रभृ॒थे ह॑वामहे हिर॑ण्यवर्णान्ककु॒हान्य॒तस्रु॑चो ब्रह्म॒ण्यन्तः॒ शंस्यं॒ राध॑ ईमहे
stanzas.transliteration: tā́n vo mahó marúta evayā́vno víṣṇor eṣásya prabhr̥thé havāmahe híraṇyavarṇān kakuhā́n yatásruco brahmaṇyántaḥ śáṃsyaṃ rā́dha īmahe
stanzas.translation: We call youi such, great Maruts, following wonted ways, to the oblation paid to Vishṇu Speeder-on. With ladles lifted up, with prayer, we seek of them preeminent, golden-hued, the wealth which all extol.

translations.griffith: We call youi such, great Maruts, following wonted ways, to the oblation paid to Vishṇu Speeder-on. With ladles lifted up, with prayer, we seek of them preeminent, golden-hued, the wealth which all extol.
translations.müller: We invoke you, the great Maruts, the constant wanderers, at the offering of the rapid Vishnu 1; holding ladles (full of libations) and prayerful we ask the golden-coloured and exalted Maruts for glorious wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते दश॑ग्वाः प्रथ॒मा य॒ज्ञमू॑हिरे॒ ते नो॑ हिन्वन्तू॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु उ॒षा न रा॒मीर॑रु॒णैरपो॑र्णुते म॒हो ज्योति॑षा शुच॒ता गोअ॑र्णसा
stanzas.transliteration: té dáśagvāḥ prathamā́ yajñám ūhire té no hinvantūṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu uṣā́ ná rāmī́r aruṇaír áporṇute mahó jyótiṣā śucatā́ góarṇasā
stanzas.translation: They, the Daṣagvas, first of all brought sacrifice: they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us. Dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights, with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.

translations.griffith: They, the Daṣagvas, first of all brought sacrifice: they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us. Dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights, with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.
translations.müller: The Dasagvas (Maruts?) 1 carried on 2 the sacrifice first; may they rouse us at the break of dawn. Like the dawn, they uncover the dark nights with the red (rays), the strong ones, with their brilliant light, as with a sea of milk.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते क्षो॒णीभि॑ररु॒णेभि॒र्नाञ्जिभी॑ रु॒द्रा ऋ॒तस्य॒ सद॑नेषु वावृधुः नि॒मेघ॑माना॒ अत्ये॑न॒ पाज॑सा सुश्च॒न्द्रं वर्णं॑ दधिरे सु॒पेश॑सम्
stanzas.transliteration: té kṣoṇī́bhir aruṇébhir nā́ñjíbhiḥ- rudrā́ r̥tásya sádaneṣu vāvr̥dhuḥ niméghamānā átyena pā́jasā suścandráṃ várṇaṃ dadhire supéśasam
stanzas.translation: The Rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments. They with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.

translations.griffith: The Rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments. They with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.
translations.müller: With the (morning) clouds, as if with glittering red ornaments 1, these Maruts have grown great in the sacred places 2. Streaming down with rushing splendour 3, they have assumed their bright and brilliant colour.

stanzas.sanskrit: ताँ इ॑या॒नो महि॒ वरू॑थमू॒तय॒ उप॒ घेदे॒ना नम॑सा गृणीमसि त्रि॒तो न यान्पञ्च॒ होतॄ॑न॒भिष्ट॑य आव॒वर्त॒दव॑राञ्च॒क्रियाव॑से
stanzas.transliteration: tā́m̐ iyānó máhi várūtham ūtáye- úpa ghéd enā́ námasā gr̥ṇīmasi tritó ná yā́n páñca hótr̥̄n abhíṣṭaye- āvavártad ávarāñ cakríyā́vase
stanzas.translation: Soliciting their high protection for our help, with this our adoration we sing praise to them, Whom, for assistance, like the five terrestrial priests. Trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.

translations.griffith: Soliciting their high protection for our help, with this our adoration we sing praise to them, Whom, for assistance, like the five terrestrial priests. Trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.
translations.müller: Approaching 1 them for their great protection to help us, we invoke them with this worship, they whom Trita may bring near, like the five Hotri priests for victory 2, descending on their chariot to help.

stanzas.sanskrit: यया॑ र॒ध्रं पा॒रय॒थात्यंहो॒ यया॑ नि॒दो मु॒ञ्चथ॑ वन्दि॒तार॑म् अ॒र्वाची॒ सा म॑रुतो॒ या व॑ ऊ॒तिरो षु वा॒श्रेव॑ सुम॒तिर्जि॑गातु
stanzas.transliteration: yáyā radhrám pāráyathā́ty áṃho yáyā nidó muñcátha vanditā́ram arvā́cī sā́ maruto yā́ va ūtír ó ṣú vāśréva sumatír jigātu
stanzas.translation: So may your favouring help be turned to us-ward, your kindness like a Iowing cow approach us, Wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble, and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.

translations.griffith: So may your favouring help be turned to us-ward, your kindness like a Iowing cow approach us, Wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble, and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.
translations.müller: May that grace of yours by which you help the wretched 1 across all anguish, and by which you deliver the worshipper from the reviler, come hither, O Maruts; may your favour approach us like a cow (going to her calf)!

stanzas.sanskrit: उपे॑मसृक्षि वाज॒युर्व॑च॒स्यां चनो॑ दधीत ना॒द्यो गिरो॑ मे अ॒पां नपा॑दाशु॒हेमा॑ कु॒वित्स सु॒पेश॑सस्करति॒ जोषि॑ष॒द्धि
stanzas.transliteration: úpem asr̥kṣi vājayúr vacasyā́ṃ cáno dadhīta nādyó gíro me apā́ṃ nápād āśuhémā kuvít sá supéśasas karati jóṣiṣad dhí
stanzas.translation: EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour. Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?

translations.griffith: EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour. Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?
translations.macdonell: Desiring gain this eloquence I utter: May the streams' son accept my songs with gladness. Will he, the Son of Waters, of swift impulse, Perchance reward them well? He will enjoy them.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं स्व॑स्मै हृ॒द आ सुत॑ष्टं॒ मन्त्रं॑ वोचेम कु॒विद॑स्य॒ वेद॑त् अ॒पां नपा॑दसु॒र्य॑स्य म॒ह्ना विश्वा॑न्य॒र्यो भुव॑ना जजान
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ sv àsmai hr̥dá ā́ sútaṣṭam mántraṃ vocema kuvíd asya védat apā́ṃ nápād asuryàsya mahnā́ víśvāny aryó bhúvanā jajāna
stanzas.translation: To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it' The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.

translations.griffith: To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it' The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.
translations.macdonell: Now from our hearts we would this hymn well-fashioned Address to him: perchance he will regard it. The noble Son of Waters, by the greatness Of rule divine, all creatures has created.

stanzas.sanskrit: सम॒न्या यन्त्युप॑ यन्त्य॒न्याः स॑मा॒नमू॒र्वं न॒द्यः॑ पृणन्ति तमू॒ शुचिं॒ शुच॑यो दीदि॒वांस॑म॒पां नपा॑तं॒ परि॑ तस्थु॒रापः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sám anyā́ yánty úpa yanty anyā́ḥ samānám ūrváṃ nadyàḥ pr̥ṇanti tám ū śúciṃ śúcayo dīdivā́ṃsam apā́ṃ nápātam pári tasthur ā́paḥ
stanzas.translation: Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse. On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.

translations.griffith: Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse. On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.
translations.macdonell: Some flow together, some approach the ocean; The rivers thus fill up the common cistern. And him the pure, the shining Son of Waters, The waters pure on all sides have surrounded.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमस्मे॑रा युव॒तयो॒ युवा॑नं मर्मृ॒ज्यमा॑नाः॒ परि॑ य॒न्त्यापः॑ स शु॒क्रेभिः॒ शिक्व॑भी रे॒वद॒स्मे दी॒दाया॑नि॒ध्मो घृ॒तनि॑र्णिग॒प्सु
stanzas.transliteration: tám ásmerā yuvatáyo yúvānam marmr̥jyámānāḥ pári yanty ā́paḥ sá śukrébhiḥ śíkvabhī revád asmé dīdā́yānidhmó ghr̥tánirṇig apsú
stanzas.translation: The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful. He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood. in waters, oil-enveloped.

translations.griffith: The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful. He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood. in waters, oil-enveloped.
translations.macdonell: The waters, youthful maidens, never smiling, Making him bright, encompass him the youthful. He with clear flames, free-handedly upon us, Unfed with wood, shines decked with ghee in waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मै ति॒स्रो अ॑व्य॒थ्याय॒ नारी॑र्दे॒वाय॑ दे॒वीर्दि॑धिष॒न्त्यन्न॑म् कृता॑ इ॒वोप॒ हि प्र॑स॒र्स्रे अ॒प्सु स पी॒यूषं॑ धयति पूर्व॒सूना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: asmaí tisró avyathyā́ya nā́rīr devā́ya devī́r didhiṣanty ánnam kŕ̥tā ivópa hí prasarsré apsú sá pīyū́ṣaṃ dhayati pūrvasū́nām
stanzas.translation: To him three Dames are oftering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure. Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.

translations.griffith: To him three Dames are oftering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure. Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.
translations.macdonell: Three dames divine to him the god, the dauntless, Wish eagerly to offer food for nurture. He seems to seek their breasts within the waters: He drinks the milk of them that first are mothers.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्व॒स्यात्र॒ जनि॑मा॒स्य च॒ स्व॑र्द्रु॒हो रि॒षः स॒म्पृचः॑ पाहि सू॒रीन् आ॒मासु॑ पू॒र्षु प॒रो अ॑प्रमृ॒ष्यं नारा॑तयो॒ वि न॑श॒न्नानृ॑तानि
stanzas.transliteration: áśvasyā́tra jánimāsyá ca svàr druhó riṣáḥ sampŕ̥caḥ pāhi sūrī́n āmā́su pūrṣú paró apramr̥ṣyáṃ nā́rātayo ví naśan nā́nr̥tāni
stanzas.translation: Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught. Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.

translations.griffith: Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught. Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.
translations.macdonell: The birthplace of this steed is earth and heaven. Our patrons do thou guard from harm and malice. Him not to be forgotten, far off dwelling In cloud-built forts, foes shall not reach nor false-hoods.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व आ दमे॑ सु॒दुघा॒ यस्य॑ धे॒नुः स्व॒धां पी॑पाय सु॒भ्वन्न॑मत्ति सो अ॒पां नपा॑दू॒र्जय॑न्न॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर्व॑सु॒देया॑य विध॒ते वि भा॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: svá ā́ dáme sudúghā yásya dhenúḥ svadhā́m pīpāya subhv ánnam atti só apā́ṃ nápād ūrjáyann apsv àntár vasudéyāya vidhaté ví bhāti
stanzas.translation: He, in whose mansion is the teeming Milch-cow, swells the Gods' nectar and cats noble viands. lle Son of Waters, gathering strength in waters, shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.

translations.griffith: He, in whose mansion is the teeming Milch-cow, swells the Gods' nectar and cats noble viands. lle Son of Waters, gathering strength in waters, shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.
translations.macdonell: He in whose house is a productive milch-cow Increasing vital force, fares on good nurture. The Waters' Son, expanding in the waters. Shines forth upon the pious, granting riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो अ॒प्स्वा शुचि॑ना॒ दैव्ये॑न ऋ॒तावाज॑स्र उर्वि॒या वि॒भाति॑ व॒या इद॒न्या भुव॑नान्यस्य॒ प्र जा॑यन्ते वी॒रुध॑श्च प्र॒जाभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó apsv ā́ śúcinā daívyena r̥tā́vā́jasra urviyā́ vibhā́ti vayā́ íd anyā́ bhúvanāny asya prá jāyante vīrúdhaś ca prajā́bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: He who in waters with his own pure Godhead shines widely, law-abiding, everlasting- The other worlds are verily his branches, and plants are born of him with all their offspring.

translations.griffith: He who in waters with his own pure Godhead shines widely, law-abiding, everlasting- The other worlds are verily his branches, and plants are born of him with all their offspring.
translations.macdonell: Who in the waters, with celestial brightness, Shines widely forth, eternal, law-abiding. Of him as branches every plant and creature Do propagate themselves with all their offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पां नपा॒दा ह्यस्था॑दु॒पस्थं॑ जि॒ह्माना॑मू॒र्ध्वो वि॒द्युतं॒ वसा॑नः तस्य॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ महि॒मानं॒ वह॑न्ती॒र्हिर॑ण्यवर्णाः॒ परि॑ यन्ति य॒ह्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: apā́ṃ nápād ā́ hy ásthād upásthaṃ jihmā́nām ūrdhvó vidyútaṃ vásānaḥ tásya jyéṣṭham mahimā́naṃ váhantīr híraṇyavarṇāḥ pári yanti yahvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: The Waters' Son hath risen, and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom; And bearing with them his supremest glory the Youthful Ones, gold-coloured, move around him.

translations.griffith: The Waters' Son hath risen, and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom; And bearing with them his supremest glory the Youthful Ones, gold-coloured, move around him.
translations.macdonell: Their son has mounted the lap of the prostrate, Standing erect and clothed around with lightning. And bearing on with them his highest greatness, The swift streams, golden-coloured, flow around him.

stanzas.sanskrit: हिर॑ण्यरूपः॒ स हिर॑ण्यसंदृग॒पां नपा॒त्सेदु॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णः हि॒र॒ण्यया॒त्परि॒ योने॑र्नि॒षद्या॑ हिरण्य॒दा द॑द॒त्यन्न॑मस्मै
stanzas.transliteration: híraṇyarūpaḥ sá híraṇyasaṃdr̥g apā́ṃ nápāt séd u híraṇyavarṇaḥ hiraṇyáyāt pári yóner niṣádyā hiraṇyadā́ dadaty ánnam asmai
stanzas.translation: Golden in form is he, like gold to look on, his colour is like gold, the Son of Waters. When he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.

translations.griffith: Golden in form is he, like gold to look on, his colour is like gold, the Son of Waters. When he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.
translations.macdonell: He is of golden form, of golden aspect, This Son of Waters is of golden colour. And him who from a golden birthplace issues, Those that give gold present with food when seated.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद॒स्यानी॑कमु॒त चारु॒ नामा॑पी॒च्यं॑ वर्धते॒ नप्तु॑र॒पाम् यमि॒न्धते॑ युव॒तयः॒ समि॒त्था हिर॑ण्यवर्णं घृ॒तमन्न॑मस्य
stanzas.transliteration: tád asyā́nīkam utá cā́ru nā́ma- -apīcyàṃ vardhate náptur apā́m yám indháte yuvatáyaḥ sám itthā́ híraṇyavarṇaṃ ghr̥tám ánnam asya
stanzas.translation: This the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the Waters' Son increase in secret. Whom here the youthful Maids together kindle, his food is sacred oil of golden colour.

translations.griffith: This the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the Waters' Son increase in secret. Whom here the youthful Maids together kindle, his food is sacred oil of golden colour.
translations.macdonell: That countenance of him, that name belovèd Of him, the Waters' Son, increase in secret. Whom thus the maidens all together kindle, Of him, the golden-hued, the food is butter.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मै ब॑हू॒नाम॑व॒माय॒ सख्ये॑ य॒ज्ञैर्वि॑धेम॒ नम॑सा ह॒विर्भिः॑ सं सानु॒ मार्ज्मि॒ दिधि॑षामि॒ बिल्मै॒र्दधा॒म्यन्नैः॒ परि॑ वन्द ऋ॒ग्भिः
stanzas.transliteration: asmaí bahūnā́m avamā́ya sákhye yajñaír vidhema námasā havírbhiḥ sáṃ sā́nu mā́rjmi dídhiṣāmi bílmair dádhāmy ánnaiḥ pári vanda r̥gbhíḥ
stanzas.translation: Him, nearest Friend of many, will we worship with sacrifice. and reverence and oblation. I make his back to shine, with chips provide him; t offer food and with my songs exalt him.

translations.griffith: Him, nearest Friend of many, will we worship with sacrifice. and reverence and oblation. I make his back to shine, with chips provide him; t offer food and with my songs exalt him.
translations.macdonell: Then him the nearest friend of many mortals We serve with sacrifices, gifts, obeisance. I make his back to shine, with shavings feed him; I nourish him with food, with stanzas laud him.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ईं॒ वृषा॑जनय॒त्तासु॒ गर्भं॒ स ईं॒ शिशु॑र्धयति॒ तं रि॑हन्ति सो अ॒पां नपा॒दन॑भिम्लातवर्णो॒ऽन्यस्ये॑वे॒ह त॒न्वा॑ विवेष
stanzas.transliteration: sá īṃ vŕ̥ṣā janayat tā́su gárbhaṃ sá īṃ śíśur dhayati táṃ rihanti só apā́ṃ nápād ánabhimlātavarṇo -anyásyevehá tanvā̀ viveṣa
stanzas.translation: The Bull hath laid his own life-germ Within them. He sucks them as an infant, and they kiss him. He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, hadi entered here as in another's body.

translations.griffith: The Bull hath laid his own life-germ Within them. He sucks them as an infant, and they kiss him. He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, hadi entered here as in another's body.
translations.macdonell: He, as a bull, in them that germ engendered; He, as their infant, sucks their breasts; they kiss him. He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, Here works as with the body of another:

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मिन्प॒दे प॑र॒मे त॑स्थि॒वांस॑मध्व॒स्मभि॑र्वि॒श्वहा॑ दीदि॒वांस॑म् आपो॒ नप्त्रे॑ घृ॒तमन्नं॒ वह॑न्तीः स्व॒यमत्कैः॒ परि॑ दीयन्ति य॒ह्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: asmín padé paramé tasthivā́ṃsam adhvasmábhir viśváhā dīdivā́ṃsam ā́po náptre ghr̥tám ánnaṃ váhantīḥ svayám átkaiḥ pári dīyanti yahvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: While here he dwelleth in sublimest station, resplendent with the rays that never perish, The Waters, bearing oil to feed their ofispring, flow, Youthful Ones, in wanderings about him.

translations.griffith: While here he dwelleth in sublimest station, resplendent with the rays that never perish, The Waters, bearing oil to feed their ofispring, flow, Youthful Ones, in wanderings about him.
translations.macdonell: While he is dwelling in this highest station, For ever shining with undimmed effulgence, The waters bringing ghee to feed their offspring, Themselves, the swift ones, with their robes fly round him.

stanzas.sanskrit: अयां॑समग्ने सुक्षि॒तिं जना॒यायां॑समु म॒घव॑द्भ्यः सुवृ॒क्तिम् विश्वं॒ तद्भ॒द्रं यदव॑न्ति दे॒वा बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áyāṃsam agne sukṣitíṃ jánāya- -áyāṃsam u maghávadbhyaḥ suvr̥ktím víśvaṃ tád bhadráṃ yád ávanti devā́ḥ- br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, I gave good shelter to the people, and to the princes goodly preparation. Blessed is all that Gods regard with favour. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Agni, I gave good shelter to the people, and to the princes goodly preparation. Blessed is all that Gods regard with favour. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
translations.macdonell: I have bestowed safe dwelling on our people, A well-wrought hymn, too, Agni, on our patrons: All that is favoured by the gods is blessèd. May we speak loud, with heroes, in the synod.

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्यं॑ हिन्वा॒नो व॑सिष्ट॒ गा अ॒पोऽधु॑क्षन्त्सी॒मवि॑भि॒रद्रि॑भि॒र्नरः॑ पिबे॑न्द्र॒ स्वाहा॒ प्रहु॑तं॒ वष॑ट्कृतं हो॒त्रादा सोमं॑ प्रथ॒मो य ईशि॑षे
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyaṃ hinvānó [']vasiṣṭa gā́ apó -ádhukṣan sīm ávibhir ádribhir náraḥ píbendra svā́hā práhutaṃ váṣaṭkr̥taṃ hotrā́d ā́ sómam prathamó yá ī́śiṣe
stanzas.translation: WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones. Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowlfirst right is thine-Soma hallowed and poured with Vashaṭ and Svâhâ.

translations.griffith: WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones. Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowlfirst right is thine-Soma hallowed and poured with Vashaṭ and Svâhâ.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञैः सम्मि॑श्लाः॒ पृष॑तीभिर्ऋ॒ष्टिभि॒र्याम॑ञ्छु॒भ्रासो॑ अ॒ञ्जिषु॑ प्रि॒या उ॒त आ॒सद्या॑ ब॒र्हिर्भ॑रतस्य सूनवः पो॒त्रादा सोमं॑ पिबता दिवो नरः
stanzas.transliteration: yajñaíḥ sámmiślāḥ pŕ̥ṣatībhir r̥ṣṭíbhir yā́mañ chubhrā́so añjíṣu priyā́ utá āsádyā barhír bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrā́d ā́ sómam pibatā divo naraḥ
stanzas.translation: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends, Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bharata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.

translations.griffith: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends, Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bharata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒मेव॑ नः सुहवा॒ आ हि गन्त॑न॒ नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतना॒ रणि॑ष्टन अथा॑ मन्दस्व जुजुषा॒णो अन्ध॑स॒स्त्वष्ट॑र्दे॒वेभि॒र्जनि॑भिः सु॒मद्ग॑णः
stanzas.transliteration: améva naḥ suhavā ā́ hí gántana ní barhíṣi sadatanā ráṇiṣṭana áthā mandasva jujuṣāṇó ándhasas tváṣṭar devébhir jánibhiḥ sumádgaṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: Come unto us, ye swift to listen: as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves. And, Tvashṭar, well-content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company.

translations.griffith: Come unto us, ye swift to listen: as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves. And, Tvashṭar, well-content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ व॑क्षि दे॒वाँ इ॒ह वि॑प्र॒ यक्षि॑ चो॒शन्हो॑त॒र्नि ष॑दा॒ योनि॑षु त्रि॒षु प्रति॑ वीहि॒ प्रस्थि॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॒ पिबाग्नी॑ध्रा॒त्तव॑ भा॒गस्य॑ तृप्णुहि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vakṣi devā́m̐ ihá vipra yákṣi ca- -uśán hotar ní ṣadā yóniṣu triṣú práti vīhi prásthitaṃ somyám mádhu píbā́gnīdhrāt táva bhāgásya tr̥pṇuhi
stanzas.translation: Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice: at the three altars seat thee willingly, O Priest. Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma meath: drink from the Kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share.

translations.griffith: Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice: at the three altars seat thee willingly, O Priest. Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma meath: drink from the Kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष स्य ते॑ त॒न्वो॑ नृम्ण॒वर्ध॑नः॒ सह॒ ओजः॑ प्र॒दिवि॑ बा॒ह्वोर्हि॒तः तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तो म॑घव॒न्तुभ्य॒माभृ॑त॒स्त्वम॑स्य॒ ब्राह्म॑णा॒दा तृ॒पत्पि॑ब
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá syá te tanvò nr̥mṇavárdhanaḥ sáha ójaḥ pradívi bāhvór hitáḥ túbhyaṃ sutó maghavan túbhyam ā́bhr̥tas tvám asya brā́hmaṇād ā́ tr̥pát piba
stanzas.translation: This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength, victory for all time are placed within thine arms. Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brahman, drink thy fill.

translations.griffith: This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength, victory for all time are placed within thine arms. Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brahman, drink thy fill.

stanzas.sanskrit: जु॒षेथां॑ य॒ज्ञं बोध॑तं॒ हव॑स्य मे स॒त्तो होता॑ नि॒विदः॑ पू॒र्व्या अनु॑ अच्छा॒ राजा॑ना॒ नम॑ एत्या॒वृतं॑ प्रशा॒स्त्रादा पि॑बतं सो॒म्यं मधु॑
stanzas.transliteration: juṣéthāṃ yajñám bódhataṃ hávasya me sattó hótā nivídaḥ pūrvyā́ ánu áchā rā́jānā náma ety āvŕ̥tam praśāstrā́d ā́ pibataṃ somyám mádhu
stanzas.translation: Accept the sacrifice; mark both of you, my call: the Priest hath seated him after the ancient texts. My prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the Kings: drink ye the Soma meath from the Director's bowl.

translations.griffith: Accept the sacrifice; mark both of you, my call: the Priest hath seated him after the ancient texts. My prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the Kings: drink ye the Soma meath from the Director's bowl.

stanzas.sanskrit: मन्द॑स्व हो॒त्रादनु॒ जोष॒मन्ध॒सोऽध्व॑र्यवः॒ स पू॒र्णां व॑ष्ट्या॒सिच॑म् तस्मा॑ ए॒तं भ॑रत तद्व॒शो द॒दिर्हो॒त्रात्सोमं॑ द्रविणोदः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mándasva hotrā́d ánu jóṣam ándhasaḥ- -ádhvaryavaḥ sá pūrṇā́ṃ vaṣṭy āsícam tásmā etám bharata tadvaśó dadír hotrā́d sómaṃ draviṇodaḥ píba r̥túbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him. Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Sorna with the Rtus from the Hotar's cup.

translations.griffith: Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him. Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Sorna with the Rtus from the Hotar's cup.

stanzas.sanskrit: यमु॒ पूर्व॒महु॑वे॒ तमि॒दं हु॑वे॒ सेदु॒ हव्यो॑ द॒दिर्यो नाम॒ पत्य॑ते अ॒ध्व॒र्युभिः॒ प्रस्थि॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॑ पो॒त्रात्सोमं॑ द्रविणोदः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yám u pū́rvam áhuve tám idáṃ huve séd u hávyo dadír yó nā́ma pátyate adhvaryúbhiḥ prásthitaṃ somyám mádhu potrā́t sómaṃ draviṇodaḥ píba r̥túbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives, Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Potar's cup.

translations.griffith: He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives, Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Potar's cup.

stanzas.sanskrit: मेद्य॑न्तु ते॒ वह्न॑यो॒ येभि॒रीय॒सेऽरि॑षण्यन्वीळयस्वा वनस्पते आ॒यूया॑ धृष्णो अभि॒गूर्या॒ त्वं ने॒ष्ट्रात्सोमं॑ द्रविणोदः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: médyantu te váhnayo yébhir ī́yase- -áriṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate āyū́yā dhr̥ṣṇo abhigū́ryā tváṃ neṣṭrā́t sómaṃ draviṇodaḥ píba r̥túbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself. Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Neshṭar's cup.

translations.griffith: Fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself. Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Neshṭar's cup.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपा॑द्धो॒त्रादु॒त पो॒त्राद॑मत्तो॒त ने॒ष्ट्राद॑जुषत॒ प्रयो॑ हि॒तम् तु॒रीयं॒ पात्र॒ममृ॑क्त॒मम॑र्त्यं द्रविणो॒दाः पि॑बतु द्राविणोद॒सः
stanzas.transliteration: ápād dhotrā́d utá potrā́d amatta- -utá neṣṭrā́d ajuṣata práyo hitám turī́yam pā́tram ámr̥ktam ámartyaṃ draviṇodā́ḥ pibatu drāviṇodasáḥ
stanzas.translation: From Hotar's cup and Potar's he hath drunk and joyed: the proffered food hath pleased him from the Neshṭar's bowl. The fourth cup undisturbed, immortal, let him drink who giveth wealth, the cup of the wealth-giving God.

translations.griffith: From Hotar's cup and Potar's he hath drunk and joyed: the proffered food hath pleased him from the Neshṭar's bowl. The fourth cup undisturbed, immortal, let him drink who giveth wealth, the cup of the wealth-giving God.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वाञ्च॑म॒द्य य॒य्यं॑ नृ॒वाह॑णं॒ रथं॑ युञ्जाथामि॒ह वां॑ वि॒मोच॑नम् पृ॒ङ्क्तं ह॒वींषि॒ मधु॒ना हि कं॑ ग॒तमथा॒ सोमं॑ पिबतं वाजिनीवसू
stanzas.transliteration: arvā́ñcam adyá yayyàṃ nr̥vā́haṇaṃ ráthaṃ yuñjāthām ihá vāṃ vimócanam pr̥ṅktáṃ havī́ṃṣi mádhunā́ hí kaṃ gatám áthā sómam pibataṃ vājinīvasū
stanzas.translation: Yoke, O ye Twain, to-day your hero-bearing car, swift-moving hitherward: your loosing-place is here. Mix the oblations, then come hither with the meath, and drink the Soma, ye rich in abundant strength.

translations.griffith: Yoke, O ye Twain, to-day your hero-bearing car, swift-moving hitherward: your loosing-place is here. Mix the oblations, then come hither with the meath, and drink the Soma, ye rich in abundant strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: जोष्य॑ग्ने स॒मिधं॒ जोष्याहु॑तिं॒ जोषि॒ ब्रह्म॒ जन्यं॒ जोषि॑ सुष्टु॒तिम् विश्वे॑भि॒र्विश्वाँ॑ ऋ॒तुना॑ वसो म॒ह उ॒शन्दे॒वाँ उ॑श॒तः पा॑यया ह॒विः
stanzas.transliteration: jóṣy agne samídhaṃ jóṣy ā́hutiṃ jóṣi bráhma jányaṃ jóṣi suṣṭutím víśvebhir víśvām̐ r̥túnā vaso maháḥ- uśán devā́m̐ uśatáḥ pāyayā havíḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, accept the fuel and our offered gift: accept the prayer of man, accept our eulogy, Do thou with all, with Rtu, O thou Excellent, fain, make the great Gods all fain taste the gift we bring.

translations.griffith: Agni, accept the fuel and our offered gift: accept the prayer of man, accept our eulogy, Do thou with all, with Rtu, O thou Excellent, fain, make the great Gods all fain taste the gift we bring.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता स॒वाय॑ शश्वत्त॒मं तद॑पा॒ वह्नि॑रस्थात् नू॒नं दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वि हि धाति॒ रत्न॒मथाभ॑जद्वी॒तिहो॑त्रं स्व॒स्तौ
stanzas.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ savā́ya śaśvattamáṃ tádapā váhnir asthāt nūnáṃ devébhyo ví hí dhā́ti rátnam áthā́bhajad vītíhotraṃ svastaú
stanzas.translation: UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty. To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.

translations.griffith: UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty. To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्व॑स्य॒ हि श्रु॒ष्टये॑ दे॒व ऊ॒र्ध्वः प्र बा॒हवा॑ पृ॒थुपा॑णिः॒ सिस॑र्ति आप॑श्चिदस्य व्र॒त आ निमृ॑ग्रा अ॒यं चि॒द्वातो॑ रमते॒ परि॑ज्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: víśvasya hí śruṣṭáye devá ūrdhváḥ prá bāhávā pr̥thúpāṇiḥ sísarti ā́paś cid asya vratá ā́ nímr̥grāḥ- ayáṃ cid vā́to ramate párijman
stanzas.translation: Having gone up on high, the God broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him. Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.

translations.griffith: Having gone up on high, the God broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him. Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒शुभि॑श्चि॒द्यान्वि मु॑चाति नू॒नमरी॑रम॒दत॑मानं चि॒देतोः॑ अ॒ह्यर्षू॑णां चि॒न्न्य॑याँ अवि॒ष्यामनु॑ व्र॒तं स॑वि॒तुर्मोक्यागा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: āśúbhiś cid yā́n ví mucāti nūnám árīramad átamānaṃ cid étoḥ ahyárṣūṇāṃ cin ny àyām̐ aviṣyā́m ánu vratáṃ savitúr móky ā́gāt
stanzas.translation: Though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them: e'en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going. He hath checked e'en their haste who glide like serpents. Night closely followed Savitar's dominion.

translations.griffith: Though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them: e'en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going. He hath checked e'en their haste who glide like serpents. Night closely followed Savitar's dominion.

stanzas.sanskrit: पुनः॒ सम॑व्य॒द्वित॑तं॒ वय॑न्ती म॒ध्या कर्तो॒र्न्य॑धा॒च्छक्म॒ धीरः॑ उत्सं॒हाया॑स्था॒द्व्यृ१॒॑तूँर॑दर्धर॒रम॑तिः सवि॒ता दे॒व आगा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: púnaḥ sám avyad vítataṃ váyantī madhyā́ kártor ny àdhāc chákma dhī́raḥ út saṃhā́yāsthād vy r̥̀tū́m̐r adardhar arámatiḥ savitā́ devá ā́gāt
stanzas.translation: What was spread out she weaves afresh, re-weaving: the skilful leaves his labour half-completed. He hath arisen from rest, and parted seasons: Savitar hath approached, God, holy-minded.

translations.griffith: What was spread out she weaves afresh, re-weaving: the skilful leaves his labour half-completed. He hath arisen from rest, and parted seasons: Savitar hath approached, God, holy-minded.

stanzas.sanskrit: नानौकां॑सि॒ दुर्यो॒ विश्व॒मायु॒र्वि ति॑ष्ठते प्रभ॒वः शोको॑ अ॒ग्नेः ज्येष्ठं॑ मा॒ता सू॒नवे॑ भा॒गमाधा॒दन्व॑स्य॒ केत॑मिषि॒तं स॑वि॒त्रा
stanzas.transliteration: nā́naúkāṃsi dúryo víśvam ā́yur ví tiṣṭhate prabhaváḥ śóko agnéḥ jyéṣṭham mātā́ sūnáve bhāgám ā́dhād ánv asya kétam iṣitáṃ savitrā́
stanzas.translation: Tlirough various dwellings, through entire existence, spreads, manifest, the household light of Agni. The Mother gives her Son the goodliest portion, and Savitar hath sped to meet his summons.

translations.griffith: Tlirough various dwellings, through entire existence, spreads, manifest, the household light of Agni. The Mother gives her Son the goodliest portion, and Savitar hath sped to meet his summons.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒माव॑वर्ति॒ विष्ठि॑तो जिगी॒षुर्विश्वे॑षां॒ काम॒श्चर॑ताम॒माभू॑त् शश्वाँ॒ अपो॒ विकृ॑तं हि॒त्व्यागा॒दनु॑ व्र॒तं स॑वि॒तुर्दैव्य॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: samā́vavarti víṣṭhito jigīṣúr víśveṣāṃ kā́maś cáratām amā́bhūt śáśvām̐ ápo víkr̥taṃ hitvy ā́gād ánu vratáṃ savitúr daívyasya
stanzas.translation: He comes again, unfolded, fain for conquest: at home was he, the love of all things moving. Each man hath come leaving his evil doings, after the Godlike Savitar's commandment.

translations.griffith: He comes again, unfolded, fain for conquest: at home was he, the love of all things moving. Each man hath come leaving his evil doings, after the Godlike Savitar's commandment.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वया॑ हि॒तमप्य॑म॒प्सु भा॒गं धन्वान्वा मृ॑ग॒यसो॒ वि त॑स्थुः वना॑नि॒ विभ्यो॒ नकि॑रस्य॒ तानि॑ व्र॒ता दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्मि॑नन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: tváyā hitám ápyam apsú bhāgáṃ dhánvā́nv ā́ mr̥gayáso ví tasthuḥ vánāni víbhyo nákir asya tā́ni vratā́ devásya savitúr minanti
stanzas.translation: The wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters. The woods are given to the birds. These statutes of the God Savitar none disobeyeth.

translations.griffith: The wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters. The woods are given to the birds. These statutes of the God Savitar none disobeyeth.

stanzas.sanskrit: या॒द्रा॒ध्यं१॒॑ वरु॑णो॒ योनि॒मप्य॒मनि॑शितं नि॒मिषि॒ जर्भु॑राणः विश्वो॑ मार्ता॒ण्डो व्र॒जमा प॒शुर्गा॑त्स्थ॒शो जन्मा॑नि सवि॒ता व्याकः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yādrādhyàṃ váruṇo yónim ápyam ániśitaṃ nimíṣi járbhurāṇaḥ víśvo mārtāṇḍó vrajám ā́ paśúr gāt sthaśó jánmāni savitā́ vy ā́kaḥ
stanzas.translation: With utmost speed, in restless haste at sunset Varuṇa seeks his watery habitation. Then seeks each bird his nest, each beast his lodging. In due place Savitar hath set each creature.

translations.griffith: With utmost speed, in restless haste at sunset Varuṇa seeks his watery habitation. Then seeks each bird his nest, each beast his lodging. In due place Savitar hath set each creature.

stanzas.sanskrit: न यस्येन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो॒ न मि॒त्रो व्र॒तम॑र्य॒मा न मि॒नन्ति॑ रु॒द्रः नारा॑तय॒स्तमि॒दं स्व॒स्ति हु॒वे दे॒वं स॑वि॒तारं॒ नमो॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: ná yásyéndro váruṇo ná mitró vratám aryamā́ ná minánti rudráḥ nā́rātayas tám idáṃ svastí huvé deváṃ savitā́raṃ námobhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Him whose high law not Varuṇa nor Indra, not Mitra, Aryaman, nor Rudra breaketh, Nor evil-hearted fiends, here for my welfare him I invoke, God Savitar, with worship.

translations.griffith: Him whose high law not Varuṇa nor Indra, not Mitra, Aryaman, nor Rudra breaketh, Nor evil-hearted fiends, here for my welfare him I invoke, God Savitar, with worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: भगं॒ धियं॑ वा॒जय॑न्तः॒ पुरं॑धिं॒ नरा॒शंसो॒ ग्नास्पति॑र्नो अव्याः आ॒ये वा॒मस्य॑ संग॒थे र॑यी॒णां प्रि॒या दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः स्या॑म
stanzas.transliteration: bhágaṃ dhíyaṃ vājáyantaḥ púraṃdhiṃ nárāśáṃso gnā́spátir no avyāḥ āyé vāmásya saṃgathé rayīṇā́m priyā́ devásya savitúḥ syāma
stanzas.translation: May they who strengthen bliss, and thought and wisdom, and the Dames' Lord and Narâṣansa aid us. That good may come to us and wealth be gathered, may we be Savitar the God's beloved.

translations.griffith: May they who strengthen bliss, and thought and wisdom, and the Dames' Lord and Narâṣansa aid us. That good may come to us and wealth be gathered, may we be Savitar the God's beloved.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्दि॒वो अ॒द्भ्यः पृ॑थि॒व्यास्त्वया॑ द॒त्तं काम्यं॒ राध॒ आ गा॑त् शं यत्स्तो॒तृभ्य॑ आ॒पये॒ भवा॑त्युरु॒शंसा॑य सवितर्जरि॒त्रे
stanzas.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tád divó adbhyáḥ pr̥thivyā́s tváyā dattáṃ kā́myaṃ rā́dha ā́ gāt śáṃ yát stotŕ̥bhya āpáye bhávāti- uruśáṃsāya savitar jaritré
stanzas.translation: So come to us our hearts' desire, the bounty bestowed by thee, from heaven and earth and waters, That it be well with friends and those who praise thee, and, Savitar, with the loud-lauding singer.

translations.griffith: So come to us our hearts' desire, the bounty bestowed by thee, from heaven and earth and waters, That it be well with friends and those who praise thee, and, Savitar, with the loud-lauding singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग्रावा॑णेव॒ तदिदर्थं॑ जरेथे॒ गृध्रे॑व वृ॒क्षं नि॑धि॒मन्त॒मच्छ॑ ब्र॒ह्माणे॑व वि॒दथ॑ उक्थ॒शासा॑ दू॒तेव॒ हव्या॒ जन्या॑ पुरु॒त्रा
stanzas.transliteration: grā́vāṇeva tád íd árthaṃ jarethe gŕ̥dhreva vr̥kṣáṃ nidhimántam ácha brahmā́ṇeva vidátha ukthaśā́sā dūtéva hávyā jányā purutrā́
stanzas.translation: SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure; Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.

translations.griffith: SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure; Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒त॒र्यावा॑णा र॒थ्ये॑व वी॒राजेव॑ य॒मा वर॒मा स॑चेथे मेने॑ इव त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ शुम्भ॑माने॒ दम्प॑तीव क्रतु॒विदा॒ जने॑षु
stanzas.transliteration: prātaryā́vāṇā rathyèva vīrā́- -ajéva yamā́ váram ā́ sacethe méne iva tanvā̀ śúmbhamāne dámpatīva kratuvídā jáneṣu
stanzas.translation: Moving at morning like two chr-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing; Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.

translations.griffith: Moving at morning like two chr-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing; Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.

stanzas.sanskrit: शृङ्गे॑व नः प्रथ॒मा ग॑न्तम॒र्वाक्छ॒फावि॑व॒ जर्भु॑राणा॒ तरो॑भिः च॒क्र॒वा॒केव॒ प्रति॒ वस्तो॑रुस्रा॒र्वाञ्चा॑ यातं र॒थ्ये॑व शक्रा
stanzas.transliteration: śŕ̥ṅgeva naḥ prathamā́ gantam arvā́k -śaphā́v iva járbhurāṇā tárobhiḥ cakravākéva práti vástor usrā- -arvā́ñcā yātaṃ rathyèva śakrā
stanzas.translation: Like to a pair of horns come first to usward, like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion; Come like two Chakwâs in the grey of morning, come like two chariot wheels at dawn, ye Mighty.

translations.griffith: Like to a pair of horns come first to usward, like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion; Come like two Chakwâs in the grey of morning, come like two chariot wheels at dawn, ye Mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: ना॒वेव॑ नः पारयतं यु॒गेव॒ नभ्ये॑व न उप॒धीव॑ प्र॒धीव॑ श्वाने॑व नो॒ अरि॑षण्या त॒नूनां॒ खृग॑लेव वि॒स्रसः॑ पातम॒स्मान्
stanzas.transliteration: nāvéva naḥ pārayataṃ yugéva nábhyeva na upadhī́va pradhī́va śvā́neva no áriṣaṇyā tanū́nāṃ khŕ̥galeva visrásaḥ pātam asmā́n
stanzas.translation: Bear us across the rivers like two vessels, save us as ye were yokes, naves, spokes and fellies. Be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us, like two crutches, that we fall not.

translations.griffith: Bear us across the rivers like two vessels, save us as ye were yokes, naves, spokes and fellies. Be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us, like two crutches, that we fall not.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाते॑वाजु॒र्या न॒द्ये॑व री॒तिर॒क्षी इ॑व॒ चक्षु॒षा या॑तम॒र्वाक् हस्ता॑विव त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ शम्भ॑विष्ठा॒ पादे॑व नो नयतं॒ वस्यो॒ अच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: vā́tevājuryā́ nadyèva rītír akṣī́ iva cákṣuṣā́ yātam arvā́k hástāv iva tanvè śámbhaviṣṭhā pā́deva no nayataṃ vásyo ácha
stanzas.translation: Like two winds ageing not, two confluent rivers, come with quick vision like two eyes before us. Come like two hands most helpful to the body, and guide us like two feet to what is precious.

translations.griffith: Like two winds ageing not, two confluent rivers, come with quick vision like two eyes before us. Come like two hands most helpful to the body, and guide us like two feet to what is precious.

stanzas.sanskrit: ओष्ठा॑विव॒ मध्वा॒स्ने वद॑न्ता॒ स्तना॑विव पिप्यतं जी॒वसे॑ नः नासे॑व नस्त॒न्वो॑ रक्षि॒तारा॒ कर्णा॑विव सु॒श्रुता॑ भूतम॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: óṣṭhāv iva mádhv āsné vádantā stánāv iva pipyataṃ jīváse naḥ nā́seva nas tanvò rakṣitā́rā kárṇāv iva suśrútā bhūtam asmé
stanzas.translation: Even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey, even as two breasts that nourish our existence, Like the two nostrils that protect our being, be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.
