translations.griffith: Even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey, even as two breasts that nourish our existence, Like the two nostrils that protect our being, be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.

stanzas.sanskrit: हस्ते॑व श॒क्तिम॒भि सं॑द॒दी नः॒ क्षामे॑व नः॒ सम॑जतं॒ रजां॑सि इ॒मा गिरो॑ अश्विना युष्म॒यन्तीः॒ क्ष्णोत्रे॑णेव॒ स्वधि॑तिं॒ सं शि॑शीतम्
stanzas.transliteration: hásteva śaktím abhí saṃdadī́ naḥ kṣā́meva naḥ sám ajataṃ rájāṃsi imā́ gíro aśvinā yuṣmayántīḥ kṣṇótreṇeva svádhitiṃ sáṃ śiśītam
stanzas.translation: Like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions. Aṣvins, these hymns that struggle to approach you, sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.

translations.griffith: Like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions. Aṣvins, these hymns that struggle to approach you, sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तानि॑ वामश्विना॒ वर्ध॑नानि॒ ब्रह्म॒ स्तोमं॑ गृत्सम॒दासो॑ अक्रन् तानि॑ नरा जुजुषा॒णोप॑ यातं बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ni vām aśvinā várdhanāni bráhma stómaṃ gr̥tsamadā́so akran tā́ni narā jujuṣāṇópa yātam br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: These prayers of ours exalting you, O Aṣvins, have the Gr̥itsamadas, for a laud, made ready. Welcome them, O ye Heroes, and come bither. Loud may we speak. with brave men, in assembly.

translations.griffith: These prayers of ours exalting you, O Aṣvins, have the Gr̥itsamadas, for a laud, made ready. Welcome them, O ye Heroes, and come bither. Loud may we speak. with brave men, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोमा॑पूषणा॒ जन॑ना रयी॒णां जन॑ना दि॒वो जन॑ना पृथि॒व्याः जा॒तौ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य गो॒पौ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वन्न॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभि॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sómāpūṣaṇā jánanā rayīṇā́ṃ jánanā divó jánanā pr̥thivyā́ḥ jātaú víśvasya bhúvanasya gopaú devā́ akr̥ṇvann amŕ̥tasya nā́bhim
stanzas.translation: SOMA and Pûshan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven, You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

translations.griffith: SOMA and Pûshan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven, You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मौ दे॒वौ जाय॑मानौ जुषन्ते॒मौ तमां॑सि गूहता॒मजु॑ष्टा आ॒भ्यामिन्द्रः॑ प॒क्वमा॒मास्व॒न्तः सो॑मापू॒षभ्यां॑ जनदु॒स्रिया॑सु
stanzas.transliteration: imaú devaú jā́yamānau juṣanta- -imaú támāṃsi gūhatām ájuṣṭā ābhyā́m índraḥ pakvám āmā́sv antáḥ somāpūṣábhyāṃ janad usríyāsu
stanzas.translation: At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish. With these, with Soma and with Pûshan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.

translations.griffith: At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish. With these, with Soma and with Pûshan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोमा॑पूषणा॒ रज॑सो वि॒मानं॑ स॒प्तच॑क्रं॒ रथ॒मवि॑श्वमिन्वम् वि॒षू॒वृतं॒ मन॑सा यु॒ज्यमा॑नं॒ तं जि॑न्वथो वृषणा॒ पञ्च॑रश्मिम्
stanzas.transliteration: sómāpūṣaṇā rájaso vimā́naṃ saptácakraṃ rátham áviśvaminvam viṣūvŕ̥tam mánasā yujyámānaṃ táṃ jinvatho vr̥ṣaṇā páñcaraśmim
stanzas.translation: Soma and Pûshan, urge your chariot hither, the seven-wheeIed car that measures out the region, That stirs not all, that moves to every quarter, fivc-reined and harnessed by the thought, ye Mighty.

translations.griffith: Soma and Pûshan, urge your chariot hither, the seven-wheeIed car that measures out the region, That stirs not all, that moves to every quarter, fivc-reined and harnessed by the thought, ye Mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒व्य१॒॑न्यः सद॑नं च॒क्र उ॒च्चा पृ॑थि॒व्याम॒न्यो अध्य॒न्तरि॑क्षे ताव॒स्मभ्यं॑ पुरु॒वारं॑ पुरु॒क्षुं रा॒यस्पोषं॒ वि ष्य॑तां॒ नाभि॑म॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: divy ànyáḥ sádanaṃ cakrá uccā́ pr̥thivyā́m anyó ádhy antárikṣe tā́v asmábhyam puruvā́ram purukṣúṃ rāyás póṣaṃ ví ṣyatāṃ nā́bhim asmé
stanzas.translation: One in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling, on earth and in the firmament the other. May they disclose to us great store of treasure, much-longed for, rich in food, source of enjoyment.

translations.griffith: One in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling, on earth and in the firmament the other. May they disclose to us great store of treasure, much-longed for, rich in food, source of enjoyment.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑न्य॒न्यो भुव॑ना ज॒जान॒ विश्व॑म॒न्यो अ॑भि॒चक्षा॑ण एति सोमा॑पूषणा॒वव॑तं॒ धियं॑ मे यु॒वाभ्यां॒ विश्वाः॒ पृत॑ना जयेम
stanzas.transliteration: víśvāny anyó bhúvanā jajā́na víśvam anyó abhicákṣāṇa eti sómāpūṣaṇāv ávataṃ dhíyam me yuvā́bhyāṃ víśvāḥ pŕ̥tanā jayema
stanzas.translation: One of you Twain is Parent of all creatures, the otherjourneys onward all-beholding. Soma and Pûshan, aid my thought with favour: with you may we o'ercome in all encounters.

translations.griffith: One of you Twain is Parent of all creatures, the otherjourneys onward all-beholding. Soma and Pûshan, aid my thought with favour: with you may we o'ercome in all encounters.

stanzas.sanskrit: धियं॑ पू॒षा जि॑न्वतु विश्वमि॒न्वो र॒यिं सोमो॑ रयि॒पति॑र्दधातु अव॑तु दे॒व्यदि॑तिरन॒र्वा बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dhíyam pūṣā́ jinvatu viśvaminvó rayíṃ sómo rayipátir dadhātu ávatu devy áditir anarvā́ br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: May Pûshan stir our thought, the all-impelling, may Soma Lord of riches grant us riches. May Aditi the perfect Goddess aid us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: May Pûshan stir our thought, the all-impelling, may Soma Lord of riches grant us riches. May Aditi the perfect Goddess aid us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: वायो॒ ये ते॑ सह॒स्रिणो॒ रथा॑स॒स्तेभि॒रा ग॑हि नि॒युत्वा॒न्त्सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: vā́yo yé te sahasríṇo ráthāsas tébhir ā́ gahi niyútvān sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: O Vâyu, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine, Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: O Vâyu, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine, Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि॒युत्वा॑न्वाय॒वा ग॑ह्य॒यं शु॒क्रो अ॑यामि ते गन्ता॑सि सुन्व॒तो गृ॒हम्
stanzas.transliteration: niyútvān vāyav ā́ gahi- ayáṃ śukró ayāmi te gántāsi sunvató gr̥hám
stanzas.translation: Drawn by thy team, O Vâyu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure. Thou visitest the presser's house.

translations.griffith: Drawn by thy team, O Vâyu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure. Thou visitest the presser's house.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒क्रस्या॒द्य गवा॑शिर॒ इन्द्र॑वायू नि॒युत्व॑तः आ या॑तं॒ पिब॑तं नरा
stanzas.transliteration: śukrásyādyá gávāśiraḥ- índravāyū niyútvataḥ ā́ yātam píbataṃ narā
stanzas.translation: Indra and Vâyu, drawn by teams, ye Heroes, come today and drink. Of the bright juice when blent with milk.

translations.griffith: Indra and Vâyu, drawn by teams, ye Heroes, come today and drink. Of the bright juice when blent with milk.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं वां॑ मित्रावरुणा सु॒तः सोम॑ ऋतावृधा ममेदि॒ह श्रु॑तं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā sutáḥ sóma r̥tāvr̥dhā máméd ihá śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: This Soma hath been shed for you, Lawstrengtheners, Mitra-Varuṇa! Listen ye here to this my call.

translations.griffith: This Soma hath been shed for you, Lawstrengtheners, Mitra-Varuṇa! Listen ye here to this my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: राजा॑ना॒वन॑भिद्रुहा ध्रु॒वे सद॑स्युत्त॒मे स॒हस्र॑स्थूण आसाते
stanzas.transliteration: rā́jānāv ánabhidruhā dhruvé sádasy uttamé sahásrasthūṇa āsāte
stanzas.translation: Both Kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home, The thousand-pillared, firmly-based.

translations.griffith: Both Kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home, The thousand-pillared, firmly-based.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता स॒म्राजा॑ घृ॒तासु॑ती आदि॒त्या दानु॑न॒स्पती॑ सचे॑ते॒ अन॑वह्वरम्
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ samrā́jā ghr̥tā́sutī ādityā́ dā́nunas pátī sácete ánavahvaram
stanzas.translation: Fed with oblation, Sovran Kings, Âdityas, Lords of liberal gifts. They wait on him whose life is true.

translations.griffith: Fed with oblation, Sovran Kings, Âdityas, Lords of liberal gifts. They wait on him whose life is true.

stanzas.sanskrit: गोम॑दू॒ षु ना॑स॒त्याश्वा॑वद्यातमश्विना व॒र्ती रु॑द्रा नृ॒पाय्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: gómad ū ṣú nāsatyā- -áśvāvad yātam aśvinā vartī́ rudrā nr̥pā́yyam
stanzas.translation: With kine, Nâsatyas, and with steeds, come, Aṣvins, Rudras, to the house That will protect its heroes well;

translations.griffith: With kine, Nâsatyas, and with steeds, come, Aṣvins, Rudras, to the house That will protect its heroes well;

stanzas.sanskrit: न यत्परो॒ नान्त॑र आद॒धर्ष॑द्वृषण्वसू दुः॒शंसो॒ मर्त्यो॑ रि॒पुः
stanzas.transliteration: ná yát páro nā́ntaraḥ- ādadhárṣad vr̥ṣaṇvasū duḥśáṃso mártyo ripúḥ
stanzas.translation: Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm, Yea, no malicious mortal foe.

translations.griffith: Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm, Yea, no malicious mortal foe.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता न॒ आ वो॑ळ्हमश्विना र॒यिं पि॒शङ्ग॑संदृशम् धिष्ण्या॑ वरिवो॒विद॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ na ā́ voḷham aśvinā rayím piśáṅgasaṃdr̥śam dhíṣṇyā varivovídam
stanzas.translation: As such, O longed-far Aṣvins, lead us on to wealth of varied sort, Wealth that shall bring us room and rest.

translations.griffith: As such, O longed-far Aṣvins, lead us on to wealth of varied sort, Wealth that shall bring us room and rest.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॑ अ॒ङ्ग म॒हद्भ॒यम॒भी षदप॑ चुच्यवत् स हि स्थि॒रो विच॑र्षणिः
stanzas.transliteration: índro aṅgá mahád bhayám abhī́ ṣád ápa cucyavat sá hí sthiró vícarṣaṇiḥ
stanzas.translation: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth e'en mighty fear away, For firm is he and swift to act.

translations.griffith: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth e'en mighty fear away, For firm is he and swift to act.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑श्च मृ॒ळया॑ति नो॒ न नः॑ प॒श्चाद॒घं न॑शत् भ॒द्रं भ॑वाति नः पु॒रः
stanzas.transliteration: índraś ca mr̥ḷáyāti no ná naḥ paścā́d agháṃ naśat bhadrám bhavāti naḥ puráḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward, And good shall be before us still.

translations.griffith: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward, And good shall be before us still.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ आशा॑भ्य॒स्परि॒ सर्वा॑भ्यो॒ अभ॑यं करत् जेता॒ शत्रू॒न्विच॑र्षणिः
stanzas.transliteration: índra ā́śābhyas pári sárvābhyo ábhayaṃ karat jétā śátrūn vícarṣaṇiḥ
stanzas.translation: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security, The foe-subduer, swift to act.

translations.griffith: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security, The foe-subduer, swift to act.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ देवास॒ आ ग॑त शृणु॒ता म॑ इ॒मं हव॑म् एदं ब॒र्हिर्नि षी॑दत
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devāsa ā́ gata śr̥ṇutā́ ma imáṃ hávam édám barhír ní ṣīdata
stanzas.translation: O all ye Gods, come hitherward: hear this mine invocation, seat Yourselves upon this sacred grass.

translations.griffith: O all ye Gods, come hitherward: hear this mine invocation, seat Yourselves upon this sacred grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: ती॒व्रो वो॒ मधु॑माँ अ॒यं शु॒नहो॑त्रेषु मत्स॒रः ए॒तं पि॑बत॒ काम्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tīvró vo mádhumām̐ ayáṃ śunáhotreṣu matsaráḥ etám pibata kā́myam
stanzas.translation: Among the Ṣunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught. Drink ye of this delightsome juice.

translations.griffith: Among the Ṣunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught. Drink ye of this delightsome juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठा॒ मरु॑द्गणा॒ देवा॑सः॒ पूष॑रातयः विश्वे॒ मम॑ श्रुता॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índrajyeṣṭhā márudgaṇāḥ- dévāsaḥ pū́ṣarātayaḥ víśve máma śrutā hávam
stanzas.translation: Ye Martus led by Indra, Gods with Pri§an for your bounteousest, Hear all of you this call of mine.

translations.griffith: Ye Martus led by Indra, Gods with Pri§an for your bounteousest, Hear all of you this call of mine.

stanzas.sanskrit: अम्बि॑तमे॒ नदी॑तमे॒ देवि॑तमे॒ सर॑स्वति अ॒प्र॒श॒स्ता इ॑व स्मसि॒ प्रश॑स्तिमम्ब नस्कृधि
stanzas.transliteration: ámbitame nádītame dévitame sárasvati apraśastā́ iva smasi práśastim amba nas kr̥dhi
stanzas.translation: Best Mother, best of Rivers, best of Goddesses, Sarasvatî, We are, as 'twere, of no repute and dear Mother, give thou us renown.

translations.griffith: Best Mother, best of Rivers, best of Goddesses, Sarasvatî, We are, as 'twere, of no repute and dear Mother, give thou us renown.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे विश्वा॑ सरस्वति श्रि॒तायूं॑षि दे॒व्याम् शु॒नहो॑त्रेषु मत्स्व प्र॒जां दे॑वि दिदिड्ढि नः
stanzas.transliteration: tvé víśvā sarasvati śritā́yūṃṣi devyā́m śunáhotreṣu matsva prajā́ṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
stanzas.translation: In thee, Sarasvatî, divine, all generations have their stay. Be, glad with Ṣunahotra's sons: O Goddess grant us progeny.

translations.griffith: In thee, Sarasvatî, divine, all generations have their stay. Be, glad with Ṣunahotra's sons: O Goddess grant us progeny.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ सरस्वति जु॒षस्व॑ वाजिनीवति या ते॒ मन्म॑ गृत्सम॒दा ऋ॑तावरि प्रि॒या दे॒वेषु॒ जुह्व॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ bráhma sarasvati juṣásva vājinīvati yā́ te mánma gr̥tsamadā́ r̥tāvari priyā́ devéṣu júhvati
stanzas.translation: Enriched with sacrifice, accept Sarasvatî, these prayers of ours, Thoughts which Gr̥itsamadas beloved of Gods bring, Holy One,to thee.

translations.griffith: Enriched with sacrifice, accept Sarasvatî, these prayers of ours, Thoughts which Gr̥itsamadas beloved of Gods bring, Holy One,to thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रेतां॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ श॒म्भुवा॑ यु॒वामिदा वृ॑णीमहे अ॒ग्निं च॑ हव्य॒वाह॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: prétāṃ yajñásya śambhúvā yuvā́m íd ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe agníṃ ca havyavā́hanam
stanzas.translation: Ye who bless sacrifice, go forth, for verily we choose you both, And Agni who conveys our gifts.

translations.griffith: Ye who bless sacrifice, go forth, for verily we choose you both, And Agni who conveys our gifts.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यावा॑ नः पृथि॒वी इ॒मं सि॒ध्रम॒द्य दि॑वि॒स्पृश॑म् य॒ज्ञं दे॒वेषु॑ यच्छताम्
stanzas.transliteration: dyā́vā naḥ pr̥thivī́ imáṃ sidhrám adyá divispŕ̥śam yajñáṃ devéṣu yachatām
stanzas.translation: This our.effectual sacrifice, reaching the sky, shall Heaven and Earth Present unto the Gods to-day.

translations.griffith: This our.effectual sacrifice, reaching the sky, shall Heaven and Earth Present unto the Gods to-day.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वा॑मु॒पस्थ॑मद्रुहा दे॒वाः सी॑दन्तु य॒ज्ञियाः॑ इ॒हाद्य सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vām upástham adruhā devā́ḥ sīdantu yajñíyāḥ ihā́dyá sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: In both your laps, ye guileless Ones, the Holy Gods shall sit them down To-day to drink the Soma here.

translations.griffith: In both your laps, ye guileless Ones, the Holy Gods shall sit them down To-day to drink the Soma here.

stanzas.sanskrit: कनि॑क्रदज्ज॒नुषं॑ प्रब्रुवा॒ण इय॑र्ति॒ वाच॑मरि॒तेव॒ नाव॑म् सु॒म॒ङ्गल॑श्च शकुने॒ भवा॑सि॒ मा त्वा॒ का चि॑दभि॒भा विश्व्या॑ विदत्
stanzas.transliteration: kánikradaj janúṣam prabruvāṇáḥ- íyarti vā́cam aritéva nā́vam sumaṅgálaś ca śakune bhávāsi mā́ tvā kā́ cid abhibhā́ víśvyā vidat
stanzas.translation: TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman. O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.

translations.griffith: TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman. O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा त्वा॑ श्ये॒न उद्व॑धी॒न्मा सु॑प॒र्णो मा त्वा॑ विद॒दिषु॑मान्वी॒रो अस्ता॑ पित्र्या॒मनु॑ प्र॒दिशं॒ कनि॑क्रदत्सुम॒ङ्गलो॑ भद्रवा॒दी व॑दे॒ह
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ tvā śyená úd vadhīn mā́ suparṇó mā́ tvā vidad íṣumān vīró ástā pítryām ánu pradíśaṃ kánikradat sumaṅgálo bhadravādī́ vadehá
stanzas.translation: Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee. Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.

translations.griffith: Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee. Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑ क्रन्द दक्षिण॒तो गृ॒हाणां॑ सुम॒ङ्गलो॑ भद्रवा॒दी श॑कुन्ते मा नः॑ स्ते॒न ई॑शत॒ माघशं॑सो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áva kranda dakṣiṇató gr̥hā́ṇāṃ sumaṅgálo bhadravādī́ śakunte mā́ na stená īśata mā́gháśaṃso br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings, So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

translations.griffith: Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings, So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒द॒क्षि॒णिद॒भि गृ॑णन्ति का॒रवो॒ वयो॒ वद॑न्त ऋतु॒था श॒कुन्त॑यः उ॒भे वाचौ॑ वदति साम॒गा इ॑व गाय॒त्रं च॒ त्रैष्टु॑भं॒ चानु॑ राजति
stanzas.transliteration: pradakṣiṇíd abhí gr̥ṇanti kārávo váyo vádanta r̥tuthā́ śakúntayaḥ ubhé vā́cau vadati sāmagā́ iva gāyatráṃ ca traíṣṭubhaṃ cā́nu rājati
stanzas.translation: HERE on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise, even the winged birds that in due season speak. He, like: a Sâma-chanter utters both the notes, skilled in the mode of Trishṭup and of Gâyatrî.

translations.griffith: HERE on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise, even the winged birds that in due season speak. He, like: a Sâma-chanter utters both the notes, skilled in the mode of Trishṭup and of Gâyatrî.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒द्गा॒तेव॑ शकुने॒ साम॑ गायसि ब्रह्मपु॒त्र इ॑व॒ सव॑नेषु शंससि वृषे॑व वा॒जी शिशु॑मतीर॒पीत्या॑ स॒र्वतो॑ नः शकुने भ॒द्रमा व॑द वि॒श्वतो॑ नः शकुने॒ पुण्य॒मा व॑द
stanzas.transliteration: udgātéva śakune sā́ma gāyasi brahmaputrá iva sávaneṣu śaṃsasi vŕ̥ṣeva vājī́ śíśumatīr apī́tyā sarváto naḥ śakune bhadrám ā́ vada viśváto naḥ śakune púṇyam ā́ vada
stanzas.translation: Thou like the chanter-priest chantest the Sâma, Bird; thou singest at libations like a Brahman's son. Even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare, announce to us good forturue, Bird, on every side, proclaim in all directions happy luck, O Bird.

translations.griffith: Thou like the chanter-priest chantest the Sâma, Bird; thou singest at libations like a Brahman's son. Even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare, announce to us good forturue, Bird, on every side, proclaim in all directions happy luck, O Bird.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒वदँ॒स्त्वं श॑कुने भ॒द्रमा व॑द तू॒ष्णीमासी॑नः सुम॒तिं चि॑किद्धि नः यदु॒त्पत॒न्वद॑सि कर्क॒रिर्य॑था बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: āvádaṃs tváṃ śakune bhadrám ā́ vada tūṣṇī́m ā́sīnaḥ sumatíṃ cikiddhi naḥ yád utpátan vádasi karkarír yathā br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: When singing here, O Bird. announce good luck to us, and when thou sittest still think on us with kind thoughts. When flying off thou singest thou art like a lute. With brave sons in assembly may we speak aloud.

translations.griffith: When singing here, O Bird. announce good luck to us, and when thou sittest still think on us with kind thoughts. When flying off thou singest thou art like a lute. With brave sons in assembly may we speak aloud.
